{Reviewer: Sydney Giles
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Our 2 year old had a wonderful time playing here! It is much cleaner than the previous play space (Crayon Panda). There are many of the same toys/playsets but a brighter, cleaner feel plus some new fun toys. They also have added a gated area for 2 and under kiddos which is nice to keep them safe from bigger kids! The owners were very kind and made us feel welcomed.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Martissa Muwwakkil
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: Peachy Pals is such a fun and convenient spot for both kids and parents! It‚Äôs super cute and thoughtfully designed. The new owner is incredibly welcoming and has really created a warm, family-friendly atmosphere.
They have a balloon station with options for special occasions like Father‚Äôs Day (as of recent), birthdays, or just because‚Ä¶ Sometimes kids just love having a balloon! There‚Äôs also a large party room available, and they offer full decorations, so all you have to do is show up and let the kids play and celebrate.
The play area includes a separate space just for children under two, and there are tables and seating for parents to relax while keeping an eye on their little ones. Let me be sure to mention that there are snacks available for the kids, which, after all that running around, they definitely work up an appetite!

Just a heads up: the play area is shoeless, so make sure to bring clean socks for you and your children!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Jessica Holt
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: Absolutely LOVE this place! My little boys (almost 2 and 4) had the best time and didn‚Äôt want to leave! The play area is filled with a huge variety of toys and activities that kept them entertained the entire time. It‚Äôs clear that a lot of thought has gone into making the space both fun and safe for kids.

The new owners are fantastic ‚Äî warm, welcoming, and clearly passionate about creating a great experience for families. You can feel the positive energy the moment you walk in. The new flooring, fresh paint, balloon bar, and gate show that they have put their heart into making the space even better than it was before. It‚Äôs rare to find a play place that hits the mark for both kids and parents, but this one absolutely does. Highly recommend ‚Äî we can‚Äôt wait to come back!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Gina Lombardi

Reviewer: Brooke Comley
Rating: 5/5

Reviewer: Cesar Chavez
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: 5 stars ‚Äì A cozy, safe place for little ones to play

Peachy Pals, which used to be Crayon Panda, has definitely kept its heart through the changes‚Äîand in some ways, it‚Äôs even better now. One thing I really appreciate is the new area just for kids 2 and under. That wasn‚Äôt available before, and as a parent, it‚Äôs such a relief to have a space designed with the littlest ones in mind.

Compared to bigger spots like Jump World, where things can feel chaotic and a little risky, Peachy Pals feels calm, clean, and safe. You can actually breathe a little while your kids play. Whether you‚Äôre sitting back with a coffee or staying engaged alongside them, it‚Äôs easy to enjoy the time together.

I‚Äôd absolutely recommend it to any parent with young kids. It‚Äôs playful, well thought out, and a nice change of pace from the loud, overcrowded places. Peachy Pals is doing it right.

Reviewer: Tanya Roberts
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: I have not been to many indoor playgrounds, but I do return to this one often. They have equipment to entertane small babies to young teenagers. Kids can romp and play pretty freely without endangering each other. There is a Diner here within easy access of the play area. Food is at a typical expense. There is a reasonable selection of drinks, snacks and desserts.

I have had a few objections that they seem to be addressing, which is awesome. At this point, I am only concerned with one gate that the kids can easily get out of and it gets a little difficult to keep track of them when it get busy. There are play areas out of sight. Parents usually look out for each other's kids so I don't get too nervous about it. There are two separate entrances/exits. One stays locked and the other has an employee manning it the majority of the time. So I would say it is reasonably secure. But I would recommend that you keep a vigil just in case.

My three kids love it here and they range from 2 to 4 years of age. They have yet to get hurt here and they meet lots of other kids and get plenty of exercise.  They are usually worn out by the time they get in the car.

Check it out, it is worth the trip.

Review: I had my child‚Äôs birthday party here and although the kids all had fun there definitely some things that need to be worked on. Other than our ‚Äòparty host‚Äô the staff could not be bothered to do their jobs. I stood at the front for a solid 90 seconds before the two employees looked up from their phone and their knitting/yarn. Even at the cafe all 3 employees were sitting down faces glued to their phones/ipads attached to the wall by their power cords.
Also the bathrooms could definitely use some maintenance or TLC. For being a children‚Äôs place you‚Äôd think they‚Äôd have stools at the toilets to help the kids potty or more diaper changing areas. It would also help to have a few several air fresheners because they smelled terrible.
I see from other reviews others have made these exact same comments. So why not educate your staff on customer service and paying attention to the guests. I didn‚Äôt see a single staff member walking around cleaning or sanitizing a single thing the entire 4hrs I was there.

Review: We had such a fantastic time at DinoDash Indoor Playground! This place is an absolute gem for families with young kids. The facilities are super clean, safe, and well-maintained. My little one was absolutely thrilled by all the fun activities ‚Äì from the giant play structures to the interactive games.

What really stands out is how well-organized everything is. The staff are friendly, attentive, and always ready to help, making the experience stress-free for parents. There‚Äôs also a dedicated toddler area which was perfect for my younger child to safely explore while the older kids had fun in the larger play zones.

They offer plenty of seating for parents, free Wi-Fi, and even a small cafe for a quick snack or coffee while watching the kids play. It's clear that DinoDash really prioritizes both fun and safety, and it's a great place for kids to burn off energy in a safe, clean environment.

Highly recommend this place for any family looking for a fun and engaging indoor play space. We'll definitely be back!

Reviewer: Roi Ceren (ksamim)
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: We just celebrated our daughter‚Äôs fourth birthday at Funville Factory and it could not have been more perfect. From the moment we arrived, the owners were right there welcoming us and helping set everything up, making sure we had everything we needed. They even accommodated us with juice boxes, the cutest Super Kitties themed plates, and a pile of stickers that the kids went crazy over.

The place itself is a little smaller than some of the bigger indoor playgrounds, but honestly that was a huge plus. There was so much variety packed into the space with swings, slides, pretend houses, and climbing areas, and because it was cozy, it was easy to keep an eye on all the kids without feeling overwhelmed. The owners were constantly walking around, making sure everyone was happy and calmly stepping in if two kids looked like they might get into a squabble. It felt so safe and thoughtfully run.

The party room looked amazing when we walked in, like a mini Super Kitties world made just for our daughter. They paid attention to every little detail, making sure every child had a seat, plenty of juice, and a stack of stickers to take home. It made the whole party feel really special and personal.

Funville Factory is perfect for younger kids, especially around two to six years old. It seems like they do not really accept kids older than six, which honestly makes sense because the space is so perfectly tailored for the little ones. If you have a four-year-old like we do, this place feels like a dream.

What really stood out the most was how personally involved the owners were the entire time. They were not just running the place, they were making sure our daughter and all her friends were having the best time. We could not have asked for a better experience and we will definitely be back.

Reviewer: Audrey Fitzsimmons
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: We stumbled across Funville earlier this summer (thank you OTP Mama for the tip!) It quickly became a favorite play spot for our toddler and was a life savor for us on those grueling hot summer days.

The place is AMAZING - with all sorts of toys/sensory exploration/playground fun you need to keep a toddler (or crew of toddlers!) entertained for hours on end. They also offer various packages - that you can take advantage of through their membership OR NOT. (I personally appreciate that flexibility in a membership/subscription dominant world) Of course they have birthday party packages, and we just hosted our son‚Äôs 2nd birthday party there.

I wasn‚Äôt exactly sure what to expect - but it was an amazing day that went off without a hitch. The owner, Jen, went above and beyond with the decorations. All I had to do was share the number of attendees and theme, and she took care of the rest (‚Ä¶and had it decorated better than I ever could have!!) Jen‚Äôs professionalism - which permeates through her entire staff - is top notch and the Funville team‚Äôs customer service makes party day enjoyable for everyone (parents too!). The pizza that‚Äôs included as part of the birthday package is delicious - and also happens to be right next store, in case you need to add on any last minute additions. (Have I mentioned the convenience of this experience??) My husband and I were carefree from start to finish and it really changed the entire day for us - it was totally worth it. They also took care of the gift bags AND had a special gift for the birthday boy.

THANK YOU Jen and the Funville Factory team for making this such a wonderful day - and planning experience - for my family! I absolutely recommend this place for anyone with kiddos (toddlers are the sweet spot, but I feel like kids up to 7 or 8 would also have a ball). And if you‚Äôre looking for a fun space for your next event, and a professional/customer-focused staff to help you execute, you‚Äôve found your spot!

Review: Funville was the perfect place to celebrate my daughter‚Äôs 3rd birthday. I purchased the private event package, and the place was closed to the public for a couple of hours. My daughter could enjoy the place comfortably with her friends, and I could relax and enjoy talking to my family and friends without worrying about cleaning, serving food, or setting up the decorations. The staff did a wonderful job with the decorations and setting up the tables. My daughter wanted a Minnie Mouse-themed birthday, so the staff decorated the party room according to that theme and even had Minnie Mouse plates and utensils for the cake. They also provided goodie bags for all my daughter‚Äôs friends. My friend told me how much her two kids loved what was in the good bags. My daughter also received a Funville T-shirt, a Mickey Mouse puzzle, and a lollipop.

Also, the package includes Napoli pizzas (the pizza place is next to Funville) for your guests. This was the first time I had Napoli pizza, and I fell in love with its fresh ingredients and overall flavor! Most of my guests had their pizza for the first time and are planning a separate trip to Funville and Napoli Pizza.

Another reason to have your toddler celebrate their birthday at Funville is that parents do not have to chase after their toddler. This is because Funville is a small space, but it is packed with interactive and fun activities that will keep them occupied. It is also clean and well-maintained thanks to the staff who ensure everything is in order. I could catch up on conversations with parents and enjoy myself while knowing my daughter is playing safely with other kids.

I highly recommend this event space! Thanks, Funville!

Reviewer: Valerie B
Rating: 2/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: Hi Valerie,

Thank you for your feedback. We apologize if our pricing felt too high for you.

Here‚Äôs a breakdown of our pricing:

	‚Ä¢	$1 for adults: We strive to keep our prices affordable. Many indoor playgrounds charge around $4.99 for adults, or even the same amount as for children. For comparison, our family recently visited the Peppa Pig Theme Park, which charged $70 for adults despite there being no rides for adults. (It was super fun to watch our kids having a BLAST!)
	‚Ä¢	$4 for children 8 months and younger: But they play for FREE WITH A PAYING SIBLING!
	‚Ä¢	$10 for children aged 9 to 21 months: Our playground is specially designed for this age group, with plenty of toys and activities tailored to their needs.
	‚Ä¢	$16 for children aged 22 months and up: We carefully researched our pricing and can assure you that our prices are among the most competitive in Georgia.

Regarding cleanliness, I can assure you that we take this very seriously. We clean and disinfect regularly throughout the day, even if it may not always be visible. We understand that while you‚Äôre focused on watching your child, it might be easy to miss our team in action. Additionally, we don‚Äôt mop the floors during business hours to avoid soaking your socks or causing slips and falls, which is why we require socks to be worn. We are also moving our shoe rack outside the entrance to help keep socks clean and ensure a better experience for everyone.

We appreciate your input and hope to welcome you back soon.

Best regards,
Jen}

Reviewer: Ashley Brooks
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: In response to Curt Digla & Nordrissa Lewis:
I completely disagree with this review, as my experiences at this venue have always and consistently been the complete opposite. It‚Äôs clear that the reviewer had a frustrating visit, but many of their complaints seem exaggerated or based on misunderstandings.
First, calling this place a "glorified daycare" is unfair. It‚Äôs an indoor entertainment space designed for kids to have fun in a safe and engaging environment. The bounce houses, attractions, and activities are exactly what one would expect from a family-friendly venue.
It makes perfect business sense for certain attractions to be available only on specific days to encourage visits during slower periods (i.e. Wednesday)‚Äîthis is a common business strategy, not an attempt to deceive customers.
Regarding pricing, hosting a party at any entertainment venue comes with costs, and $416 for a birthday party that includes a dedicated space, play areas, and food is actually quite reasonable compared to similar venues. Pizza and Capri Suns are standard party offerings, and expecting gourmet options at this price point is unrealistic.
As for the cake, I don‚Äôt know of a single venue that includes cakes as part of the package‚Äîoutside cakes are clearly allowed, so all it takes is asking. However, last-minute issues can happen anywhere, and instead of escalating frustration, a simple check with staff could have clarified the situation.
The owners and their family members are PHENOMENAL, and their staff is professional. If a child was asked to remove a wristband, I have no doubt it was handled appropriately. The accusation of racial favoritism is not only unfair but also unfounded‚ÄîTHIS BUSINESS DOES NOT OPERATE ON RACIAL BIAS.
Additionally, the claim that the venue fabricates positive reviews is simply false.
Comparing this experience to renting a bounce house at home completely ignores the fact that not everyone has the space, time, or desire to host a party themselves. Many parents appreciate the convenience of an all-in-one venue where they don‚Äôt have to worry about setup, cleanup, or keeping kids entertained.
This review is overly negative and fails to recognize the value this venue provides. My personal experience, as well as that of many others, has been overwhelmingly positive.
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS VENUE TO PARENTS‚ÄîIT IS ONE OF THE CLEANEST, FRIENDLIEST INDOOR PLAY AREAS WE HAVE EVER TAKEN OUR LITTLE ONE TO. WE WILL BE BACK AGAIN AND AGAIN!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Niki Smith
Rating: 5/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: I was searching for an indoor playroom in my area to take my nearly 20-month-old granddaughter and found Eve's Garden at the last minute when I had almost given up. I wasn't in the mood for the chaos of a trampoline park, but with the extreme heat, I knew we wanted to be indoors. From the moment we walked in, I was impressed by the safe, clean and fun environment. My granddaughter had an absolute blast, and to my surprise, my 11-year-old son enjoyed himself as well. They had air hockey, basketball, jumbo connect 4, an inflatable obstacle course, an interactive sand room and an interactive ball game room with a projector for him.

The variety of activities available kept both children entertained and busy. It took my granddaughter a little while to acclimate, but in no time, she was running around, laughing and playing! For this outing, I was specifically looking for a toddler-friendly space, ensuring she could have fun without the risk of being trampled by bigger kids. Eve's Garden perfectly fit the bill, and it was an added bonus that my son also had a great time. The music was amazing, and although we didn't partake because we had just eaten, I saw that they had a variety of snacks and drinks for purchase.

I've already recommended Eve's Garden to a dozen friends and family and can't wait to visit again when my granddaughter is back in town. The experience, staff, cleanliness and overall atmosphere were all top-notch. 10 out of 10!

Reviewer: Ashley Brooks
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: In response to Curt Digla & Nordrissa Lewis:
I completely disagree with this review, as my experiences at this venue have always and consistently been the complete opposite. It‚Äôs clear that the reviewer had a frustrating visit, but many of their complaints seem exaggerated or based on misunderstandings.
First, calling this place a "glorified daycare" is unfair. It‚Äôs an indoor entertainment space designed for kids to have fun in a safe and engaging environment. The bounce houses, attractions, and activities are exactly what one would expect from a family-friendly venue.
It makes perfect business sense for certain attractions to be available only on specific days to encourage visits during slower periods (i.e. Wednesday)‚Äîthis is a common business strategy, not an attempt to deceive customers.
Regarding pricing, hosting a party at any entertainment venue comes with costs, and $416 for a birthday party that includes a dedicated space, play areas, and food is actually quite reasonable compared to similar venues. Pizza and Capri Suns are standard party offerings, and expecting gourmet options at this price point is unrealistic.
As for the cake, I don‚Äôt know of a single venue that includes cakes as part of the package‚Äîoutside cakes are clearly allowed, so all it takes is asking. However, last-minute issues can happen anywhere, and instead of escalating frustration, a simple check with staff could have clarified the situation.
The owners and their family members are PHENOMENAL, and their staff is professional. If a child was asked to remove a wristband, I have no doubt it was handled appropriately. The accusation of racial favoritism is not only unfair but also unfounded‚ÄîTHIS BUSINESS DOES NOT OPERATE ON RACIAL BIAS.
Additionally, the claim that the venue fabricates positive reviews is simply false.
Comparing this experience to renting a bounce house at home completely ignores the fact that not everyone has the space, time, or desire to host a party themselves. Many parents appreciate the convenience of an all-in-one venue where they don‚Äôt have to worry about setup, cleanup, or keeping kids entertained.
This review is overly negative and fails to recognize the value this venue provides. My personal experience, as well as that of many others, has been overwhelmingly positive.
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS VENUE TO PARENTS‚ÄîIT IS ONE OF THE CLEANEST, FRIENDLIEST INDOOR PLAY AREAS WE HAVE EVER TAKEN OUR LITTLE ONE TO. WE WILL BE BACK AGAIN AND AGAIN!

Reviewer: Niki Smith
Rating: 5/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: I was searching for an indoor playroom in my area to take my nearly 20-month-old granddaughter and found Eve's Garden at the last minute when I had almost given up. I wasn't in the mood for the chaos of a trampoline park, but with the extreme heat, I knew we wanted to be indoors. From the moment we walked in, I was impressed by the safe, clean and fun environment. My granddaughter had an absolute blast, and to my surprise, my 11-year-old son enjoyed himself as well. They had air hockey, basketball, jumbo connect 4, an inflatable obstacle course, an interactive sand room and an interactive ball game room with a projector for him.

The variety of activities available kept both children entertained and busy. It took my granddaughter a little while to acclimate, but in no time, she was running around, laughing and playing! For this outing, I was specifically looking for a toddler-friendly space, ensuring she could have fun without the risk of being trampled by bigger kids. Eve's Garden perfectly fit the bill, and it was an added bonus that my son also had a great time. The music was amazing, and although we didn't partake because we had just eaten, I saw that they had a variety of snacks and drinks for purchase.

I've already recommended Eve's Garden to a dozen friends and family and can't wait to visit again when my granddaughter is back in town. The experience, staff, cleanliness and overall atmosphere were all top-notch. 10 out of 10!

I appreciate that it wasn‚Äôt super loud and chaotic like other indoor play grounds. We‚Äôll be coming back especially during the too-hot to play outside summer days.

Review: We had our daughter‚Äôs second birthday party here the other weekend and it went so amazing. Everyone was so helpful, kind and eager to assist or make things easier for us. I really couldn‚Äôt say enough great things about the establishment and the family who runs it.
The thing that drew me in to this facility is how it is someplace safer and more aimed to the younger kids. Taking my toddler to a big name jump place is absolutely out of the question. They‚Äôd get trampled before getting completely through the door. At Eve‚Äôs garden, I know she‚Äôs able to run and jump and play- just living her best life and I don‚Äôt have to be in constant fear she‚Äôs going to get ran over by a big kid.
Don‚Äôt get me wrong, they have things aimed for the older kids, it‚Äôs not just for toddlers. My 8 year old daughter and 9 year old niece had a blast there as well! There‚Äôs a really cool obstacle course kinda thing that they had a great time with. There‚Äôs an interactive sand table that‚Äôs one of the coolest things I‚Äôve seen for kids in a long time. Ok maybe not just for kids cause I did play with it too lol and there‚Äôs an air hockey table that took me back to my childhood daycare days.
Overall, this place is great. The staff is great. The environment is great. We will definitely be back to Eve‚Äôs garden indoor playground!!!
Thank you all again so much for helping us with our party. Top tier. 10/10 very much recommend!!!

Review: Heard about this place on a  Facebook group. I tried to take my daughter to this location earlier this week. Unfortunately, when we got there, which took a while because it is kind of off the beaten path in McDonough, I wasn‚Äôt very impressed with the outside of the building. It looks like an old, run-down industrial building with a hemp store right next to it (really?) There were no cars in the front, no real signage (a taped piece of printing paper with directions to a side door ), and no curtains open to the windows so that you could at least see into the place. I  called a couple of times To see if someone was inside, but the phone kept going to voicemail (at like 11 AM) I drove around to this mysterious door and did not feel comfortable taking my daughter in so I didn‚Äôt. IMO, this is not a professional place where you take your child. I didn‚Äôt feel comfortable, Didn‚Äôt like the location, and wasn‚Äôt a fan of the non-responsiveness. There were also zero cars outside, which made me think the place wasn‚Äôt even open despite their hours being listed as open from 8 to 4. I got excited about having this kind of facility, but I realize this is not what I‚Äôm looking for. I won‚Äôt be back and won‚Äôt recommend it. Hopefully, we get an actual playroom in the area sometime in the future. Until then, go North. Don't waste your time here.

Reviewer: madison cheeves
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: ‚≠ê 1 out of 5 stars

We visited this indoor playground recently, and unfortunately, it was a very disappointing and concerning experience. The facility was noticeably dirty ‚Äî floors, equipment, and play areas all felt poorly maintained. To make matters worse, staff were mostly standing around, not engaging with kids or actively monitoring the space.

A major red flag: we found a vape on the ground inside the children‚Äôs play area. This is completely unacceptable in a space meant to be safe for young kids.

But the most upsetting part is that a few days after our visit, my daughter developed hand, foot, and mouth disease. She‚Äôs not in daycare and hasn‚Äôt been around any other children recently, so we‚Äôre confident this is where it came from. Illnesses happen, but in this case, it really feels like a direct result of a lack of proper sanitation and oversight.

This place has potential, but until they make serious improvements to cleanliness and safety standards ‚Äî and actually supervise the space ‚Äî we won‚Äôt be back.

Reviewer: Oresha Peete
Rating: 3/5
Time: Edited 3 weeks ago
Review: A great place for all ages. We celebrated my daughter's birthday who turned one year old. While I appreciate the inclusions for the birthday party package ( drinks, fruit snack, bring your own food, 3 hr party, etc) I have some feedback/concerns:
1. Each child at the party is given "flames" for games and ride but they put EVERYONE'S flames on one card. A savings for the company but an inconvenience for the host and guest.
2. "Unlimited" drinks are 2 liters but they provide small cups. So bring your own. Another savings for the company but an inconvenience for the host and guest. Individual cans/bottles would be preferred. Especially for the water, instead of 1 gal bottle.
3.  Several older kids kept coming into the toddler area. They were fully staffed, most of them positioned behind the counter. Only one birthday party in session (mine) but no employees even attempted to regulate the toddler area.
4. I booked the morning party time (10:30am) with hopes to have first access to a clean toddler area. It was very noticeable that the surfaces/floor was not clean. Therefore in my opinion the cleanliness of the ball pit is questionable. I would have rated this place at least a 4 but had to deduct another star due to cleanliness. Cleanliness and safety should be their priority especially if they are providing a service for children.

However, the staff was friendly. Music selection was enjoyable. Thank you Bryant and Christie. They let me use an extra table for my party. Bryant was always checking on us.

Reviewer: Mariel
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: It was fun until I broke my back!
I had fun at this park until I fractured two vertebrae of my spine! Long story short, there was an (unguarded, uncovered) foam pit which I jumped into in the dark, naturally, thinking it was safe. As I was in the air I realized there was NO foam in the pit and the ground was concrete. Between the height of my jump and my fall, I probably fell a total of 12-15 feet (the pit was seven feet deep‚Ä¶ I measured later on.) I am only alive by the grace of God alone. I could have died.
After the injury, an employee stuck her head over the edge of the pit and asked if I was ok. I could barely speak. I couldn‚Äôt move. She offered me her hand and attempted (unsuccessfully) to pull me out. (Back injury 101‚Ä¶ NEVER move the person.)
When I finally got out, the employee kind of just walked away and nobody at the park followed up, gave me ice packs,or called 911. My friends took me to the hospital.
The result of my injury was two fractured vertibre, eight weeks in a back brace, three rounds of physical therapy, and almost complete immobility for the first few weeks of the injury. It was the worst experimence of my life.
I came to the park with friends a week or two after the incident to see the scene of the crime, measure the pit (why not) and see if it was filled. It was still empty!! There was a girl guarding it who told me just that day, a little boy got back there and she had to rush to get him out of the area before he fell!
I recognize that this story is comedic. I mean who falls into a pit? But I just wanted to warn everyone about this place. It‚Äôs unsafe, the staff is not trained in injury prevention or recovery, and when I contacted the owners later on, they gaslit me and said it was MY fault. They said the had a video of a staff member telling me not to jump and me doing it anyway (funny, I don‚Äôt remember that happening. Why would I PURPOSELY jump into a pit). Don‚Äôt worry! They said no I could NOT see the video, hmmm. They also refused to help me with medical bills.
It should NEVER be possible for someone to fall in a seven foot deep pit with a concrete bottom.
If you or your kids go here, please be VERY careful.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Peter Ton
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: Go if you like spinal compression fractures:

Went here on Jan. 28, 2022 with a group of friends. I had a blast until one of them literally broke her back. Near the end of the night one of the members of my party accidentally bounced into an area of the park that was undergoing maintenance. It was a 7 foot concrete pit! Mind you she was jumping on a trampoline, so she didn‚Äôt fall from ground level, she fell from several feet ABOVE ground level. To be fair, there was a small plastic chain over the entrance, but my friend easily cleared this when she was double bounced in that direction. We‚Äôre estimating that she fell a distance of at least 12 vertical feet in total.

As a result, she suffered a spinal compression fracture that left her in a back brace for 8 weeks. When the injury occurred none of the teenage staff knew what to do, so thank goodness she had friends there who could take her to the emergency room. Not before a well-meaning employee offered my friend her hand and attempted to help her up, however. Word to the wise, if you‚Äôve suffered a spinal compression fracture DO NOT MOVE, it‚Äôll make things worse. In hindsight we should have called 911 and waited for the professionals to put her on a stretcher, but neither we nor the staff knew that at the time.

I wish I was making this up, but my friend is now half an inch shorter and very familiar with her local physical therapy center.

In the interest of fairness, nobody wanted my friend to fall into a 7 foot concrete pit. It even had a little chain and sign. I would argue however, that at a trampoline park, it shouldn‚Äôt be possible to do so. Laws of entropy kind of dictate that masses of bouncing people will eventually land in untended places. I shouldn‚Äôt have to spell out the need for safety nets or protective barriers to the owners of a trampoline park‚Ä¶

Aren‚Äôt there building codes for this kind of thing? Thankfully the victim this time was a 21 year old with fully developed bones. I shudder to think of the consequences if a child had fallen that distance.

Edit: the first picture shows my friend standing in front of the pit a week after the incident. The 7 foot drop had been covered with a red tarp. Notice how dark the area is? The second photo is a clearer view of the pit, and my friend‚Äôs back brace!

Reviewer: Luanne Pettit
Rating: 1/5
Time: a week ago
Review: The only reason I even gave one star is because the place seemed pretty clean. My son booked his daughter's birthday party here, and we will never book here again.  When you pay over $300 for 2 pizzas and water, a host, 2 hours of room time, and unlimited play, you expect to get what you pay for.  It is overpriced, you don't get what you pay for, and the employees dont seem to want to be there. First off, when we arrived, they changed the price that was quoted to him, and he was charged more than what was agreed upon. The employee didn't seem to care and didn't really try to explain the discrepancy.   The tv they have with advertisements shows that first responders get free admission. When she was asked about it, she just said no, it's 10% off. No explanation. When questioned about what it said on the screen, it seemed to make her mad that she had to go clarify with someone else. Very poor customer service. There was supposed to be a host for the party, but we only saw her once when the pizzas were brought out. (The same person that checked us in) The playtime is supposed to be "all day" and "unlimited", but when they arrived an hour early as was stated that they were supposed to do, only to be turned away and told to come back 15 minutes prior. The party was at 4 pm. The so-called unlimited play is definitely not unlimited. They only had 3 people on staff that we could see. That is ridiculous for a place that big, with parties scheduled. There's no wonder that the party "host" only showed once. The 2 hours of private room time is cut short, too, because they want you out 15 minutes prior to clean up. I understand that, but when you do follow the rules, then it's at least another 30 minutes before they come to clean the room. Why were you told to leave? The party next to ours had the same time frame and were still in the room another hour after their set time and were never bothered. Had we known that we would have stayed. Overall, this place is just a huge letdown. Next time, we will book at Chuck E Cheese. You at least know what you are getting there. And they have gluten-free options, too.

Reviewer: goldie lane
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: Last weekend 4/27/2025, my daughter had her 6th birthday party here.  We arrived 30 mins prior, signed the paperwork and paid the remaining balance.  The young lady who checked us in was great.  She told us that our room wasn't ready but she was gonna go clean it and then we could set up. That process was smooth . Things went downhill from there.  Upon arrival in the room,  we noticed that it was super hot so we opened the door to let some air in. The temperature never really got better, so i found the young lady and asked her if the air was working she said that maintenance had been by and said they fixed it.  As my guests began arriving,  it got worse.  It was so bad,  we had to share the portable fans and few guests brought.  I constantly asked the staff to turn on the A.c. with the same response as before.  So we move on to the pizza.  I ordered an extra pizza for the parents and when the 2 bday pizzas and extra ones came out. 2 of them were burnt. We had to send them back, with hungry kids asking for more pizza. I also ordered pitchers of fountain drinks.  They were out of everything I asked for, except sprite. Not only were they out,  I had to go and pick up the pitchers myself.  I also had to serve the pizzas,  cake and clean up after the kids ate the pizza in order to make space for them to have desserts. We looked around for staff to assist us with the party,  but the 3 of them were stretched so thin we could never track them down.  This was the worst party I've ever paid for.  From extreme heat to the burnt pizza, no staff to assist.  It was just terrible. No one offered any alternatives, no assistance,  nothing.  Since that day,  I called the customer service line a few times and have heard nothing back. Customer service is lacking, besides for the young lady who checked us in.  If y'all are going to charge so much money for a party,  you all need to have the resources to accommodate each party.  When we book these parties,  we book them with the understanding that we are gonna get what we're paying for,  ie; un burnt pizza, fountain drinks that are listed, assistance during the party, air conditioned rooms that seats several people etc. I will never book with you all Again and I'll make sure my loved ones do not either. Just terrible.....

-----------------------

Reviewer: Patricia Mauragas
Rating: 2/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: Booked a party here. If I had just brought my kid here to have fun on a Saturday morning, I‚Äôd leave a 5 star review.

The pros:
The play place is VERY clean. The tunnels and slides seem well attended to. Over all the facilities are great.

The cons:

-after paying for a party package, paying for extra people on top of the party package, and paying for food- we were informed that no outside food is allowed. No veggie trays, no fruit, no drinks. It was over $80 for 12 juice boxes, they do not offer any semblance of fruit, veg or fiber. If this was offered, I would understand no outside food- but the fact is, their soda machine was down and all they have is pizza that isn‚Äôt even little ceasar quality and candy bars. If you don‚Äôt offer it and people have booked a party with you, the fair thing is to allow them to bring it.

- the place is not equipped with an intercom of any kind, so you cut your kids loose to go play- pizza comes, you want to get all those kids back in that room? Good luck - they‚Äôre in the tunnel maze.

- they started prompting us out of the room by 1:00. Our party was 11:30-1:30. If we only get 15 minutes to set up, don‚Äôt rush us out without offering help. It‚Äôs rude.

- customer service was non existent, no one offered to help us clean, they seemed inconvenienced that we had left shoes in the room.

- no one wished my child happy birthday.

Lame.

Reviewer: Lorisa Pineda
Rating: 3/5

Review: This place is an absolute madhouse we left after 23 minutes. The person at the front desk will tell every single parent if they need to keep their child out of the baby area and the parents never follow through. Once you‚Äôre on the other side of the gate the rules are not reinforced. There is no staff member directing or supervising in the actual play area. You have bigger kids trampling the toddlers, pushing, shoving while parents sit on their phones and the owner ignores. They are supposed to have a sick policy but they back down once the parents offer up any excuse. It really needs to be that if you cannot follow the rules and keep your 4-5 year old child from stomping through the designated baby area then you get kicked out. The toys do not have batteries in them and it is not just the ‚Äúfloor toys are addressed in a previous review, it‚Äôs also the hanging alphabet mat in the sensory room with no batteries and an exposed/open battery housing which is a hazard and against state regulations. Also loose and missing screws in the play kitchen in the back hallway. There are pieces of the floor that are loose and coming up‚Ä¶again a state regulation violation. As a pediatric nurse this set up and poor management is a recipe for a serious injury. We will not be back and I do not recommend to fellow LV parents that value their children‚Äôs safety.

Reviewer: Daniel Ajero
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: Ohana Wonder Town Playground South Mall has been nothing but an amazing place for all little children. The owner and their staff are mindful, selfless, and caring for all the children and even to parents as well.

The staff team does their best to meet every parents needs from signing a waiver or reminding you about a payment needs to happen or even looking out for your child whenever you got a little busy for a second. They are lenient and making sure the enjoyment of your kids comes first and also from needing a beverage or a snack to always able to help out.

My two boys truly enjoy going to this location. Its a perfect place for them to play, have a ton of fun, and meet new friends. They are always excited meeting new friends and become friends for along time.

Their arts and craft in the back room is truly great. They have cool stuff that goes along even with the holiday seasons. They have this interactive monitor that is really cool. Every kid loves playing with it.

They try to change stuff and upgrade throughout the season. They are a very, very clean place also.

I recommend having the monthly subscription because it is worth every penny especially if you come more than 5x a month.

I always recommend this place to all the parents with little kids! There isn't much of a place like this in Lehigh Valley! And they are opening second building in the Easton, Palmer Mall Soon. So your monthly membership is eligible for Allentown and Easton location! What an awesome thing!

If i could give them a 10 out 5, i would totally do so!!!

Reviewer: Brandon Miller
Rating: 1/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I am writing on behalf of my wife Rebecca, who previously left a review.

As she mentioned, the kids had fun and enjoyed the facility.

Speaking as a parent trying to celebrate his 2 year old's birthday and host a party for friends and family, this establishment did nothing but stress us out.

We showed up 15 minutes before the party to setup. We walked in with supplies and 2 children in hand. The worker at the front desk was adamant about us paying up front, while we're trying to set stuff down and situate ourselves. My wife expressed her anxiety, and the worker showed no empathy. No reassurance, just demanding a credit card to pay for the party.

Here we are now as 2 parents, trying to bring supplies in, and still manage to watch our kids. I get that it is a no shoes facility, but trying to run supplies from the parking lot, through the mall, needing to take shoes off, run supplies back to the back room, to put shoes back on, to go back to the parking lot...this is beyond frustrating. It is utterly ridiculous that Ohana does not have a supplies cart to assist families with setting up a party. We did not "bring our whole house" for a party. We had 2 boxes of supplies, a balloon banner, a food tray, juice boxes, and a case of water. This could have been a single trip if Ohana actually had a means of transport. If the cart was stolen by a previous customer, that's not my problem. Figure out a better way to keep track of your company property.

The waiver system on the computer is absolutely a breach of customer confidentiality. I should not be able to start typing and see every previous customers sensitive information.

The same worker came in our party room at 11:55 and asked us to start cleaning up. We didn't even get the full 2 hours to enjoy the party. We were rushed out of the room to clean up for a party at 2. 2 hours needed to clean up the room? This is again extremely inconvenient for your morning party.

Leaving the party, we had to rely on the generosity of our family members to carry everything back out, along with the gifts that were brought for the birthday girl. Trays of hot food, heavy cases of water...the only way out of the facility is the same walkway you came in. Only now you have to fight through a crowd of parents and kids, and oh yeah, put your shoes back on amongst the crowd of parents trying to come in.

Overall, the organization of this place is an absolute joke. We were told we would be contacted with instructions a couple days before the party. WE NEVER RECEIVED A CALL! The worker had a bad attitude and was extremely unhelpful to us. The lack of transportation for supplies, and separate traffic path is inconvenient.

I urge the public to look elsewhere for your party needs. A party at this place is not worth the effort.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Rebecca Miller
Rating: 1/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: This review was based on a one-time experience.  We hosted our 2-year old's birthday party here recently.  From a child's perspective, this was great!  Clean, space to play, the kids had such a fun time.

From an adult perspective... I am so disappointed.

When finalizing plans for the party.  I was told the staff would help with setup and break down of the party.  I was even told I would have to do "little to nothing" for clean up at the end.  I was given 15 minutes prior to the party to set up all of my belongings - decorations, food, and simply transporting the the supplies in from the parking lot, through the mall.  They had 1 staff member to "help" set up and move supplies to the back room.  Instead of immediately getting to work, she insisted I sign waivers and pay...  My hands were full with boxes, since my priority was elsewhere.  When asked if they had a trolley of sorts.  They said another family stole it so now we are out of luck... ok?

The set up was fine, but no overly accommodating.  The "helping" staffer didn't have any tape or other materials to assist.  So, I'm glad I brought my own.

My family started to arrive, and was asked to sign waivers and take off their shoes.  My family asked to bring their shoes and personal belongs to the back room since the shoe cubbies were just open racks.  They were told no, the shoes have to stay facing the open public mall.  They were asked to sign waivers -  My family said "no".  This created contention. Upon further investigation.  One could see that the waiver programming is faulty.  Guests could simply look up guest's sensitive information due to predictive typing.  This made my friends and family uncomfortable.  When brought up, it was brushed off as a "cute mistake".

Party persists, we are guaranteed 1-hour of uninterrupted time because the establishment doesn't open until 11 am and our party starts at 10 am.  The 1 staff member complains and says the other worker read the schedule wrong and has yet to show up and help her... ok?  The 1 staffer allows people of the public to checking in around 10:50 am and they are in our party space before 11 am.  A bit upsetting since we paid to have the space until opening.  Ironically, the first non-party child hit the birthday girl upon entrance.  So, that's cool.

Finally we move to the back room for our 30-45 minutes of cake and food.  We eat in our tiny room and sing "Happy Birthday"  The staffers comes up at 11:55 am and starts telling people it's that time to leave.  We are already cleaning tables and taking down decorations.  She told me there was another party coming up.  I said, "That party starts at 2:00pm, we will be out very soon."  She starts taking down decorations around the guests.  I said, "Hey we aren't going to keep the balloon arch, you can pop it.  We do not want to put it back in our car."  She said, "We don't have space to store balloon arches." I replied "Right, so pop it, we do NOT want it."   This turned into a fight.  She explained the balloon is my possession and my responsibility.  I explain, it is trash and can be treated as "helping clean up" to get rid of it.  She said is she said, "If I cleaned up every balloon arch, I would be popping balloons for hours."  I said FINE.  I started popping all the balloons in front of her.  She rolled her eyes and ran for the door and said, "You could at least close the door" maybe to not scare the other 25 children playing who were trying to get free food from our party?  Well, this could have been remedied by the staff popping the balloons themselves.  Alas.

Overall, I wish the staff kept their promises of time-frames, setup and break down, and just treated myself and family like we mattered for 2 hours.

Reviewer: Chelsea Wooten
Rating: 4/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: The hive is very neat! This small town needed this after Polk county remolded the outdoor playgrounds. This is going to be a popular place on hot, rainy and cold days! This is a great indoor playground and has many sensory play area for little ones, plus a under 3 baby/toddler zone. They even have a semi private area that can be rented for parties. My 11 month old and 6 year each had there only spaces and had fun for hours. I also appreciate nit having to worry about big kids/teenagers running around and nocking into my child which is sometimes you find at parks and some of the larger indoor playground, jumping gyms.

There is different lanes for sensory and imagination play. Each of the 4 lanes are themed, under the sea, construction zone, outdoor/picnic, and house/doll. The only call out is we noticed the bottom baseboard in the lanes had a rough texture, so if not careful, could get a splinter. All the other boards in the place were smooth and laquered.

Something to note, we hadn't been before they moved the baby zone but talking to some parents, they voiced they didn't like how small it is now. The baby zone used to be where the party area is now. Parents were saying there was more room for them to run around and spread out. On the other hand I could understand the need for larger party area to accommodate larger parties. I didn't mind the baby area and we there on Sunday afternoon after the church crowd. The only thing I didn't like was the net gate used to act as a baby safety gate. Toddlers were climbing over it, under it and around it where it's only attached and hooked at the bottom. Looks broke. Would like to see a solid 3' wall with a swinging gate like at the entrance of the place.

There are a few adult games scattered about, table games like checkers, Jenga and chess. There are large yard games like corn hole, connect 4, tick tac toe.

There is plenty of tables with metal bar stool seats. I personally would have liked to see lower seating with back support that is more children friendly and more comfortable for parents to lounge while the kids play. However they do have two leather futon couches and 4 cushioned arm chairs towards the stage, set up in two living room style sets. There are also plenty of high chairs for babies and they looked clean!

The hive offers WiFi and a variety of refreshments and snacks. I had one of there nitro coffees (never had before) but was very good and creamy. The flavoring range is surprisingly amazing if you are willing to be adventurous and try new things. The also offer craft sodas, teas, and traditional coffee drinks you get at a coffee shop. There is ice cream, we got the waffle bubble and it was so yummy. So much ice cream for the $7. So worth it. There are snacks starting at $1, chips, gummies, dunkaroos, etc.

My daughter keeps asking me when we are going to go back again. Great hangout place, for. Both parents and kids. A little bit of everything for everyone.

-----------------------

Review: This place is wonderful! The owners care very much and they keep this place nice and clean. My boys love the playground and all the fun toys. They are always sad to go home. I'm so glad this place exists in our community! Oh and as a BIG plus the coffee and other treats are so good!

Reviewer: Chelsea Wooten
Rating: 4/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: The hive is very neat! This small town needed this after Polk county remolded the outdoor playgrounds. This is going to be a popular place on hot, rainy and cold days! This is a great indoor playground and has many sensory play area for little ones, plus a under 3 baby/toddler zone. They even have a semi private area that can be rented for parties. My 11 month old and 6 year each had there only spaces and had fun for hours. I also appreciate nit having to worry about big kids/teenagers running around and nocking into my child which is sometimes you find at parks and some of the larger indoor playground, jumping gyms.

There is different lanes for sensory and imagination play. Each of the 4 lanes are themed, under the sea, construction zone, outdoor/picnic, and house/doll. The only call out is we noticed the bottom baseboard in the lanes had a rough texture, so if not careful, could get a splinter. All the other boards in the place were smooth and laquered.

Something to note, we hadn't been before they moved the baby zone but talking to some parents, they voiced they didn't like how small it is now. The baby zone used to be where the party area is now. Parents were saying there was more room for them to run around and spread out. On the other hand I could understand the need for larger party area to accommodate larger parties. I didn't mind the baby area and we there on Sunday afternoon after the church crowd. The only thing I didn't like was the net gate used to act as a baby safety gate. Toddlers were climbing over it, under it and around it where it's only attached and hooked at the bottom. Looks broke. Would like to see a solid 3' wall with a swinging gate like at the entrance of the place.

There are a few adult games scattered about, table games like checkers, Jenga and chess. There are large yard games like corn hole, connect 4, tick tac toe.

There is plenty of tables with metal bar stool seats. I personally would have liked to see lower seating with back support that is more children friendly and more comfortable for parents to lounge while the kids play. However they do have two leather futon couches and 4 cushioned arm chairs towards the stage, set up in two living room style sets. There are also plenty of high chairs for babies and they looked clean!

The hive offers WiFi and a variety of refreshments and snacks. I had one of there nitro coffees (never had before) but was very good and creamy. The flavoring range is surprisingly amazing if you are willing to be adventurous and try new things. The also offer craft sodas, teas, and traditional coffee drinks you get at a coffee shop. There is ice cream, we got the waffle bubble and it was so yummy. So much ice cream for the $7. So worth it. There are snacks starting at $1, chips, gummies, dunkaroos, etc.

My daughter keeps asking me when we are going to go back again. Great hangout place, for. Both parents and kids. A little bit of everything for everyone.

Reviewer: nicole D
Rating: 2/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: I think the concept of this place is very cool and offers parents an outlet and place for their kids to release energy in a climate controlled environment.

The issues that I have with this place are; they have a toddler time for under 3 year olds, but it‚Äôs not in an enclosed area where parents can kind of relax and monitor their children.
They have an entrance area that should be gated,  so that kids are enclosed so and can safely play while being monitored by a seated parent, and that doesn‚Äôt require you to constantly chase them. I really dislike this lack of a feature at this establishment and it truly has a negative effect on the experience when going.

this is a place for children to play and I feel like it‚Äôs also a place where parents can go and possibly get some work done or socialise with other parents while safely monitoring their children play with other kids.

The lack of having a gated area does not allow this at all. It‚Äôs also quite dangerous to have an open area that a young child under the age of three could simply walk out and open the door and go outside and get hit by a car.

Next, There are not bicycles in the area.  with children that are under three years old , it‚Äôs kind of overkill asking them to constantly come off of the mat area. A heavier woman kept redirecting my child off of the mat. Why have bikes in the same area? People do different things. No one has ever mentioned this before or had a problem.

Then, they have an upselling scheme of charging you $4 if you forget your socks. I have about five pairs of socks at this point because I do end up forgetting the socks whenever I spontaneously decide to come by this place.
you would think they had some type of system.
It‚Äôs literally just a tactic to make more money.
Toddler Socks don‚Äôt cost $4 for 1 pair.
If a child is wearing socks, it‚Äôs ridiculous to even charge to buy theirs.

I feel the quality of children and parents is low class and I had an experience where a child put my child in a headlock and left a scratch of my child‚Äôs neck.
The child was a bit older and clearly had some behavioural issues as the parent was not able to communicate effectively for the child to acknowledge they had done something wrong.
For this reason in addition to the other concern stated, I decided that I won‚Äôt be coming to this place anymore.

It‚Äôs truly a shame because there isn‚Äôt anything else that‚Äôs in this area, but I don‚Äôt feel comfortable paying $17 for one hour of letting my kid play and also subjecting my child to certain dangers. It‚Äôs not worth it.

Reviewer: Wyeuca
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Brought the kids here for some much needed time out of the house after the snow day last weekend. We'll be back.

-Booking online was easy
-Pricing was good
-Staff is friendly.
-Lots of variety in activities.
-Suitable mostly for younger kids. I could see kids around 8-9 getting bored, but your mileage may vary and this isn't a criticism, merely my observation.
-We went when they opened; we were the only family for about half an hour. Not sure how busy it gets, but I could see it getting crowded pretty fast during peak times.
-The people griping about cleanliness need to get a grip. The place is clean, but it's also an indoor playground for children. It's never going to be medically sterile, and kids play in dirt when they go outside anyways.

Like I said, there was enough variety in activities that our kids didn't get bored in 2 hours. From physical activities to imaginative and interactive playsets, and a quiet room for kids with sensitivities, they cover a lot of bases.

It's more suited for younger kids, as I mentioned before. It's not as high energy and high speed as a place like Catch Air, so older kids may not enjoy it as much. But it's way easier here to keep track of your kids, since it isn't huge, and you don't have to worry about bigger kids knocking your toddler over on their way to a slide.

We'll definitely be back. On rainy days or days where we just need a break, it'll be nice to bring the kids to a place close by where they can burn off some energy in a safely contained space with lots to do.

Don't listen to the grouches. This place gets five stars.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Erica Krumholz
Rating: 5/5

Review: I truly am not sure how there are so many reviews saying things about the cleanliness of this place.  Every time I have been here it has been exceptionally clean, especially compared to other children‚Äôs play places in the area.  I feel like people tend to forget that this is a place that constantly has children in and out playing.  It obviously is not going to be a sterile and clean as a hospital.   I think this place is truly a gem that I am thankful to have found for my kids. I think the staff is absolutely wonderful and is always very kind. I truly have no complaints.

Review: First time visiting today for their New Years Eve bash. Our twins had a good time, but the cleanliness and attention to what is going on around the gym is to be desired. Additionally, $100 for two kids with zero food provided or anything outside of the ordinary is exorbitant. We could have visited one of many Atlanta attractions and purchased a FAMILY membership for this price.

In shock, we also watched as one of the workers children physically pulled another child from one of the ‚Äúride in‚Äù cars by their hair while yelling ‚Äúthat‚Äôs my car, that‚Äôs my car‚Äù while the father stood on his phone just inches away doing nothing.

Inclusivity is paramount in our twins lives, of course, along with cleanliness and safety. We had high hopes for this neighborhood kids gym, but unfortunately, we won‚Äôt be returning.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Chloe Kim
Rating: 1/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: This was my first visit, and I will never return. The only positive aspect of this place was the staff‚Äîthey were friendly and nice. However, the layout needs improvement, especially the placement of the swings. They should not be positioned in the middle of the space. Both kids and adults were frequently hit by the swings, and parents had to carefully navigate the area multiple times when passing through with their children. The floor plan of the kids' playroom is poorly organized. The worst part of the visit, though, was the cleanliness. The owner needs to hire someone to clean the place at least once a day. They charge for kids as young as 7 months, and all children, especially babies, deserve to play in a clean environment. If they want to continue operating, they must maintain proper hygiene. I am extremely disappointed and will not return. I would never let my child play in such a filthy place.

Review: We absolutely love We Rock the Spectrum! The play area has been updated to include tons of new activities, keeping my 4 year old and almost 3 year old entertained for hours. We are also enrolled in the Spanish class and I can't speak highly enough of this program!  I had been looking for a program that would accept 2 year olds and this is the only one in the North Atlanta area that I could find. Ms. Johana is the best teacher ever! If you haven't checked this place out yet, then get on it ASAP!  I promise you won't regret it!

Reviewer: Monica Richardson
Rating: 4/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: I really like this place, especially when it's not super busy. For the most part, other parents are really good about being present, but sometimes people don't watch their kids well and they can be super rough which is really awkward because you don't want to say something to someone else's child and I am not comfortable confronting another parent. There is a staff member that I see there most of the time and she does a great job at picking up and resetting the area throughout the visit. I can tell when they clean the place because you can tell a difference in the way the floors feel. Not sure how to be able to tell with the toys though ha! For a children's play gym, I don't know why but I expected the staff to be super friendly and welcoming, but it's not really that kind of vibe. This is all just my opinion by the way. Others could certainly have a different experience.

My only complaint, which I think just comes with any children's center, I believe they run some sort of therapist program through the gym and twice now we have caught some sort of funk from a child in that program. The first time, a child coughed right on my child's head. I know that child did not know what they were doing so I am not upset with the child, but is there not a  sick policy in place? The second time we caught something, I noticed we were jumping on the trampoline with a child who had a giant green blob coming out of their nose. Again, I just wonder if there is any sort of sick policy and if not it would be wonderful to have one in place. I know children are going to get sick and that's just part of it, but I also don't agree that  it's okay  to send a child who is obviously sick into a play area with other children. Overall, I think this is a great place to take your children. I have recommended them to all of my friends with kids and will continue to do so.

Review: Great concept in a nice location, however we had a terrible experience! I have a 3 year old son that could and should have had a fabulous time but they allowed several older children (7,8,9 and older) to go absolutely wild in there. This is a very small place, which is perfect for younger children, but older rough and rowdy boys have NO business being there with younger children. The older children dominated the entire place. The parents just let them run wild and never checked on them. In the meantime, I was having to follow my son around and tell him he couldn‚Äôt do anything because the older kids were on the equipment. There SHOULD be an age limit or if not then definitely different times for different age groups. They need to have a time frame for the younger children where they can play and have fun SAFELY! We paid close to $20 but had to leave after maybe 30 minutes because my son was going to get hurt. Another big issue was they only had ONE young teenage girl working. She had absolutely NO control of the situation and had no business being there by herself. I am shocked no one got hurt. If you have young children I would NOT recommend this place as they are subject to get hurt since they have no rules or regulations on how many children are allowed in or how old and wild they act. Reviewer: Walk Faster
Rating: 4/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Lots of adventures and fun can be found here.  Parents are friendly, kids are having a good time.  Employees are working to keep each of the areas clutter-free and safe.  Parents can help a young kid win a prize! Hungry? A variety of basic kid-snacks are available.  There are tables where parents or friends can hang out. Adults can connect to the internet using the guest wi-fi.

Activities can accommodate children up to about eight years of age.  Older children will probably get bored here quickly.  The staff work with patrons on problem behaviors to keep things safe for everyone.

Facilities are kept clean and tidy while color-rich activities encourage kids to keep busy or just cut loose and have fun.  Children can enjoy swinging, jumping, wallowing, developing new skills and using their imagination.

We brought one toddler and the price was very affordable.  This is a great place to catch some really good photos of your little one playing.

There are plenty of restaurants in the same area to enjoy!  Take your kids here and hang out together!

They have something for every age. They have an area for smaller children with lots of cool toys, smaller trampolines, swings, a play kitchen with lots of toy food, and a doll castle. We visited this area first. They have an arcade room my older daughter and her friend explored.

Review: We've been twice now and absolutely love this place! I pray they're here to stay! Great for babies and kids, and parents can play with.

Reviewer: Michele Robberts
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We were very impressed with J&W play world! Our group had ages ranging from 18 months to seven years old and every kid had a great time. The entrance fees are reasonable, in my opinion, and their membership rates are a good deal if you decide to go often. They have several party rooms that can be rented. I just peaked into the party rooms quickly and they seemed a bit plain, but that might be good if you wanted to bring your own decorations.
There are two major play areas. Visibility is good in both areas and it is easy to follow your child. Stroller accessible. Nothing contains kids to a specific play area so just be aware that if you are one person with a bunch of kids, you might have them running in opposite directions. The play gym and 'tubes' are large enough for a parent to climb with their child if needed. I felt like everything was padded and safe so I felt comfortable letting my little one roam, discover, and play.
The facility was clean and I really hope it stays that way! They do have some food items for purchase, but we brought our own snacks so I didn't really pay attention to what they had/cost etc.
There is a game room and you do need to purchase tokens for those games.
We will definitely be back!

The main issue was NO STAFF watching the kids play AT ALL. no rules, we walked around with shoes on, no one said anything. A child can easily run off or be taken without consent at this place. It's hard to watch your child and there's no staff doing it at all.

Food was expensive and mediocre at best. They said they would call out number but they never did, and we went back to the window to find our food sitting and cold.

Our kids were bored after 30 minutes. We made them keep playing so we could at least get our food.

Nice concept, but unfortunately a fail.

Reviewer: Aubrie Vasquez
Rating: 1/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: WIGGLE GIGGLE ü§¢

I used to love this place with my 3 year old! It‚Äôs been a few months since I‚Äôve been and decided to take my now 4 year old and infant today. The first issue is the front girl told me she couldn‚Äôt give me a receipt and it would be emailed. Ok no problem, but I never received an email! I checked my bank statement and saw she charged me for my infant. Children under 12 months are free with a sibling. The manager was extremely nice and confirmed I had been charged and issued a refund. Just a reminder to check your card if you don‚Äôt get a receipt!

So we move on to the play area. I fully expected it to be busy on a rainy Saturday. What I did not expect was how filthy this place was. It was clear they have not been cleaning properly for more than just today. I was so disappointed üòî The floors were visibly dirty and sticky, the baby area had built up dirt and grime (see pics). There was dust and hair all over the play mats in some areas. Crackers , crumbs, and food wrappers all over the floors. I have never seen it like this!

Now, I KNOW kids places are not the cleanest in general, it is what it is, but this was disgusting. So much so that I wanted to share this in a post so that other parents can avoid this place. To me it is expected that places like these should do the utmost to at least not have sticky floors and built up dirt! I‚Äôve been to plenty of places like gymboree, the little gym, buddies etc to know what to expect. Again, I‚Äôve been going here with my son for a year now and it has been much cleaner than this before! This was around noon today so it‚Äôs not like I went at the end of the day either.

The manager was helping a party so I addressed it with front desk girl. I asked if I could get a refund because I didn‚Äôt want my baby and kid playing in this filth and was ready to go. She said I couldn‚Äôt get a refund and sent a really sweet girl over to clean the baby area. The poor girl, who looked maybe 16-17 didn‚Äôt have the proper equipment to clean so much dirt and grime. She asked for a vacuum and I couldn‚Äôt hear the reason why they didn‚Äôt give her one. I just left and let it go that I wasted $20 because I‚Äôll never spend another dime here again. I should have received a refund especially since they couldn‚Äôt give the girl a vacuum to clean!

Please see pics. & zoom in!  Respectfully, This place needs a good cleaning üßº especially the baby area and the floors, your socks should not stick to the floor in some areas of this place! ü§¢

Review: Excellent concept for play. However, there were a few areas where the children were not visible and the lighting was dim. AmThe set-up ppears problematic for security purposes since they allow adults to access the play area with their "kids." It would be an improvement if they had better lighting and limited the areas where adults can access/jump & tumble with their "kids" within the children's "safe" play area so that we are assured that our kids are free to run and play in a well lit; in a properly supervised safe play area. We want to be able to see them play. Additionally,  I would suggest that there be a safe, separate space for parents who wish to play with their kids and a separate area where kids can be just kids - separated from "well-intentioned" parents. I would also suggest that strange adults not engage with other peoples children - I was VERY uncomfortable when I observed an adult collecting kids names and engaging with the kids in the play area. Paranoid? I am not - it would be great if we lived in a completely safe world - but we do not. Also, I would suggest a form of ID for parent and child, obvious security cameras, and someone posted at the door to ensure the correct adult leaves with the correct kid(s).

Reviewer: Michelle Unterborn
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Sorry in advance for the long review.
I went to this establishment with some friends yesterday for their sons birthday. While the kids were jumping my friend and myself went to get a snack. She purchased a frozen banana and I was in line to purchase mine when she opened hers and bit into it. My friend immediately had to spit out the piece of banana as it had gone bad and was partially melted. I asked if I could open mine up before purchasing and the girl reluctantly said yes. That one was also partially melted and you could tell it had melted and refroze before that as it looked like when a candy bar melts and you put it in the freezer. I obviously did not purchase the banana, but they offered nothing to my friend who had purchased hers. The staff then started going through the freezer and realized half of the freezer was defrosted and had to throw away all of those items on that side. Now food regulations are not my specialty, but I don't see that the other half of the freezers items could have possibly been at food grade temp. All of the items should have been disposed of in the freezer. After that we purchased cards for the kids to play the arcade/ VR games. When my son got on to one of the VR games he said he couldn't figure out how to get it to work. I thought maybe it hadn't taken the card and swiped it again. It had taken the money off the card, now 2 times. It was at this point a young lady came over (mind you this was like 4 or 5 minutes later) and I was saying that we had swiped it and the money came off twice and we couldn't figure out how to get the machine to work. She then proceeds to explain that is because she has to release it. Apparently she was supposed to be working that section and helping everyone with the VR games. She begins strapping my son in and when she straps his feet in he asks if the ride goes upside down. She replied yes and he said no he didn't want to do that, so she let's him off. No offer to put back on the money or anything. There were multiple people trying to get on the VR rides and no one knew that there was even an attendant for that area. The attendant did have time to constantly be on her phone though. Lastly the group of kids were waiting to go into the laser tag game. They were waiting for the group ahead of them to finish because there were small kids in that group and they were trying to be polite because we had older kids. The attendant told them they could wait for their turn to finish. Our group sat at the tables by the laser tag while the other group played. Another group came up and was standing at the door and once the first group finished the attendant proceeded to let that group in. When my friend approached him asking why he had done that and asked for the manager or owner they said he wasn't there. My friend said she had just seen the owner a few minutes prior. The attendant then said "Oh you think just because he's Indian, he's the owner!?" My friend then proceeded to tell him NO she had known he was the owner because earlier that's what he had told her. The staff here are rude and will be the downfall of this establishment.
1. There should be a sign that states there is an attendant that sets up all the VR games.
2. Signs should be posted on games that aren't working so that people aren't swiping cards and not getting to play said game. (I seem a few kids swipe their cards on a game in the VR section before the "attendant" let them know it wasn't working)
3. There should be a waiting list for the laser tag.
4. The staff should be taught about temperature regulations on the freezers and they should be checked daily.
5. Being rude to customers should not be tolerated when it is not called for.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Renan de Campos
Rating: 2/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: This place was okay, I guess. For $12 for my child I can't really complain. I'm not driving out of my way and here's why.

The toys were really beat up. A lot of them were broken and gunked up. Some of these inflatables were on the flat side. I was too worried of an injury to let my son go on.

There's a almost tree house looking area with a house at the top of stairs. This is crazy dangerous. One side has steep and sharp stairs. The other side is to climb up, but if someone falls it will be a serious injury.

Also, one area in the ball pit has the beam exposed without pad. It's a very small area, but that can cause a serious injury.

To me, this place isn't putting safety and cleanliness first. There seems to be a lack of care.

While it was a decent spur of the moment place when we were in town, I would not return here.

Review: I hesitate to ever give bad reviews, especially during these trying times, but Oodazu really dropped the ball on a birthday balloon delivery and wanted to give the heads up to anyone else ordering to make sure you call repeatedly. In early December I ordered a balloon delivery for a birthday in late December. On the birthday, no balloons arrived. I sent multiple text messages, but never got a response. I called at 11 am, and they told me it would be arriving after 1 pm. I called at 3 pm after no delivery had been made and left a message.  I got a call back after 5 asking if we still wanted a delivery later that evening. I said we were home, but still no delivery.
I understand being short staffed and unable to fulfill an order, but I don‚Äôt understand not giving the customer a heads up and soon as you realize this.  All this to say, if you order balloon delivery, call often to ensure you‚Äôll get what you ordered.

Reviewer: Kay Nguyen
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 years ago
Review: This is among our very favorite kids' spaces! After attending an awesome birthday party at Oodazu, we decided to sign up for the after school sessions.

We had initially been hesitant - our young 4 year old daughter loves the playground, but is always reluctant to go down big slides, or get pushed too high (or at all) on the swings, and only likes bouncy castles when there are just a few tired kids left in there. She‚Äôs active, but VERY cautious, haha!

On her first day at Oodazu, she was inspired to climb/scale the walls and towers, had the energy to drag the tires up the huge slide (with the help of a friend), and clearly had an incredible time. Most impressive - she was in the most upbeat and positive mood after Oodazu (a level of cheerfulness that lasted all day and that doesn‚Äôt compare to her days with dance, tennis or swim classes, which she also loves).

The space is functional, and also modern and creative. There are a ton of activities to get kids moving and exploring - but without the chaos of the typical kids‚Äô indoor gyms/playgrounds. The staff are exceptionally warm and attentive - there aren‚Äôt many places I feel comfortable leaving my child, but this is one of the very few.

We tried the kids‚Äô yoga classes - we haven‚Äôt found anything like it nearby in Atlanta. The yoga teachers keep the kids engaged for 45 minutes (without parents!) in the very chill yoga studio, doing real yoga postures specifically for kids - while I couldn‚Äôt tear my eyes away from the screen outside in amazement. We‚Äôll be back often!
