Reviewer: Sam Eileen
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: I am SO happy this place exists in Maryville. It took a while to get there, but today I finally took my 6 year old son. He has autism and eloping is part of that. Parks, and open public spaces are a no go, because he will run. It is very limiting and keeps us from going most places.  Today we went here after school and he had such a great time. The play area was so perfect for him. He was able to run around free and he didn't stop for the nearly hour and half we were there. The play equipment was all really great. The bouncy slide area was his favorite but really enjoyed the regular slides too. I brought him home and for the first time pretty much ever, he sat down and relaxed. He was worn out. This place will become our second home and I am so thankful they were so accommodating. The prices were much lower than I had anticipated. Which is rare these days.  The ONLY complaint I have is not about this place nor the staff but about parents not watching over their children a bit better. But I guess that is the appeal. To bring your kids and get a breather from them for a second. Not everyone has children with special needs that require constant supervision, so maybe I'm jealous of their freedom. üòÇ Regardless I couldn't be more pleased with our first visit!

Reviewer: Penelope Miller
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Very dirty but very fun if your okay with germs!! The mats are worn and the new (like from 2021) ninja course is not too fun for the kids but the big room with red carpets (I don't know what it's called) is quite clean. On one of the animal things that kids can ride around on there was blood on it which concerns me although I doubt something bad has happened there (just reporting and it was quite long ago so it might be cleaned). It's quite old and run down/ghetto yet besides the low quality quite fun if you don't mind it! The employees are slightly bratty and kids do prefer the old version of this place with the arcade but it's still keeping some attention but not all of it is positive. I believe maybe besides all of the negative things, if you go in with a positive attitude and ignore any grime or dirt then maybe it could be enjoyable. This place doesn't deserve one star because it's not completely terrible but it's ever so slightly dirty but I feel some people in the reviews are over exaggerating it a little bit. (I do now take negative criticism about this) Although the place looks like a middle school bathroom it has a lot of terrible things happening which I believe if they had at least a bit of cleaning they could get these reviews way up then now. I believe that maybe at least a bit of cleaning could do a lot for this place. Compared to how this place used to look it has changed a LOT, I used to be taken here when I was little and compared to now... It has changed for the worst and I doubt it will come out of this weird rabbit hole of dirt they have fallen in, and i don't think they are really trying to fix it because since like 2019 it has fallen into disrepair and I doubt it will come back into their prime. If a worker is reading this then please please please hire a janitor!! Hell I'll even do It for free!! I'll just walk in and clean It. This place has really changed and I see the possibility of this place being good if you cleaned it and took better care of it but I feel in a few years this place will end up like the old ajc building downtown, If you don't know what that is supposed to mean I'm saying that it will possibly go bankrupt. Sorry for the long review, I feel very passionate about this place. I wouldn't want to see this place go but it seems like now I have no choice but to watch it slowly decay.

Reviewer: Kimberly Arnold
Rating: 3/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: I had a great first visit last month. Brought our water thermos' and purchased sliced pizza for my kids later on. No problem at all.
Encountered a lady working and she never said a peep about our water cups that visit, or next, a week later. So, I purchased a pass for 10 visits since it was clean fun.

2nd visit- kids out of control, not much monitoring going on. I had to stop the banana swing with my 2 kids screaming because older kids were going too fast. Staff just stood there.
I had a pass, so decided to try a midweek day.

However, this visit has been an entire different encounter.
Myself and my kids were abruptly stopped after checking in, and told to put our water cups in the shoe bin, as they weren't allowed.

I get a business trying to make money and have rules for no outside food.
But it's not as though I'm bringing a bag of fast food. Nor, special drinks.
It's Ludacris that a water thermos isn't allowed. So, we all have to leave together,  go to lobby for a drink of water.

Water shouldn't be a 'luxury' that must be purchased , especially as people need to hydrate and already pay a decent amount to enter.
I see similar reviews mentioning that and I should have researched more.

After my pass visits are met,  we will resume going elsewhere. A water thermos and special diet snacks shouldn't be an issue.

I'm sure , like other parents, I'll have a passive response. So,   Poppets place here we come.

Review: I am extremely disappointed with the service that my disabled daughter received at this playground. We spent almost 30 dollars only to be inside 30 to 45 minutes. Let me start by saying I had to pay 6 dollars for my daughters nurse which is fine. However when people are complaining on your child that has down syndrome and the nurse and I never left her side but a parent made it seem like we were not around her which is completely inaccurate..My daughters nurse and I were with her 100 percent of the time and when my daughter scratched another child I personally apologized to everyone that was close to her.. I as well as her nurse was standing right next to her and got her of the swing immediately...To even insinuate that she was unattended is gross and unacceptable... Meaning that parent was no where near their child for them to even hear that I apologized to every adult.... Meaning the child was unsupervised....... I would not suggest bringing any child here with special needs including but not limited to down syndrome, autism, ADHD. Not to mention we drove an hour and half here..... I blame the ignorance of the parents as well as anyone else who doesn't understand the difficulty of having a special needs child.....
In addition to "chastise" me about my disabled daughter in front of other parents was completely unacceptable.... If there was any concern that should have been handled privately..... I left of my own free will because I felt that I wouldn't have been chastised publicly if I was a different complexion........ I'm am still very upset.... wish I read the Google reviews instead of the Facebook reviews honestly...... The reviews on Facebook are very misleading ...... It was a complete waste of time.... I ended up taking my daughter another 55 minutes away to chuck e cheese on Kingston Pike we had a blast! I was not going to let that ruin her day at all!!!! If you have a special child save your self and your child the heartache please üíïüíïüíïüíïüíïüíïüíï

Not even for your two year old.  They sell chips, pizza and pepsi products. If your child has strict dietary needs, well you‚Äôre out of luck. They watch your every move and bark at kids if they break a rule. They also provide plastic shoe covers for parents to wear while in the facility. However, if you dare step your foot in the restricted area, you will be yelled at! Seriously?? After I walked in the restricted area WITH MY PLASTIC SHOE COVERS to help my child when he fell of the bike, I was rudely asked to leave. I couldn‚Äôt believe it. Shocking.
By the way, if you happen to speak another language, BEWARE!! You may be discriminated against. Thats exactly how I felt that day. I know my rights. I‚Äôm sad we had such a bad experience in our local community.

Reviewer: Alyssa Bartram
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: There are definitely pros and cons to this place. But as a parent, the cons outweigh the pros.

PROS:
- My kid had a great time on the equipment.

CONS:
- The ‚Äúno outside food or beverage‚Äù rule is ridiculous. The indoor playground in Maryville (as well as the new one they‚Äôre putting in there soon) allows you to bring your own HEALTHY snacks and drinks. I asked to keep my water at least because I‚Äôm recovering from kidney surgery and they said a firm ‚Äúno.‚Äù
- You can buy their pizza, but it‚Äôs a $5.99 pizza from Dominos and they charge you $16 for a whole one, or you can buy 2 slices for the same price you could buy the whole pizza for at Dominos.
- There‚Äôs a young teen-ish boy who sulks about the ‚Äúlounge‚Äù area with a very unfriendly face and attitude about him, slamming chairs back into tables and making sure you‚Äôre not breaking any rules. I believe he is related to the owner.
- ‚ÄúMimi‚Äù or her husband come around and stare everyone down (again, not very friendly faces or demeanors) to make sure you‚Äôre not breaking rules.
- The ‚Äúlounge‚Äù area is plastic or metal chairs, and since you can‚Äôt bring ANY drinks or foods from home, you‚Äôre uncomfortable in many physical ways.
- You can‚Äôt step out to eat in your car and then return (which goes to show it‚Äôs not about keeping the facility clean or fair, it‚Äôs about GREED).
- They charged me for an extra adult even though it‚Äôs supposed to be one free adult per child. Wasn‚Äôt worth the trouble of dealing with the front desk to get my money back.
- We went opening day, and they were VERY lax on their rules. Came back a few weeks later, and the rules were strictly and rudely enforced. ‚ÄúMimi‚Äù doesn‚Äôt have a very friendly attitude and should stick to a career where she doesn‚Äôt have to talk to people face-to-face.
- Also I witnessed one of her younger grandkids (I am fairly certain) going into a private room with many ‚Äúoutside‚Äù snacks and drink, while a mom who was there with us said she was denied to bring her baby‚Äôs bottle and baby food in there. So I guess if you‚Äôre related to ‚ÄúMimi,‚Äù you don‚Äôt have to eat one of the few unhealthy options they offer, but if you aren‚Äôt, be prepared to spend plenty more money on food and drinks. Which I‚Äôm sure is the whole point.

That‚Äôs all. We went twice, and don‚Äôt expect to go back. Which I‚Äôm sure is the mutual feeling of many.

Reviewer: Anaid K
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: Kid friendly place not so kid friendly or friendly at all. I recommend reading so you don't get in trouble as I did.

Cons.

1. No healthy snack options(nothing kosher, for diabetics, or for kids with allergies)
2. Kicking out without warning
3. Banning you from coming back.
4. Talking to kids instead of parents if there's an issue.
5. It's not a place to relax while kids play. You're being watched for every mistake. And then you get kicked out.
6. Not for parents with multiple kids.

Pros
1. A nice playground for kids under 4, I'd say, and for those with 1 or two children the most.

I was so happy when they opened such a fun place in town. We planned to come once a month at least. I even asked for a multiple visit pass that they offer that day. However, for the 1st time in my mom life of 14 years,  I was kicked out of the place for bringing healthy snacks with us.  This was on our second visit to the Mimi's.
On our first visit, we noticed almost every single family using their own water bottle for both kids and adults, so I thought that was sweet of staff to allow. We also brought our own water and healthy snacks because after looking at their options on Facebook, I couldn't call them snacks but junk. Go check for yourself. Staff didn't tell us anything, and they saw us eating and drinking. We had a great experience. We loved it. I've got 3 kids ages 6-13 plus an infant.
On our second visit,while I breastfeed a baby,I noticed an older lady(staff) came to my older daughter and her friend's table and was talking to them in a very serious tone. I came to them and asked if everything was ok. She said :"yeah,I just told them no outside snacks or drinks." I told her you guys don't have healthy options, so we had to bring our own. She said our rule is no outside food or drinks period. And left. Ok,we hid the snacks, and the kids went back to play(my younger ones weren't there). Then, once again,I'm breastfeeding a baby, and my 7 year old grabs a grape from a backpack and goes towards the playground and I called her and said no food on the playground. Once I'm done breastfeeding, I head towards kids, and the older lady approaches me and says you guys need to leave. And not come back again. You break our rules. Mind you,she never told us before if we break the rule again,we'll have to leave. No warning. And plus she said,someone overheard me calling her " b**ch. I was shocked. English is not my primary language. My friend and I was talking to each other in another language, plus, I never ever swear. Never. And I told her that. I said let me also explain to you about the snacks. She said I don't want to talk about it,and please don't come back, and left. I wanted to tell her that kids' pediatrician recommended my kids to eat healthy snacks to restore their guts and I cannot feed them sugary drinks and candies. Plus if you pay $12 per child(with multiple children it adds up),you'd like them to stay a bit longer then 1 hour and kids loose a lot of energy playing there and need a snack. However, they don't allow you to go to your car, eat and then come back. If you go out,you leave. And if you bring your own, you get kicked out without warning.

Reviewer: Tiffany Bivins
Rating: 2/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: We booked Kids Avenue for our daughter‚Äôs Birthday Party. The kids loved playing in the different play areas, and had a great experience overall. Our concern is with the owner and the lackluster offerings for the birthday parties. It was very expensive, and not worth the cost. When we booked the party we knew that we wouldn‚Äôt get much, but wanted to book because our baby loved it during our visit.

The staff was nice, but lacked alignment on exactly what we were to receive during our time there. Upon booking, we were told that juice boxes for each child would be included and that they help with setting up, etc. The staff helped with setting and clean up, but gave varying explanations on the juice box issue. After paying almost $700 for a party; I expect to get everything that is stated to be apart of the package. We paid for 15 kids, and they attempted to give us a half opened package of 6 juice boxes. After complaining, a staffer left to get more juice boxes and attempted to then give us a box of 10, and take back the 6. The owner tried to explain by saying they no longer offer this as a package incentive. He also did not want to give us the juice. Seemed to me, that he was the only person aware of the policy change. BOTH bathrooms in the property were broken, and there were guests with toddlers scrambling to find a bathroom across the street. When we brought this up, he was very unapologetic about the overwhelming inconvenience.

This review is NOT about $5 juice boxes; it‚Äôs the lack of integrity from the owner. If this was offered during booking; then honor it. If the bathrooms don‚Äôt work; apologize to your customers and assist them in finding a solution. The party package is too expensive to receive nothing but the runaround‚Ä¶the allotted time is also too short, but it‚Äôs doable, since most of the kids opted to play instead of eating.

Review: I emailed the company this after my daughters party but did not get a response. I just didn't want to surprise them with my review.

We were not provided capri suns for the children although that is a part of the booking, nor did we receive assistance with the setup. This is very disappointing as we not only watched them help the party coming in after us but was rushed out 15 minutes prior than our end time.  The party is way to expensive for two hours to not come with the bells whistles and capri suns [ literally $5 worth of juice]. Of course I was overprepared so my daughter's party did not suffer. Nothing special was done for our birthday girl by your facility and that is just lackluster. For $800 you should try to do more to make the party feel special.

The party to play window is not long enough for the kids to eat and play, they pretty much had to choose which one they will do. You should consider 1.5 hours in the party room and additional time for the kids to play after to allow parents time to feed their children and sing happy birthday to whoever's party it is.

It is way too hot in the party room and bathroom, you guys needs to have HVAC come assist with that, it makes the short time in there with a group of people miserable. And if its too hot right now in the winter it will be too cold. The facility is nice despite it being small, the parking lot is an absolute terror! Someone hit a car leaving out twice while we were there.

The kids tables in the party should be cleaned so that disposable table cloths don't show the writing all over the tables, it looks cheap, doesn't match the venue's aesthetic and there is no party cheaper than $550. My kids as well as their cousins and friends usually have fun here but party vs play time will prevent me from booking another one.

Reviewer: Secoyia Sadler
Rating: 5/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: We learned about this place from my friend and she came across a instagram post about the venue collaborating with Ms. Shay for a ‚Äú Parent Help Parent Support Group‚Äù this particular event was  dedicated to children with special needs from 6pm-8pm. I saw the post and called right away and asked how I could purchase the ticket.  I purchased my daughter ticket over the phone for about $13 and they asked if I completed the waiver and said no, so the manager said she will stay on the call while I completing the waiver and texted me the receipt and confirmed the waiver was complete.  Calling ahead definitely made the process swift . I was very pleased to hear about this event and discovered a new place to take my daughter for her own enjoyment. I make it my mission to travel to kid friendly places to figure out what she likes and let her be a kid. I love the inclusivity of children with special needs. I knew I wouldn‚Äôt have to worry about anyone judging my child or any child.  My child would be free and I could watch her in peace.

Fast forward to the day of the event, we were welcomed by Ms. Nella and Ms. Shay and the staff.  My  daughter immediately took off her shoes and went to play. That‚Äôs a plus , usually new environment are hard adjustment for her especially with unfamiliar people. This establishment is great for the kiddos. This place offers video gaming , tutoring, snack bar. The indoor playground was designed with the kids in mind. I love the rock climbing wall,  ball pit , slide , obstacle course , trampoline, projector and screen with kid friendly videos and music. It‚Äôs a great place to let the kids enjoy themselves. Additionally, they offer to watch your kiddo if you have a date night or just need time to yourself for a flat fee and trust me the price is very reasonable. Please inquire about it. It was a great experience overall. This place was very clean. I highly recommend this place! I can‚Äôt wait to come back.

It was nice being able to enjoy mingling with the parents of other children, family, and friends without feeling like we were being pulled in a million directions/constantly interrupted! The owner was extremely accommodating and worked with me as I fluctuated between various details regarding the party! Not to mention they coordinated so many of the details and party planning that we just showed up with the cake, party favors, and a few other items and the rest was taken care of! I highly recommend this indoor playground not just for parties, but for those parents with last minute schedule changes that need some responsible adult supervision for their kids when you are in a bind! Reviewer: Kaylee Prunty
Rating: 3/5
Time: 8 months ago
Review: Adorable, cute play place! So many Lovery and Montessori toys, it's every aesthetic mom's DREAM. I wish it was my house. However...

sadly...its not an great place for  energetic  or autistic children.

The environment is very calm and quiet. I felt like we were in a library and every noise we made was embarrassing. I wish they played some light music.

Also, every room is self-enclosed. I have two kids, and it was impossible to see where both kids are at once. This place is designed for moms with only one small child.

The biggest thing though, was I did NOT feel it was a safe enough for any kid who tends to run away (elope).

My autistic 3 year old loves to open and shut doors as "fine motor stimulation". Most kids go through a phase where they like to open and shut doors. Thusly, there needs to be child locks on EVERY door, inside AND out. There were over 10 times that my kid opened the door and ran for the street before I could even get to them!

I want to come back, but I felt stressed, flustered, and disappointed by the end. Please consider all children. If you update with inclusive safety measures, we will be a regular customer.

Reviewer: Stephanie Simon

Review: So happy to have discovered this great place!  So fun and affordable,  clean and well ran.

Love the variety of toys and things to play with. Definitely Montessori style toys which is great, love all the natural materials.

Every room has a theme, everything is labeled to make cleaning up easy. Twonof the rooms are for 18 months and you ger.

Almost every room has a seat specificly for adults. Two rooms that I've been in didn't have one. But one of the rooms  had some short stools that work if you cant sit on the floor.

Appreciate the kitchen area to sit and eat snacks, one visit they even had snacks set out for guests. They have 2 single stall bathrooms and a nursing room.

Remember to wear your socks, but if you forget - you can buy a pair from them.

We've been coming every week after PT appointments, makes the trip to Lexington even better =)

Really wish we had a place like this in Sumter! Even my 16 yr old had a great time.

Reviewer: Erin
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: My children were very excited to go here and I always enjoy supporting small businesses. The place is a nice size, not too big, and perfect for toddlers. Everything is clean and organized. However, I noticed the owner does not like clutter of any kind. She frequently followed us around and would put toys back in their assigned spots when my children were still playing with them. All the toys are labeled and the owner expects that toys should be put back in the exact location that she wants them. There are multiple rooms that have adorable themes, but the toys in each room are not to leave. This was a bit frustrating. It was difficult to enjoy playing with my children because I felt like I had to cleanup after them the entire time. I was hoping this would be a relaxing experience but it was the complete opposite for me. I also enjoy keeping things tidy and had no plans to leave a mess behind. My kids are asking to return but I'm not sure I want to go back. To the owner, your business has so much potential but kids need to be kids. They will make messes, it's part of how they play and learn. I hope this feedback is received well and that your business continues to flourish.

My 17 month old loved the ball pit and her big brother played in there with her! The giant jumper in the middle was a huge hit with every child! The older ones loved climbing and bouncing. The staff was very friendly and helpful! After the party ends, we got to stay and play up until closing time which I thought was awesome. All of our guests got free passes to come back. The women's restroom has a changing table and rocking chair in it! I appreciate the space while doing diaper changes and loved the option to sit and nurse if we needed privacy. Reviewer: Karynna
Rating: 5/5
Time: a week ago
Review: Amazing! Not only is it a lot of fun for the kids, but it's so clean! The staff seems to be constantly cleaning. They have great sitting space for adults even areas with outlets. I could have totally brought my laptop to get some work done had I known. We came in on a Thursday late afternoon, there was a good size crowd, but not crowded. I imagine weekends might be a little insane.
The music volume is great too. Feels like a lot of these places keep the volume up so high and it becomes stressful with the children's volume mixed in.
Food - while I wasn't planning on buying food here, the toddler decided he was starving. Luckily we can when they were rubbing a promo for $1 personal pizza for kids so it worked out. And the pizza wasn't too shabby, nothing gourmet. But for a place like this, it was decent. They also have a wide selection of snacks, coffee, and other eats for a fair price.
Price - reasonable for the area. And adults are free (or included) so that's nice, it feels less price gaugey. But if you don't want to eat here, there's plenty of restaurants around to choose from.
They do birthday parties as well and with a summer baby, this sounds like a great option. Not having compared party rates, not sure how they measure up here.
The staff is VERY friendly. They clearly enjoy their job here.
Parking- it's in a shopping center, so plenty of parking.

Overall, highly recommend. Thanks to my neighbor for checking it out first and telling us we HAD to come check it out for ourselves!
We will definitely be returning regularly.

Reviewer: Paige Smith
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Best Catch Air experience yet! The woman working at the front desk who checked us in, I believe her name was Nicki or Vicki, gave us an incredibly warm welcome.  Her customer service was exceptional! What I loved the most about this location was the fact that there were multiple employees on the floor at ALL TIMES with hand held vacuums and mops (similar to a swiffer wet jet). The cleanliness of this location, while understanding it's still brand new, was pristine and it was definitely because of that.  This is the third Catch Air location we've been to in the greater ATL area, but this was the only location I've seen cleaning up in real time.

Outside of that, the place itself is AWESOME and is now my 3 year old's new favorite Catch Air location.  But caution on those slides, they are SLICK because of how new they are and my 37 pound kid (and myself) went FLYING out of them (equal parts hilarious, entertaining, but also nerve-wracking). The outer space theme was so much fun, our favorite part being when they turned off the overhead lights and just let the colored lights do their job. We spent 3 hours here and not once did my kid get bored.  Can't recommend this place enough, so much that we plan on booking my daughter's 4th birthday party here!

Reviewer: Veronica Preston
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Late post but I had never been to a kid's play attraction grand opening Before until last sunday....if you have little ones up to like 10-12yrs old, u must go and check out Catch Air Tucker (in same plaza as Goodwill and Jason deli and our fav spot to eat KPOT Korean BBQ & Hot Pot ) ...it was amazing, not over crowded, perfect size ...toddler area is right next to the Big kid area but if u got a little one u want to keep up with like we do then get ready for a workout bc You Will be going inside all the attractions with them, we Will definitely make this a monthly visit and can't wait until they have memberships available soon ...

Pros: great location and size, colorful attractions for all ages, prices are $13-$20 for 2& up, 1 yr old free with sibling, every family has an unique hand stamp that Will be checked to make sure parents are leaving with the right child Before they unlock gate for You to exit, friendly staff, always cleaning the whole Time, everyone has to wear socks and take off their shoes(Even parents) and make sure it's grip socks because have some slick √°reas..also you can leave and come back later in day just show ur stamp again and the Best part as an parent... 1 free parent entry per paid child and only $5.99 each for extra adults( I used to hate going to other places and they want parents to pay same price as kids just to watch their kids have fun..smh)

Cons: Even though the bathroom was Nice and clean, as having an Autistic son, we didnt like the fact that the hand dryer for your hands is builded into the faucet, should be separate or at least at some paper towels inside bathroom as other option to dry your hands

The large pizza for $12.99 is not a pizza place type of large it's more like a medium size but was good and worked for what we needed at Time(food for kids to eat while we ate at Kpot afterwards)

Don't assume a child age just by looking at them bc got overcharged bc they assumed my youngest was already 3 and he is not so had to get a refund or put it towards the snack bar √°rea cr√©dit.

Nevertheless, both kids had a bowl on our family Day outing after church and then hubby and I got to eat at Kpot.

Review: We had the absolute BEST experience hosting our little one‚Äôs first birthday at Romp-a-Roo!

From start to finish, everything was seamless, thoughtful, and beautifully executed. Audrey went above and beyond with the d√©cor‚Äîevery single detail matched our Wonderland theme perfectly. From the balloons and backdrops to the table runners and themed play areas, it truly felt like stepping into a storybook. Even our guests (yes, including the dads!) were commenting on how detailed and magical everything was!

The space was clean, safe, and full of fun‚Äîfrom a ball pit and obstacle course to interactive play stations and an inflatable bounce area. It was a dream setup that let the kids play freely while the adults relaxed and enjoyed the party. All we had to do was show up and set out the food‚Äîeverything else was handled with care and creativity.

I cannot recommend Romp-a-Roo enough for your next party or celebration. It‚Äôs rare to find a venue that feels this personal, welcoming, and well-curated. Thank you, Audrey, for making Chloe‚Äôs ONEderland celebration so incredibly special‚Äîwe can‚Äôt wait to return!

Reviewer: Sarah King
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: This place exhibits a grossly negligent and apathetic approach to guest safety (and is unsanitary and not well maintained on top of all that). Despite recurring injuries in specific areas, they make no meaningful effort to implement preventive measures or improve safety protocols.

Instead of addressing the risks, they simply rely on a flimsy liability waiver as a legal shield‚Äîreopening hazardous zones without additional oversight, signage, or support. Their disregard for basic injury prevention reflects a disturbing prioritization of profits over people.

Quick cash grab for the owners.

Reviewer: Michelle Unterborn
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Sorry in advance for the long review.
I went to this establishment with some friends yesterday for their sons birthday. While the kids were jumping my friend and myself went to get a snack. She purchased a frozen banana and I was in line to purchase mine when she opened hers and bit into it. My friend immediately had to spit out the piece of banana as it had gone bad and was partially melted. I asked if I could open mine up before purchasing and the girl reluctantly said yes. That one was also partially melted and you could tell it had melted and refroze before that as it looked like when a candy bar melts and you put it in the freezer. I obviously did not purchase the banana, but they offered nothing to my friend who had purchased hers. The staff then started going through the freezer and realized half of the freezer was defrosted and had to throw away all of those items on that side. Now food regulations are not my specialty, but I don't see that the other half of the freezers items could have possibly been at food grade temp. All of the items should have been disposed of in the freezer. After that we purchased cards for the kids to play the arcade/ VR games. When my son got on to one of the VR games he said he couldn't figure out how to get it to work. I thought maybe it hadn't taken the card and swiped it again. It had taken the money off the card, now 2 times. It was at this point a young lady came over (mind you this was like 4 or 5 minutes later) and I was saying that we had swiped it and the money came off twice and we couldn't figure out how to get the machine to work. She then proceeds to explain that is because she has to release it. Apparently she was supposed to be working that section and helping everyone with the VR games. She begins strapping my son in and when she straps his feet in he asks if the ride goes upside down. She replied yes and he said no he didn't want to do that, so she let's him off. No offer to put back on the money or anything. There were multiple people trying to get on the VR rides and no one knew that there was even an attendant for that area. The attendant did have time to constantly be on her phone though. Lastly the group of kids were waiting to go into the laser tag game. They were waiting for the group ahead of them to finish because there were small kids in that group and they were trying to be polite because we had older kids. The attendant told them they could wait for their turn to finish. Our group sat at the tables by the laser tag while the other group played. Another group came up and was standing at the door and once the first group finished the attendant proceeded to let that group in. When my friend approached him asking why he had done that and asked for the manager or owner they said he wasn't there. My friend said she had just seen the owner a few minutes prior. The attendant then said "Oh you think just because he's Indian, he's the owner!?" My friend then proceeded to tell him NO she had known he was the owner because earlier that's what he had told her. The staff here are rude and will be the downfall of this establishment.
1. There should be a sign that states there is an attendant that sets up all the VR games.
2. Signs should be posted on games that aren't working so that people aren't swiping cards and not getting to play said game. (I seem a few kids swipe their cards on a game in the VR section before the "attendant" let them know it wasn't working)
3. There should be a waiting list for the laser tag.
4. The staff should be taught about temperature regulations on the freezers and they should be checked daily.
5. Being rude to customers should not be tolerated when it is not called for.

-----------------------

Review: We recently visited Flipzone Trampoline & Fun Park and were thoroughly disappointed with the condition of the facility. We arrived at opening and noticed several spills in the main entryway and throughout the building, which appeared to be left over from the previous day. The overall cleanliness was very poor, making the environment feel unkempt and uninviting. Several of the game machines were out of order, further limiting the activities available.

After visually checking the space, we made the decision to cancel our party reservation due to the lack of upkeep. While the concept of the park is great, the lack of maintenance and attention to cleanliness made it impossible for us to proceed with our plans. We hope improvements are made in the future to better meet guest expectations.

Review: This place exhibits a grossly negligent and apathetic approach to guest safety (and is unsanitary and not well maintained on top of all that). Despite recurring injuries in specific areas, they make no meaningful effort to implement preventive measures or improve safety protocols.

Instead of addressing the risks, they simply rely on a flimsy liability waiver as a legal shield‚Äîreopening hazardous zones without additional oversight, signage, or support. Their disregard for basic injury prevention reflects a disturbing prioritization of profits over people.

Quick cash grab for the owners.

Reviewer: Michelle Unterborn
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Sorry in advance for the long review.
I went to this establishment with some friends yesterday for their sons birthday. While the kids were jumping my friend and myself went to get a snack. She purchased a frozen banana and I was in line to purchase mine when she opened hers and bit into it. My friend immediately had to spit out the piece of banana as it had gone bad and was partially melted. I asked if I could open mine up before purchasing and the girl reluctantly said yes. That one was also partially melted and you could tell it had melted and refroze before that as it looked like when a candy bar melts and you put it in the freezer. I obviously did not purchase the banana, but they offered nothing to my friend who had purchased hers. The staff then started going through the freezer and realized half of the freezer was defrosted and had to throw away all of those items on that side. Now food regulations are not my specialty, but I don't see that the other half of the freezers items could have possibly been at food grade temp. All of the items should have been disposed of in the freezer. After that we purchased cards for the kids to play the arcade/ VR games. When my son got on to one of the VR games he said he couldn't figure out how to get it to work. I thought maybe it hadn't taken the card and swiped it again. It had taken the money off the card, now 2 times. It was at this point a young lady came over (mind you this was like 4 or 5 minutes later) and I was saying that we had swiped it and the money came off twice and we couldn't figure out how to get the machine to work. She then proceeds to explain that is because she has to release it. Apparently she was supposed to be working that section and helping everyone with the VR games. She begins strapping my son in and when she straps his feet in he asks if the ride goes upside down. She replied yes and he said no he didn't want to do that, so she let's him off. No offer to put back on the money or anything. There were multiple people trying to get on the VR rides and no one knew that there was even an attendant for that area. The attendant did have time to constantly be on her phone though. Lastly the group of kids were waiting to go into the laser tag game. They were waiting for the group ahead of them to finish because there were small kids in that group and they were trying to be polite because we had older kids. The attendant told them they could wait for their turn to finish. Our group sat at the tables by the laser tag while the other group played. Another group came up and was standing at the door and once the first group finished the attendant proceeded to let that group in. When my friend approached him asking why he had done that and asked for the manager or owner they said he wasn't there. My friend said she had just seen the owner a few minutes prior. The attendant then said "Oh you think just because he's Indian, he's the owner!?" My friend then proceeded to tell him NO she had known he was the owner because earlier that's what he had told her. The staff here are rude and will be the downfall of this establishment.
1. There should be a sign that states there is an attendant that sets up all the VR games.
2. Signs should be posted on games that aren't working so that people aren't swiping cards and not getting to play said game. (I seem a few kids swipe their cards on a game in the VR section before the "attendant" let them know it wasn't working)
3. There should be a waiting list for the laser tag.
4. The staff should be taught about temperature regulations on the freezers and they should be checked daily.
5. Being rude to customers should not be tolerated when it is not called for.

Reviewer: Sarah King
Rating: 1/5

Review: This place exhibits a grossly negligent and apathetic approach to guest safety (and is unsanitary and not well maintained on top of all that). Despite recurring injuries in specific areas, they make no meaningful effort to implement preventive measures or improve safety protocols.

Instead of addressing the risks, they simply rely on a flimsy liability waiver as a legal shield‚Äîreopening hazardous zones without additional oversight, signage, or support. Their disregard for basic injury prevention reflects a disturbing prioritization of profits over people.

Quick cash grab for the owners.

Reviewer: Michelle Unterborn
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Sorry in advance for the long review.
I went to this establishment with some friends yesterday for their sons birthday. While the kids were jumping my friend and myself went to get a snack. She purchased a frozen banana and I was in line to purchase mine when she opened hers and bit into it. My friend immediately had to spit out the piece of banana as it had gone bad and was partially melted. I asked if I could open mine up before purchasing and the girl reluctantly said yes. That one was also partially melted and you could tell it had melted and refroze before that as it looked like when a candy bar melts and you put it in the freezer. I obviously did not purchase the banana, but they offered nothing to my friend who had purchased hers. The staff then started going through the freezer and realized half of the freezer was defrosted and had to throw away all of those items on that side. Now food regulations are not my specialty, but I don't see that the other half of the freezers items could have possibly been at food grade temp. All of the items should have been disposed of in the freezer. After that we purchased cards for the kids to play the arcade/ VR games. When my son got on to one of the VR games he said he couldn't figure out how to get it to work. I thought maybe it hadn't taken the card and swiped it again. It had taken the money off the card, now 2 times. It was at this point a young lady came over (mind you this was like 4 or 5 minutes later) and I was saying that we had swiped it and the money came off twice and we couldn't figure out how to get the machine to work. She then proceeds to explain that is because she has to release it. Apparently she was supposed to be working that section and helping everyone with the VR games. She begins strapping my son in and when she straps his feet in he asks if the ride goes upside down. She replied yes and he said no he didn't want to do that, so she let's him off. No offer to put back on the money or anything. There were multiple people trying to get on the VR rides and no one knew that there was even an attendant for that area. The attendant did have time to constantly be on her phone though. Lastly the group of kids were waiting to go into the laser tag game. They were waiting for the group ahead of them to finish because there were small kids in that group and they were trying to be polite because we had older kids. The attendant told them they could wait for their turn to finish. Our group sat at the tables by the laser tag while the other group played. Another group came up and was standing at the door and once the first group finished the attendant proceeded to let that group in. When my friend approached him asking why he had done that and asked for the manager or owner they said he wasn't there. My friend said she had just seen the owner a few minutes prior. The attendant then said "Oh you think just because he's Indian, he's the owner!?" My friend then proceeded to tell him NO she had known he was the owner because earlier that's what he had told her. The staff here are rude and will be the downfall of this establishment.
1. There should be a sign that states there is an attendant that sets up all the VR games.
2. Signs should be posted on games that aren't working so that people aren't swiping cards and not getting to play said game. (I seem a few kids swipe their cards on a game in the VR section before the "attendant" let them know it wasn't working)
3. There should be a waiting list for the laser tag.
4. The staff should be taught about temperature regulations on the freezers and they should be checked daily.
5. Being rude to customers should not be tolerated when it is not called for.

Review: We are recent military transfers from California to the local area and we stumbled upon this venue one afternoon driving around trying to get a lay of the land! What a hidden gem! The venue is perfect for those parents and kiddos who are leery of the traditional amusement park, arcades, and bouncy house places where not only you, but your children are overwhelmed and overstimulated by the sounds, flashing lights, and crowds of people running around! This venue gives you an opportunity to host a party where the kids can just be kids! And, the parents can relax because the staff is watching and assisting to ensure the kids don‚Äôt get bored, hurt, or feel left out! It was nice being able to enjoy mingling with the parents of other children, family, and friends without feeling like we were being pulled in a million directions/constantly interrupted! The owner was extremely accommodating and worked with me as I fluctuated between various details regarding the party! Not to mention they coordinated so many of the details and party planning that we just showed up with the cake, party favors, and a few other items and the rest was taken care of! I highly recommend this indoor playground not just for parties, but for those parents with last minute schedule changes that need some responsible adult supervision for their kids when you are in a bind! Drop ‚ÄòN Play is the Way!

Reviewer: Dia Jeanlys
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: I recently booked my son‚Äôs 4th birthday party at Boston Playground. I actually reserved the space before seeing it in person, and I‚Äôm glad I did‚Äîbecause if I had seen it beforehand, I might have had second thoughts. That said, I‚Äôm so glad we went through with it!

The play area is big, clean, and full of fun things to do. There‚Äôs plenty of space for the kids to run around without being on top of each other. One of the best parts is that parents can go in and play too, which made it a really fun experience for both kids and adults. Everyone had a great time!

The party room is definitely small‚Äîjust two picnic tables‚Äîso if you‚Äôre hoping for a full sit-down meal, it‚Äôll feel tight. That was our plan, and while it was a bit cramped, everything still worked out in the end.

Seriously, give yourself the extra time to set up, decorate, clean, and take things down. The time flies. Book at least 30 minutes before and after your party. Trust me, you‚Äôll need it.

The price is actually great‚Äî$500 for two hours. That‚Äôs already a better deal than a lot of similar places charging $700 for the same amount of time. So go ahead and add that extra hour or two and still come out ahead, with more time and a better overall experience.

Yes, the staff does give you a polite push to wrap things up when your time is up‚Äîbut it‚Äôs only fair since they need to get ready for the next group. They were all kind, helpful, and professional throughout.

Tip them in cash if you can‚Äîthey work hard and absolutely deserve it.

Highly recommend for a fun, energetic, and kid-friendly celebration.

Reviewer: Medgyne Lubin

Review: We had a great party celebrating our daughter's 2nd birthday at Boston Playground! The booking process online was easy and simple. They were open on a Monday holiday. We had a group of 40+. For large groups, I would recommend adding the additional hour so guests can have more time on the playground.

Here are the pros and cons:
Pros:
-The venue was very clean
-The venue accommodated our large group
-Tables, chair/bench and fridge was provided
-They allowed the freedom to decorate freely
- All kids age group 3-10 enjoyed themselves
- It was private to just our group

Cons:
-The venue was very cold, although we asked many times to have the thermostat increased
- the party room was on the smaller side, kids were able to sit at the tables but adults stood and overflowed into the hallway
- There was no host so you have to manage your own time and keep track of your 2 hours
- The pizza shop recommended for catering was not a great experience. Guests mentioned the pizza did not taste good. I would suggest ordering from your preferred pizza shop (we wish we did).

Overall it was a good experience and we would recommend to others looking for an indoor playground for a kid's birthday party.

However, the time was full of disappointment:

- Safety concerns all over the place. We have 5 toddlers in our group. But the place is lacking proper protections for all ages: the outlets are all exposed, the foosball table poles were broken...

The duration of this session was also very confusing, they allow you to add party package to get 30 mins more, which we expect to be two and half based on the website. Their staff cannot explain the rate at all so he has to call the ‚Äúboss man‚Äù to clarify it.

Only 2 sad looking tubes left for the slide (they used to have tons) No air conditioning and half the attractions taped off with caution tape.  Bathrooms out of order and the floors and tables are so neglected.  We used to love it but it's gross now.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Michelle Unterborn
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Sorry in advance for the long review.
I went to this establishment with some friends yesterday for their sons birthday. While the kids were jumping my friend and myself went to get a snack. She purchased a frozen banana and I was in line to purchase mine when she opened hers and bit into it. My friend immediately had to spit out the piece of banana as it had gone bad and was partially melted. I asked if I could open mine up before purchasing and the girl reluctantly said yes. That one was also partially melted and you could tell it had melted and refroze before that as it looked like when a candy bar melts and you put it in the freezer. I obviously did not purchase the banana, but they offered nothing to my friend who had purchased hers. The staff then started going through the freezer and realized half of the freezer was defrosted and had to throw away all of those items on that side. Now food regulations are not my specialty, but I don't see that the other half of the freezers items could have possibly been at food grade temp. All of the items should have been disposed of in the freezer. After that we purchased cards for the kids to play the arcade/ VR games. When my son got on to one of the VR games he said he couldn't figure out how to get it to work. I thought maybe it hadn't taken the card and swiped it again. It had taken the money off the card, now 2 times. It was at this point a young lady came over (mind you this was like 4 or 5 minutes later) and I was saying that we had swiped it and the money came off twice and we couldn't figure out how to get the machine to work. She then proceeds to explain that is because she has to release it. Apparently she was supposed to be working that section and helping everyone with the VR games. She begins strapping my son in and when she straps his feet in he asks if the ride goes upside down. She replied yes and he said no he didn't want to do that, so she let's him off. No offer to put back on the money or anything. There were multiple people trying to get on the VR rides and no one knew that there was even an attendant for that area. The attendant did have time to constantly be on her phone though. Lastly the group of kids were waiting to go into the laser tag game. They were waiting for the group ahead of them to finish because there were small kids in that group and they were trying to be polite because we had older kids. The attendant told them they could wait for their turn to finish. Our group sat at the tables by the laser tag while the other group played. Another group came up and was standing at the door and once the first group finished the attendant proceeded to let that group in. When my friend approached him asking why he had done that and asked for the manager or owner they said he wasn't there. My friend said she had just seen the owner a few minutes prior. The attendant then said "Oh you think just because he's Indian, he's the owner!?" My friend then proceeded to tell him NO she had known he was the owner because earlier that's what he had told her. The staff here are rude and will be the downfall of this establishment.
1. There should be a sign that states there is an attendant that sets up all the VR games.
2. Signs should be posted on games that aren't working so that people aren't swiping cards and not getting to play said game. (I seem a few kids swipe their cards on a game in the VR section before the "attendant" let them know it wasn't working)
3. There should be a waiting list for the laser tag.
4. The staff should be taught about temperature regulations on the freezers and they should be checked daily.
5. Being rude to customers should not be tolerated when it is not called for.

-----------------------

Review: We recently visited Flipzone Trampoline & Fun Park and were thoroughly disappointed with the condition of the facility. We arrived at opening and noticed several spills in the main entryway and throughout the building, which appeared to be left over from the previous day. The overall cleanliness was very poor, making the environment feel unkempt and uninviting. Several of the game machines were out of order, further limiting the activities available.

After visually checking the space, we made the decision to cancel our party reservation due to the lack of upkeep. While the concept of the park is great, the lack of maintenance and attention to cleanliness made it impossible for us to proceed with our plans. We hope improvements are made in the future to better meet guest expectations.

I love to go and let my daughter play while I sip my coffee and work on my laptop! The membership is an added bonus and very worth it! Lexi, the owner, is sweet as can be. Highly recommend a trip here!

Review: We took our Pre-K class from Windsor Academy to Giggle Town for our Last Day celebration. The children, the parents and the teachers had a fantastic time. The place was very clean and well organized. The children played for a solid 3 1/2 hours and never complained about being bored or ready to leave. They enjoyed the ball pit, each one of the play stations in busy town, the slide in the soft play area and the interactive game tables. The teachers enjoyed exploring and spending time with the children and the parents enjoyed getting to be kids again! I would recommend Giggle Town to anyone with children ages 2 to about 6. I would also recommend it to classrooms who are looking for a fantastic field trip opportunity. We are already looking at our calendar to book another visit for next school year.

Reviewer: Jessica Moreland
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 years ago
Review: My son LOVED Sprouts! We spent our full 2 hour session laughing and playing and we plan to go back in the next week. My son is 2 and Sprouts is perfect for the younger kiddos who can‚Äôt always enjoy typical playground equipment because they are too young. My son‚Äôs favorites were the ball pit and the slide. As a teacher, I also loved seeing all of the learning opportunities in the little town they have at Sprouts. They was a grocery store for shopping, a farmhouse, and a vet!
Everything was safe, clean, and super cute. There is also a separate area for crawlers and little ones who aren‚Äôt quite big enough for the larger play area. My son was exhausted after our playtime and took a nice long nap!
I also found the Sprouts website to be user friendly and I like their reservation system. Each session is 2 hrs with an hour in between so the business can clean up and get ready for the next play group. The women who checked us in was very friendly and helpful and even remembered my son from a birthday party he attended there over a month ago!
I will be recommending Sprouts to all my friends with little ones!!

We wanted to bring my son up for some play time on his first birthday and being a first time customer we called ahead to ask what we would need before we brought him up. We were told he just needed to have socks in order for him to play. We show up thirty minutes later and the lady at the front desk informed us that the session was about to end which we weren‚Äôt told about over the phone (I understand mistakes happen). When questioned The women we spoke with could not have been more condescending and unsympathetic toward my wife and made no effort to correct the error. My wife enjoys these type of places but unfortunately we will have to cross this place off the list.

Reviewer: Ciera Beardsley
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: The Playful Family has been a God send for our family! We are always greeted with a smile from the staff and owners when we walk in the door. It‚Äôs always clean and there‚Äôs lots of fun stuff for the littles to enjoy. From the play and sensory areas to arts and crafts, music, & special events ect. There‚Äôs always something fun going on. Ms. Loraine (sp?) is so friendly and creative and so good with the kids. We play there about 3 times a week and always have a great experience. I highly recommend the monthly membership that they offer!

I would also like to take an extra minute to share our latest experience with anyone that may need more convincing to join The Playful Family or anyone that may just enjoy a little inspirational story. One that has made us forever customers.

I have 3 sons. An 11 month old and 3 year old Twins, one of whom has Autism. He typically does great when we come play. We attended this Saturday and it was a bit busier than it typically is during the week. Even with his noise canceling headphones, he became a bit overwhelmed and had some pretty big meltdowns. Mainly due to things not being in their ‚Äúcorrect spot‚Äù while other kids were playing with them. I decided that we should probably head home and try again another day. That is when his largest meltdown of the day began. I became extremely overwhelmed trying to pack up 3 little ones that are never ready to leave The Playful family. While one twin was on the floor screaming, kicking and crying, my other twin was begging to do a craft before leaving. They were building and painting birdhouses for Fathers Day. My hands were so full between juggling the baby and trying to calm a worked up 3 year old. I apologized to my other 3 year old and explained that we wouldn‚Äôt be able to do the craft that day. That is when Ms. Franchescka (whom also happens to be the CEO, I believe) stepped in and offered to build and paint a birdhouse with Grayson. She was so kind and genuine. He was so happy and so proud of his completed birdhouse made with his new friend. It was time to leave and the meltdown was still going on. As I struggled my way towards the door with 3 kids. Ms. Franchescka and Ms. Nilsa both jumped up and offered to help us to the car with zero hesitation. One carrying the baby and one carrying a freshly painted birdhouse. Reassuring me over and over that I was doing a good job and that everything was ok. I was also reassured that there was no reason to apologize. While I apologized for the chaos more times than I can probably count.
I will never forget the kindness that was extended to myself and my children. It‚Äôs so refreshing to know that there are still kind and caring people in the world. Willing and ready to lend encouraging words and a helping hand in any way they can. We are blessed to have found that and more at The Playful Family! :)

Reviewer: Britny Kaminsky
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: We had my baby's first birthday party at Playpalz.  This was the first time I have ever spent money on a "venue" for a party.  Will I do it again?  maybe, all places for kids parties are about the same in price. Value for the price is so so.  I spent close to 500 for Party Room B.  The room was a nice size to fit all my guests and super clean and ready for me to decorate.  The party came with 15 drinks for kids and 2 pizzas.  Great if you are just planning on feeding kids.  If you are wanting to feed the grownups too then you will need to purchase more pizza and drink packages... I understand the reasoning for no outside food or drinks but I also find it silly that I have to spend 40 dollars for 40 waters that I could easily buy at walmart for maybe way less.  It was a Saturday so that place was insanely crazy as you can imagine but all the kids had a great time.  You are only allotted 90 minutes for party set up/ take down and party time.  I feel like it was a little rushed, decorations were taken down I feel like almost right after putting them up.  I think people should get a full 2 hours.  I brought my own decor but made sure it was all put together at home so that when I brought it in all we had to do was tape to the wall.  Brings me to my next point.  We were not allowed to thumb tac anything and could only use tape they provided (which was NOT good tape).  My decorations kept falling, which was very frustrating.  I was given a party host Chelsea.  Chelsea was phenomenal!  She helped we bring decor to the room, helped me put decor up, helped decorate the highchair, kept the party moving smoothly, handed out pizza, helped with cake, helped clean up after my baby after his smash cake.  She was my right hand man and I couldn't have done the party without her.  Thank you Chelsea, well deserved included gratuity.   I love playpalz and will always return for a fun play day but as for a party place I feel like there are cheaper options out there that allow you to bring your own outside food and drink for a longer party time.

Reviewer: Laura Schwindler
Rating: 2/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: To start, My child loved getting to play on the equipment they have and with their friends. They didn't want to leave at all, which is why I'm leaving 2 stars. I took off 3 stars because I did not see the value for the amount of money spent and I will explain why.
First reason: they only include 20 slices of pizza and 15 drinks [what the girl on the phone to confirm my party add ons said, even though their website states 20 drinks are included] for up to 25 guests and those 25 guests, include adults. You may not bring any outside food or drink, which is fine, but the amount charged for the food they provide is high. I added on a fruit tray [that was $60] because I wanted the fruit available for the kids and from my child's party last year, that was about what I spent on fruit for my own fruit trays and I wouldn't have to wash and cut it... the fruit tray that was brought into the party room was in a store bought container and was less fruit than what I spent $60 on last year, plus the very large strawberries were whole. For a place that has all ages of children, I find it incredibly odd that they did not at least half, if not quarter the strawberries. The high food add ons, that you're pretty much forced into, also contribute into my ire on my third reason.
Second reason: I paid for a theme add on and for that $30, I got a themed happy birthday sign, a stack of themed plates, a stack of themed napkins, & about 5 themed tablecloths. I did not get to keep any of those supplies and you could clearly see labelled boxes under the tables for other themes. It was also clearly outlined, that plates, napkins, tablecloths, & utensils were already included in the base party price.... I'm super confused on why the add on stated "come in to your party already decorated," when it was a sign and tablecloths and why the add on is $30.
Third reason: we had a party host included in the base price that was for "party set up, clean up, & to coordinate," that gets an automatic 5% gratuity added on to your final bill. I'm totally fine with the concept, but the execution was lacking. The host did the set up and clean up, but the only thing she did for "coordinating," was ask when she should have the pizza in the room. For a tipped position with coordinating the party as part of the position, I expected the host to actually have a timeline and help us stick to the timeline within the 90min we had the room for. She was nowhere to be seen part of the time and the other part of the time she was just in a corner of the room watching people. Actually making sure your parties are happening on schedule is important... We were supposed to have 10min before the party in our party room. We arrived exactly 10min before, to find the party room was not actually ready and it was past our party start time before we got to go back to it. I highly suggest coaching your host staff on giving parties a heads up when there's 30min & 10min left and leaving more time in between parties to accomodate for any running a little over, clean up, and so incoming parties actually get their 10min before their guests start arriving to get settled in.
Fourth reason: Overall customer service... I ran out of room to fully elaborate, but there were multiple times I was asked about adding their add ons and multiple times I had questions that were not answered. There was no guidance on where to finish paying for the party and despite asking for a receipt as I checked out, I still had to go back for it. The woman that did complete my transaction, did ask how the party was and did ask for feedback on what could be better; I was just too overwhelmed and tired in the moment to answer her then.
Fifth reason: the bathrooms are in the no shoes area and my partner immediately left the mens room and went somewhere else to use the bathroom.
Sixth reason: Included in the base price is a t-shirt and FREE return pass for the birthday child... We did not receive a t-shirt or any kind of voucher nor did we receive information on how we can redeem the return pass.
Please train your staff better.

Reviewer: Michelle Elich

Review: We are recent military transfers from California to the local area and we stumbled upon this venue one afternoon driving around trying to get a lay of the land! What a hidden gem! The owner allowed my little one to come in and preview/try out the play areas to ensure she would be comfortable and safe with this being a party venue for her 5th birthday and she fell in love with the place! The venue is perfect for those parents and kiddos who are leery of the traditional amusement park, arcades, and bouncy house places where not only you, but your children are overwhelmed and overstimulated by the sounds, flashing lights, and crowds of people running around! This venue gives you an opportunity to host a party where the kids can just be kids! And, the parents can relax because the staff is watching and assisting to ensure the kids don‚Äôt get bored, hurt, or feel left out! It was nice being able to enjoy mingling with the parents of other children, family, and friends without feeling like we were being pulled in a million directions/constantly interrupted! The owner was extremely accommodating and worked with me as I fluctuated between various details regarding the party! Not to mention they coordinated so many of the details and party planning that we just showed up with the cake, party favors, and a few other items and the rest was taken care of! I highly recommend this indoor playground not just for parties, but for those parents with last minute schedule changes that need some responsible adult supervision for their kids when you are in a bind! Drop ‚ÄòN Play is the Way!

Reviewer: Denise Infante
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I love bringing my two and three-year-old to this cafe. It's a place I frequently visit with my husband or other mommies. The atmosphere is very clean, and I always look forward to their delicious vanilla lattes and waffles! The staff behind the counter consistently greet everyone with smiles and work their tails off to serve us. The location is also low sensory which I appreciate as a former special education advocate.

While the location is a bit cramped, I believe this is partly due to families placing their belongings on the tables, which can limit space, especially for those who are dining. It would be wonderful if patrons could utilize the cubbies provided to help create a more enjoyable dining experience for everyone. Additionally, I think it would be beneficial if parents could take a more active role in supervising their children and encouraging them to return items to their proper places. My daughter loves playing in the kitchen area, but it often seems empty. Parents joining their kids on the slide should bear in mind that they move all the balls when they slide down. My son hit his head on the back of the slide because the balls had been removed from a parent sliding down.

I truly believe that creating a welcoming environment is a shared responsibility within our community. If you‚Äôre visiting, it would be wonderful if you could encourage your little one to practice responsibility. I also wish there were opportunities to explore memberships! Otherwise, great location!

Review: I enjoy bringing my 16 month old baby here during the week when it tends to be slow, however we brought her recently when there were more older kids running around. The kids were super rowdy, chasing one another around and pelting each other with balls both inside and outside of the ball pit (I got hit hard in the side of the head). They kept climbing up the slides and the parents were way more interested in socializing amongst each other than actually parenting their kids. An announcement was made regarding the kids' behavior, but unfortunately none of us could understand what was being said over the loudspeaker and nothing was done by employees OR parents when the behavior continued. We didn't feel it was safe for our baby to keep playing so we left after about an hour, which felt like a waste of money, as we usually stay for the full two hours. We love Playland, but it would be so much better if there were designated areas by age group, or at least if the rules of safe play were actually enforced. Also, after a few times of coming, we've never once seen employees disinfecting the play area, and as another reviewer mentioned, the baby changing table in the women's restroom isn't bolted to the counter, so it slides around if you have a squirmy baby. We'll still keep coming here, but I was disappointed by our most recent visit.

Reviewer: Karla Diana
Rating: 4/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I‚Äôve visited High-five Playhouse twice now and my son and I really enjoy it. My son recently had a birthday party there last weekend and we had overall a good experience but I do wish our party host told us to leave in a kinder manner. Our party was over at 12 and we were out of the play area by 12:15. The party room was completely empty by 12 pm. We were on the side where the chairs were by 12:15 gathering last minute things but by 12:20 our party host came to me and told us we had to leave now and was very rude about it. I understand that we were still in the building 20 mins after party time but we were not in the party room or play area whatsoever.. just on the side gathering things and putting kids shoes on. I would understand more if the facility was busier or if we were in anyone‚Äôs way but like I mentioned, our party room was empty and the next party hadn‚Äôt arrived yet. At 12:20 the building alone wasn‚Äôt even as busy as it was 30 mins prior. I‚Äôm really big on customer service and I wish our birthday party experience didn't end that way. I also wish they wouldn‚Äôt tell us to start packing up 15 mins before our party time ends which cuts us short of our 2hours that we have booked. I wish they had longer slots in between parties to avoid people from feeling rushed to leave.

Review: It‚Äôs a nice place, albeit a little small. I have a 2 1/2 year old and thought the place would be better suited for younger kids. There‚Äôs only one slide, and as expected, some parents are not keeping an eye on their kids, leading to kids climbing up the slide while 3 others are going down. The lack of supervision is not the fault of Unwind, but I do think they should have someone monitoring, instead of having 4 employees hanging out behind the coffee bar. There weren‚Äôt enough balls in the ball-pit/slide area.

Also, you HAVE to buy their socks. We went the Monday after their grand opening and nowhere was it listed that you had to buy their socks. On the way out, they do have a box where you can choose to donate your $4 socks so they can wash and resell. I kept mine. Check-in took forever, but it was only their second day of being open, so I hope they find a better and more efficient way of getting people in quickly.

FYI - they don‚Äôt have iced coffee.

UPDATE - so I wanted to give this place another chance. I went to their online site to book a ticket and was absolutely shocked on their new prices. $24.99 for TWO HOURS OF PLAY? I went six months ago and paid $16 for TWO HOURS. That is a $9 increase in six months. That‚Äôs a 56% increase in price. I was completely floored and astounded on how crazy expensive it got. Did they add new activities? Are they giving away stuff for free at the door? In 6 months, I don‚Äôt know what justifies that. They have outpriced themselves out of the indoor playground market.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-
While my kids enjoyed their play experience, I think charging $12.99 per child for one hour is very expensive, and there were no discounts for siblings.  Also, I felt their equipment was not as sturdy, especially in the baby/24 month area where the climbing thing was loose.

An employee came to me and brought a credit card reader and said ‚Äúwe forgot to charge you for the water, please pay.‚Äù I was shocked because I was frazzled as I was feeding my toddler while trying to watch my other kids. Reviewer: Chelsea Wooten
Rating: 4/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: The hive is very neat! This small town needed this after Polk county remolded the outdoor playgrounds. This is going to be a popular place on hot, rainy and cold days! This is a great indoor playground and has many sensory play area for little ones, plus a under 3 baby/toddler zone. They even have a semi private area that can be rented for parties. My 11 month old and 6 year each had there only spaces and had fun for hours. I also appreciate nit having to worry about big kids/teenagers running around and nocking into my child which is sometimes you find at parks and some of the larger indoor playground, jumping gyms.

There is different lanes for sensory and imagination play. Each of the 4 lanes are themed, under the sea, construction zone, outdoor/picnic, and house/doll. The only call out is we noticed the bottom baseboard in the lanes had a rough texture, so if not careful, could get a splinter. All the other boards in the place were smooth and laquered.

Something to note, we hadn't been before they moved the baby zone but talking to some parents, they voiced they didn't like how small it is now. The baby zone used to be where the party area is now. Parents were saying there was more room for them to run around and spread out. On the other hand I could understand the need for larger party area to accommodate larger parties. I didn't mind the baby area and we there on Sunday afternoon after the church crowd. The only thing I didn't like was the net gate used to act as a baby safety gate. Toddlers were climbing over it, under it and around it where it's only attached and hooked at the bottom. Looks broke. Would like to see a solid 3' wall with a swinging gate like at the entrance of the place.

There are a few adult games scattered about, table games like checkers, Jenga and chess. There are large yard games like corn hole, connect 4, tick tac toe.

There is plenty of tables with metal bar stool seats. I personally would have liked to see lower seating with back support that is more children friendly and more comfortable for parents to lounge while the kids play. However they do have two leather futon couches and 4 cushioned arm chairs towards the stage, set up in two living room style sets. There are also plenty of high chairs for babies and they looked clean!

The hive offers WiFi and a variety of refreshments and snacks. I had one of there nitro coffees (never had before) but was very good and creamy. The flavoring range is surprisingly amazing if you are willing to be adventurous and try new things. The also offer craft sodas, teas, and traditional coffee drinks you get at a coffee shop. There is ice cream, we got the waffle bubble and it was so yummy. So much ice cream for the $7. So worth it. There are snacks starting at $1, chips, gummies, dunkaroos, etc.

My daughter keeps asking me when we are going to go back again. Great hangout place, for. Both parents and kids. A little bit of everything for everyone.

-----------------------
