Reviewer: Sophia Henderson
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: **Theft- Odd Occurence**
This was a very unique experience if I must say so,odd behavior. First, I'll speak on the part room,it was not clean there were still pizza crust and crumbs or what not left behind from the previous party. The attendant oddly was not very attentive,not very engaged at all,however I will say towards the end they perked up,you could see a personality, I guess maybe it was just a long day. Overall the play areas were super congested,almost somewhat a challenge to move around,anyhow my kid enjoyed the playtime. Moving on one of my dear guest lost their wallet while over by the slides where the neated areas are. So he goes to report it and or to see if someone turned it in,luckily one of the young ladies at the front said her co-worker had just mentioned something about a wallet being found but she was not sure of what she did with it. Young lady at the front scans the floor and attempted to reach the girl via walkie talkie,no luck. Anyhow the girl who found the wallet appears and said yes she found one but gave it to someone,then she said well it was some lady and then proceeded to look for her(my guest is walking with her). The lady is found and states to the girl(worker) that the wallet you gave me was purple,see (proceeds to show the wallet). Ok so at this point I'm confused and clearly someone is lying because now the worker doesn't recall the color of the wallet
(brown mens wallet) nor anything else. Spoke with the lead(caucasian lady) up front with the short pixie cut. Security got involved,police were called and the tape was viewed,however oddly there was footage of every area surrounding to the left and right of the slide except for front view of the slide itself where the incident occurred,it was completely distorted,not visible.  Alright after all that,the wallet appears,one of the customers brings it to the front,the only thing left that was left in it was the ID. Ok so at this point there was nothing else we could do about it,note: the police officer did agree that the footage appeared to be altered.This just really ruined the time for myself and my parents at this point AND keep in mind it's only a 2hr party so they/ we practically spent most of the time with the staff/officers in reference to this issue,more money wasted!! Here is the kicker, today March 31,2025 someone from Newtopia called and said "hey we have a ziploc bag that you left behind with your business cards and etc"!  I am in complete disbelief. So you mean to tell me we went from,no wallet,to found empty wallet,to oh we found a bag you left behind with your cards in it,you can come get it! So he goes to get the bag from Newtopia AND they say well no,we can't give it to you,you will have to wait until the other lady is in tomorrow. A manager is requested and  he refused to come out to speak about the matter or release the remaining items.  This seems to possibly be some type of inside mess going on,maybe one of the workers had his things the entire time. I don't know however what I do know is there is definitely foul play here. I guess the thief felt bad and brought back everything but the money and credit cards,wow!! Needless to say I want be patronizing this establishment anymore. Ruined my time with my girl and guest with this foolery.

-----------------------

Review: Overall the concept is everything. Big open and lots to do to keep the littles busy. I gave it a mid rating though because in times like these cleanliness is truly next to godliness. The place is horrid filthy. It is utterly disgusting and crawling with germs. I know that germs are to be expected in most public kiddie play places but this place is performing very poorly. There is visible dirt, sticky spots, likely snot spots on lots of the toys. We stayed almost all day and had not seen a single employee clean or disinfect a single area. The little toy houses are so gross they need to just toss them out. The blocks were broken chewed through foam. I would think the owners would be checking in to ensure it‚Äôs being up kept since the idea is ideal for families especially me a stay at home mom who would‚Äôve been likely to visit regularly throughout the week to tire my littles. They need to close for a good week or two replace some things, do a deep cleanse, even get rid of some of the phone cuties that work there but aren‚Äôt working only playing in their phones not paying attention to anything. There were also visible dangers I noted with some of the moving equipment so I made sure to warn other parents and keep my babies away. Oh and not to mention there needs to be blockers put on the shooting ball games so kids who weren‚Äôt raised to not harm others are able to shoot the balls at other littles smh. Overall this could be a really good spot to visit but it needs a bunch of tlc immediately. The care seems to have left the building. We didn‚Äôt really partake in the party rooms or food bar area. The area wasn‚Äôt very clean either. And the same girls playing on phones not sanitizing or anything are back and forth from front register to that area. I didn‚Äôt see any employee hand washing going on. I wanna love this place because my babies did but lord knows I washed the heck out of them ‚Äúcheered‚Äù when we got home. Lol. Wishing this business more success attached to its care level.

There are 2 separate rooms for parties and they seem to have a lot of events going on to keep the fun going and different (like a ms Rachel meet and egg hunt). I would highly recommend this place to anyone. Yea its a little messy from kids playing throughout the day but that's to be expected... they're kids. It gets cleaned up nonetheless.

As a stay-at-home mom new to Easley, I was on the lookout for a place where my two toddlers could play and socialize. After some searching, I stumbled upon this family-owned treasure, and it has been a game-changer for us.

Kids Play and Caf√© isn't just a play area; it's a warm, welcoming community. The staff are incredibly friendly and always go the extra mile to make you feel at home. And those Lotus energy drinks? They're simply unbeatable. The caf√© itself offers an exceptional experience every time, with a menu full of delicious options, including vegan and non-dairy choices.

The events they host each month are another highlight, adding even more excitement to our visits. If my toddlers had their way, they‚Äôd move in!

Reviewer: Miranda Sofer
Rating: 5/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: This morning, my husband and I found ourselves staring at our two kids, feeling completely stumped on what to do with them. We live in Five Forks and have already checked off the Children's Museum and the Zoo. With the heat making the park a no-go and the age gap between our kids (6 and 2) complicating things, we needed a solution. In a moment of desperation, I googled ‚ÄúThings to do with kids in Greenville, SC‚Äù and stumbled upon Kids Play & Cafe in Easley, about 45 minutes away. The photos looked promising, but I wasn‚Äôt sure if it would hold their interest for more than five minutes. Still, I decided to give it a try.

Spoiler alert: It‚Äôs fantastic!

From the moment we walked in, I was impressed. We signed the waiver, paid the $30, and my kids eagerly ran off to explore. The space has plenty of spots to stash shoes and comfortable seating for parents to keep an eye on their little ones. The climbing jungle gym was a huge hit‚Äîit was designed perfectly for both my 2-year-old and 6-year-old, with various levels of difficulty. I was relieved to see that there were enough ways for kids to climb up and down without needing any help from the staff. Plus, there are several other areas specifically for toddlers to play safely.

I made sure the kids had a good lunch before we arrived, but the on-site cafe had a great selection of snacks, including organic Annie‚Äôs, candy, muffins, cupcakes, and drinks like bottled water, organic juices, and coffee. We enjoyed a cupcake, some Annie‚Äôs cheddar crackers, and a coffee while we were there.

The staff were exceptional‚Äîfriendly, attentive, and proactive. When my 2-year-old removed his socks, they quickly informed me he needed to get them back on or he'd have to miss out on climbing. Honestly, I appreciated the attention they were paying. Additionally, I noticed staff members constantly cleaning and tidying up, which gave me peace of mind about the cleanliness of the facility. After visiting other indoor play centers, I can confidently say this place surpasses them all.

An added bonus was the warm atmosphere created by other parents. Everyone seemed genuinely nice, and the kids quickly made friends. One child even helped my 2-year-old into the ball pit. It‚Äôs clear that this place fosters a great community.

If I had one suggestion, it would be to make the arcade games and cotton candy machine card-friendly. I would have easily bled $30-40 into those machines, but I rarely carry cash and didn‚Äôt notice an ATM on-site. A token system or card payments could be a great addition, but I understand the challenges with credit card fees for small businesses.

As for keeping an eye on your kids, you‚Äôll see a range of options. Some parents worked on laptops in centrally located tables, others relaxed on phones in cozy egg-shaped chairs or enjoyed massage chairs, while some simply found comfy spots to sit along the perimeter. I was more active since my youngest is a bit of a daredevil, but overall, it was a relaxing experience that properly exhausted my kids and provided a nice, quiet drive home.

I hope this review helps other parents considering the drive to Easley for a fun and engaging spot for their kids.

Review: My honest review
Not worth the money. ($22 per child end everyone has to have socks even adults who don‚Äôt plan to play $3 for socks..I paid $31 for one child and two pair of socks)

Online it seems like a lot of attractions but once there they only have a jungle gym and a small area to play with a ball (soccer). They have cars to drive around but it‚Äôs for small kids. My child is 9‚Ä¶.doesn‚Äôt care for that. I feel like it may be fun for children 6 and younger.

I didn‚Äôt like that we had to put our shoes in bins and had to carry the bins everywhere we went or put by our table if no more cubbies were available.

The food is a bunch of snacks you can but from the corner store or bring in yourself but they don‚Äôt allow you to. They have fruit snacks, chips, pudding, Oreo cookies etc and juice and soda. In their $7 snack pack you get a pb&j sandwich with a choice of two other snacks and a drink. Not worth it.

I honestly will not bring my child back until they have specials. It should be $15 socks included.

Reviewer: Arla Jay
Rating: 2/5
Time: a month ago
Review: I had my daughter‚Äôs birthday party on May 17th. It was a Saturday and never ever again will I have a birthday party here especially on a Saturday. They over booked. Everything was chaotic. Had i not have gone into the location to put some money down towards the party i would not have known they had me listed for 13 children and 13 adults and i actually had 19 and 19 my guest would not have been accommodated. Everything was so unorganized. My family and I set up my daughters entire party which that part was fine we didn‚Äôt mind doing that but we did basically host our own party other than going to get the things we did not have access to. I spoke with the regional manager a few days prior to my daughter‚Äôs party he assured me that they would have everything correct. I purchased additional play cards for each child in attendance and was not told until the party they had to put all of the flames on one card so i basically would have had to follow behind the children throughout the party to swipe the one card to be shared between 19 children. When i expressed that needed to be fixed i was told my party had to be paid in full. I paid with no issues which i told them was not a good idea in case they had to charge me extra for something or not charge me for a child not showing up or anything. But i paid as requested. They could not fix the issue with the play cards and my daughters party was coming to an end. I asked for a refund for the play cards and was told I had to wait 7-10 days to receive my money back when they could have just waited to fix the issue and adjusted my balance accordingly as I have had done at other places. There weren‚Äôt enough tables to accommodate my party size and we had to wait for another party to finish before we could get the extra table. When i tried to reach back out to express the concerns I had at my daughters party no one will respond to me now because they already got paid so I guess the urgency to call me back is non existent. On a positive note the staff was very friendly they really did try to help with the issues it‚Äôs just that the issue was not fixable by them so it was out of their hands. Jemya Kam Trey (i believe that‚Äôs his name) and Regina were all super nice and they really tried their best. There was also a female manager there that was also very nice and tried her best to accommodate. I will never have a party here again. It‚Äôs a great place for a play date but parties especially Saturday no way will never happen again.

Reviewer: Shayla Lord
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Great concept of a place, but having a birthday party here was not worth the price. Customer service was terrible from the confirmation call, all the way through the actual party.

There was no direction when it came to the check in process. No special line for birthday parties or any signs or anything. The staff were rude until I mentioned I was hosting a birthday party there, then all of a sudden her tone changed.

Party pricing makes no sense. It would have been cheaper to just pay admission for all the kids at $22 each, adults are free with their kids, and then buy them each a lunch set at $7, which also includes a game card. Instead, if you book a party you have to pay for ALL the adults AND infants (which are also normally free). And THEN you pay an upcharge for them to bring you Pizza Hut pizza, which was way late for us, everyone was starving and cranky by the time it showed up. We had 15 kids, which would have been $435 with normal admittance and food costs. Instead they wanted to charge us over $700 for the same people, only difference is there was pizza, drinks, and cake. You‚Äôre not allowed to bring outside food in, but their food is from outside sources. They don‚Äôt even have private party rooms, your tables are in the middle of everyone else so people are walking through your ‚Äúparty‚Äù the entire time you‚Äôre there. The party host doesn‚Äôt really do anything, we served our own food and drinks, cut the cake, lit the candles, etc. She came around every so often to pick up trash but that was really it. Chuck E. Cheese does a better birthday party than this place!

On top of all of that, this place was so crowded, and there were NO staff in the play area to supervise or anything. We noticed so many safety hazards. The kids all had fun but none of the parents were impressed by this place. Very disappointing.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Ryan Turner
Rating: 3/5
Time: a month ago
Review: The facilities are great for kids, but their waiver policy for adults is nonsensical, inappropriate, and invasive. I say this as an attorney with 16+ years of experience.

Kids Empire Jacksonville forces every adult, to include 82 year old grandparents, to submit personal emails (assuming they have one), phone numbers, and addresses, and sign a waiver (e.g. contract of adhesion) in order to SIT at a table and watch their grandchildren play.  These requirements for clearly non-participants is legally unnecessary, an invasion of privacy, and likely a stealthy money grab for personally identifying information which will no doubt be sold to a data broker as soon as granny exits the facility.

The point of a legitimate waiver is to guard against liability and potential personal injury suits. The policy of Kids Empire Jacksonville goes far beyond this rational purpose and seems to suit more nefarious purposes. I strongly recommend you reconsider visiting this facility and visit the Bravos Entertainment Center--a trampoline park near Bartam Park--who had a far more reasonable, legally permissible policy.

Reviewer: Ashley Brooks
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: In response to Curt Digla & Nordrissa Lewis:
I completely disagree with this review, as my experiences at this venue have always and consistently been the complete opposite. It‚Äôs clear that the reviewer had a frustrating visit, but many of their complaints seem exaggerated or based on misunderstandings.
First, calling this place a "glorified daycare" is unfair. It‚Äôs an indoor entertainment space designed for kids to have fun in a safe and engaging environment. The bounce houses, attractions, and activities are exactly what one would expect from a family-friendly venue.
It makes perfect business sense for certain attractions to be available only on specific days to encourage visits during slower periods (i.e. Wednesday)‚Äîthis is a common business strategy, not an attempt to deceive customers.
Regarding pricing, hosting a party at any entertainment venue comes with costs, and $416 for a birthday party that includes a dedicated space, play areas, and food is actually quite reasonable compared to similar venues. Pizza and Capri Suns are standard party offerings, and expecting gourmet options at this price point is unrealistic.
As for the cake, I don‚Äôt know of a single venue that includes cakes as part of the package‚Äîoutside cakes are clearly allowed, so all it takes is asking. However, last-minute issues can happen anywhere, and instead of escalating frustration, a simple check with staff could have clarified the situation.
The owners and their family members are PHENOMENAL, and their staff is professional. If a child was asked to remove a wristband, I have no doubt it was handled appropriately. The accusation of racial favoritism is not only unfair but also unfounded‚ÄîTHIS BUSINESS DOES NOT OPERATE ON RACIAL BIAS.
Additionally, the claim that the venue fabricates positive reviews is simply false.
Comparing this experience to renting a bounce house at home completely ignores the fact that not everyone has the space, time, or desire to host a party themselves. Many parents appreciate the convenience of an all-in-one venue where they don‚Äôt have to worry about setup, cleanup, or keeping kids entertained.
This review is overly negative and fails to recognize the value this venue provides. My personal experience, as well as that of many others, has been overwhelmingly positive.
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS VENUE TO PARENTS‚ÄîIT IS ONE OF THE CLEANEST, FRIENDLIEST INDOOR PLAY AREAS WE HAVE EVER TAKEN OUR LITTLE ONE TO. WE WILL BE BACK AGAIN AND AGAIN!

Review: I was searching for an indoor playroom in my area to take my nearly 20-month-old granddaughter and found Eve's Garden at the last minute when I had almost given up. I wasn't in the mood for the chaos of a trampoline park, but with the extreme heat, I knew we wanted to be indoors. From the moment we walked in, I was impressed by the safe, clean and fun environment. My granddaughter had an absolute blast, and to my surprise, my 11-year-old son enjoyed himself as well. They had air hockey, basketball, jumbo connect 4, an inflatable obstacle course, an interactive sand room and an interactive ball game room with a projector for him.

The variety of activities available kept both children entertained and busy. It took my granddaughter a little while to acclimate, but in no time, she was running around, laughing and playing! For this outing, I was specifically looking for a toddler-friendly space, ensuring she could have fun without the risk of being trampled by bigger kids. Eve's Garden perfectly fit the bill, and it was an added bonus that my son also had a great time. The music was amazing, and although we didn't partake because we had just eaten, I saw that they had a variety of snacks and drinks for purchase.

I've already recommended Eve's Garden to a dozen friends and family and can't wait to visit again when my granddaughter is back in town. The experience, staff, cleanliness and overall atmosphere were all top-notch. 10 out of 10!

Don‚Äôt get me wrong, they have things aimed for the older kids, it‚Äôs not just for toddlers. My 8 year old daughter and 9 year old niece had a blast there as well! There‚Äôs a really cool obstacle course kinda thing that they had a great time with. There‚Äôs an interactive sand table that‚Äôs one of the coolest things I‚Äôve seen for kids in a long time. Ok maybe not just for kids cause I did play with it too lol and there‚Äôs an air hockey table that took me back to my childhood daycare days.

Fun for the kids, easy on the parents!

As soon as we get in there are parents sitting in every seat. This event was on a time schedule and when it came time for them to ‚Äúsit down and have a special snack‚Äù that was a complete joke. I asked the gentleman SEVERAL TIMES if my daughter could have a plate with a snack and she never received it, she had nowhere to sit because management couldn‚Äôt tell parents to get out of the chairs designated for the children. Reviewer: Anna Moore
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I regularly come here during the week with my almost 2 year old. Today was the first time I came on a Saturday. It. Was. Awful. They take reservations on Saturday and Sunday to keep the crowd at a minimum (or so they say), but this place was a madhouse from the second I stepped in. Because all age groups of children are welcome here, there were teenagers and rambunctious pre-teens everywhere. Some of them were lifting up the panels at the top of the stairs in the playground creating a fall hazard. Others were underneath making barriers where other children couldn't pass. It was also impossible to let my daughter play on the trampoline part because of so many unattended children being wild. It was also difficult to keep up with my daughter because there were so many people standing around. I had told my sister about this place and she was there too with her 7 month old and two older children. I was honestly embarrassed that I had recommended this place. I left quickly because it wasn't worth putting my small child in danger due to overcrowding and unsupervised children. I will continue to come here on weekdays, but if you have any kid under 7 or 8 years of age, do yourself a favor and skip it on the weekends.

Reviewer: Mariel
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: It was fun until I broke my back!
I had fun at this park until I fractured two vertebrae of my spine! Long story short, there was an (unguarded, uncovered) foam pit which I jumped into in the dark, naturally, thinking it was safe. As I was in the air I realized there was NO foam in the pit and the ground was concrete. Between the height of my jump and my fall, I probably fell a total of 12-15 feet (the pit was seven feet deep‚Ä¶ I measured later on.) I am only alive by the grace of God alone. I could have died.
After the injury, an employee stuck her head over the edge of the pit and asked if I was ok. I could barely speak. I couldn‚Äôt move. She offered me her hand and attempted (unsuccessfully) to pull me out. (Back injury 101‚Ä¶ NEVER move the person.)
When I finally got out, the employee kind of just walked away and nobody at the park followed up, gave me ice packs,or called 911. My friends took me to the hospital.
The result of my injury was two fractured vertibre, eight weeks in a back brace, three rounds of physical therapy, and almost complete immobility for the first few weeks of the injury. It was the worst experimence of my life.
I came to the park with friends a week or two after the incident to see the scene of the crime, measure the pit (why not) and see if it was filled. It was still empty!! There was a girl guarding it who told me just that day, a little boy got back there and she had to rush to get him out of the area before he fell!
I recognize that this story is comedic. I mean who falls into a pit? But I just wanted to warn everyone about this place. It‚Äôs unsafe, the staff is not trained in injury prevention or recovery, and when I contacted the owners later on, they gaslit me and said it was MY fault. They said the had a video of a staff member telling me not to jump and me doing it anyway (funny, I don‚Äôt remember that happening. Why would I PURPOSELY jump into a pit). Don‚Äôt worry! They said no I could NOT see the video, hmmm. They also refused to help me with medical bills.
It should NEVER be possible for someone to fall in a seven foot deep pit with a concrete bottom.
If you or your kids go here, please be VERY careful.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Peter Ton
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: Go if you like spinal compression fractures:

Went here on Jan. 28, 2022 with a group of friends. I had a blast until one of them literally broke her back. Near the end of the night one of the members of my party accidentally bounced into an area of the park that was undergoing maintenance. It was a 7 foot concrete pit! Mind you she was jumping on a trampoline, so she didn‚Äôt fall from ground level, she fell from several feet ABOVE ground level. To be fair, there was a small plastic chain over the entrance, but my friend easily cleared this when she was double bounced in that direction. We‚Äôre estimating that she fell a distance of at least 12 vertical feet in total.

As a result, she suffered a spinal compression fracture that left her in a back brace for 8 weeks. When the injury occurred none of the teenage staff knew what to do, so thank goodness she had friends there who could take her to the emergency room. Not before a well-meaning employee offered my friend her hand and attempted to help her up, however. Word to the wise, if you‚Äôve suffered a spinal compression fracture DO NOT MOVE, it‚Äôll make things worse. In hindsight we should have called 911 and waited for the professionals to put her on a stretcher, but neither we nor the staff knew that at the time.

I wish I was making this up, but my friend is now half an inch shorter and very familiar with her local physical therapy center.

In the interest of fairness, nobody wanted my friend to fall into a 7 foot concrete pit. It even had a little chain and sign. I would argue however, that at a trampoline park, it shouldn‚Äôt be possible to do so. Laws of entropy kind of dictate that masses of bouncing people will eventually land in untended places. I shouldn‚Äôt have to spell out the need for safety nets or protective barriers to the owners of a trampoline park‚Ä¶

Aren‚Äôt there building codes for this kind of thing? Thankfully the victim this time was a 21 year old with fully developed bones. I shudder to think of the consequences if a child had fallen that distance.

Edit: the first picture shows my friend standing in front of the pit a week after the incident. The 7 foot drop had been covered with a red tarp. Notice how dark the area is? The second photo is a clearer view of the pit, and my friend‚Äôs back brace!

Review: I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this place. It‚Äôs a sensory-integrated, inclusive play space and it truly shows in every detail.

My boys had an absolute blast! They loved making stained glass during art class, building in the giant block room, swinging on a variety of swings, and sliding down the wooden roller slide (a favorite!). The foam pit, gross motor toys and chairs, and even a bubble dance party kept them entertained the entire time.

Everything is thoughtfully designed to support different sensory needs while keeping it super fun and engaging. It‚Äôs clean, well-organized, and full of exciting activities.

The owner, Kimberly, is incredibly kind and passionate about creating a space where all children feel welcome and included. Her warmth and care really set this place apart.

We will definitely be back. Highly recommend Sensory Town for any parent looking for a fun, safe, and inclusive play experience!

Reviewer: Juliana Depablo
Rating: 1/5

Review: Owner and/or representative of Sensory Towne, Kimberly provided a unsatisfactory customer service. On Sunday 07/14, I took my daughter to this place to explore it and see if it was a good fit for her. During the registration, a calendar listing all the activities the month of July was provided.
2 days later Tuesday 07/16 at 10: 30am, Per Sensory Towne schedule, my nanny took my daughter to her very first class. After 30 minutes driving to Sensory Towne, they have informed my nanny that the class was not going to happen until noon becuase they have another event scheduled. This demonstrates a lack of professionalism and communication on Sensory towne's representatives. I told them I was not satisfy with the service they were providing on the very first day of service and I did not wish to proceed with them, and Kimberly said that I had a membership of 3 months that I could not cancel. However, they never deliver what they promise in their mission statement, neither they deliver the services they said they offered in their "membership".  "Our mission is to help provide sensory resources for families of all children that will help refine their ability to respond to sensory experiences; nurture, and improve upon their overall childhood development and social skills.  We believe that all children should play together and learn from one another.
Sensory Towne believes in using education and play to provide a safe and inclusive environment for all children and families to enjoy no matter what their ability. We provide an array of services to provide both a recreational and educational learning experience for all families. We connect families with resources and help families get the resources they need."

Reviewer: Brittany Hodges
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We have been a couple of times. It is definitely a fun time for the kids and they always have a blast! It feels clean too, so I think the stars are warranted. However, I do have a couple of issues:

1. The price. We paid $77.40 for my four kids to play (plus socks), one of them being under 1 year old. They do charge for infants 6 months and older, for which I feel is poor taste. Most places do not charge infants for a ticket for entry. They do require the parents to wear socks even if the parent isn't going to be playing. So that's even more money that you'll have to be paying. I could literally have taken my kids to marine land for less because they don't charge for kids under 4 y/o. I just feel like with this economy, only the wealthy can really afford to come to a place like this which is so sad. I know they will say that everywhere charges the same, but that's simply not true. We have been around the block and have tried lots of other indoor play places.

2. They have toys laid all around in the check-in area for purchase, within hands-reach of little ones. Naturally they are going to be excited and want to look. But the owner immediately confronted my kids for picking up the toys as soon as we walked in the door. Their expectation is that the children are not to touch any of the toys on display. I can understand this, but perhaps it might be helpful to keep them out of arms reach if this is the expectation as it's very unrealistic to expect children to not want to check out all of the neat things!

3. I am not trying to be mean because that's not my intention, but the owner is VERY helicopter-like as soon as you arrive... Barking orders at you and your children, reciting all of the rules in rapid-fire sequence, correcting your children, reading the policies, asking questions, grabbing your payment info, having you sign waivers, and trying to get you to sign up for a membership, all at the same time, before you've even walked into the play area. There was just so much going on, all while I was trying to keep an eye on my 4 kids and make sure they didn't touch anything! I am a pretty calm person in general, and I understand needing to have rules, but I could feel my blood pressure rising during this bizarre interaction. It was very intense! Be prepared for that. It was exactly like that both times we have been. I do realize that it could have been our personalities just clashing too, but perhaps my perspective could help some as I'm sure I'm not the first person to have felt this way.

4. I called beforehand about 10 minutes before to see if they were busy as it was spring break week. I was told that it was "not too bad". When we got there, after we checked in, I heard them turning another family away because they were now at "full capacity" even though that family prepaid for their spots online. The place was completely jam packed. I felt this was a little deceptive of them. Had we known how crazy it would have been inside, we probably wouldn't have come.

Don't get me wrong, the kids love it here. But I feel that it is also important for the parents to have a peaceful, pleasant experience, especially for the money we are paying. I hope my review is helpful to other parents who are curious about this place.

Time: Edited 2 years ago
Review: As a parent of an energetic 2 yr old, I can‚Äôt express how thrilled I am with this indoor play area! It‚Äôs an absolute gem for both kids and parents alike. The facility is thoughtfully designed, with multiple play areas that cater to different types of sensory stimulation. Whether it‚Äôs climbing, sliding, or imaginative play, there‚Äôs something for every little adventurer.

What sets this place apart is their commitment to creating a wholesome experience. The monthly activities organized for the kids are a fantastic addition. It keeps things fresh and engaging, ensuring there‚Äôs always something new to discover. And let‚Äôs not forget about the genius late-night sessions! Finally, parents can have a well-deserved date night while their kids have a blast in a safe and supervised environment.

The staff here deserves a special mention‚Äîthey are friendly, attentive, and truly understand the needs of young children. The cleanliness and maintenance of the play area are top-notch, giving parents peace of mind.

Overall, this indoor play area gets a resounding four-star rating from me. It‚Äôs a haven for children‚Äôs play and a sanctuary for parents‚Äô sanity. Keep up the excellent work!

Reviewer: Kristina Becerra
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Such a good experience for us that I have to post a review because I want to see this business thrive. I believe this location is new; it was certainly new to us and I‚Äôm so glad they are here because we need more indoor play places near Columbus. Funtastic is an indoor play place good for ages 1 (infant crawlers and even new walkers) through 12 and has areas sectioned off according to age. One of the selling points for us is how open the play area is so you can almost easily spot out your kids no matter where you were seated (another win, some places we have been to don‚Äôt have the kind of set up to easily supervise your kids). We just happened to not only be there at opening time but at a good time where there wasn‚Äôt too many kids there to play so space to play/run around was good. The facility was clean (this includes even the restroom) AND well lit so another win. Again we were there shortly after the play area was open for the day but we saw staff actively clean/sanitize when they could. Towards the end of the time (90 minute play time per play pass) we were reminded we could also extend our time if need be which is enforced based on the color wristband we were given at the beginning. I had to point out to the staff (who were not only helpful, they were polite and professional) I really appreciate that system. We will certainly be back when we are in the area.

Reviewer: Meriah Roy
Rating: 4/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: Very nice space to rent for a party. The owner is so helpful at the start and not having to worry about clean up is fantastic. There is plenty of toys for all the kiddos to enjoy and the cutest little areas set up for eating.

There are two things that for me, keep at from 5 stars. One of which is the bathroom situation. I personally am not comfortable with a multi stall, unisex bathroom and neither were any of my guests. This resulted in a lot of time knocking to ensure the opposite sex wasn't in there and could be easily solved with a lock on the door so it could be single use.

The second thing, that I am grateful my parents stumbled on before any children was that there were multiple LGBTQ books. Myself as well as our entire group are Christians and do not believe in things like that being taught to young children (no different than if there were sex education books) For a place like this I wouldn't have even thought there'd be books like that. I assumed ABC books, colors etc. Luckily my parents saw them, and put them up for the duration of the party, but if you are Christian or simply so not believe those are age appropriate books, it was simple enough to move them for the party. Less simple however, if you go for open play.

Overall though, great space and would recommend:)

-----------------------

Time: 11 months ago
Review: Friendly, kind, welcoming, helpful, accommodating, and so CLEAN! I was in a pinch to have my daughter‚Äôs 4th birthday party since  the weather changed suddenly to rainy and we were supposed to have the party at the lake. We are actually from Florida and are just in the area visiting family for the summer but aren‚Äôt familiar to Maine much at all. But I saw the reviews and it sounded perfect. I called and left a voicemail and the owner called me back within a few minutes. She informed me that there was availability and she was so sweet and accommodating. We arrived and had the best time! I love the little details she put into making the space fun, interactive, educational and relaxing. I felt safe letting my kiddos run around and play- not worrying about if they could get hurt or if I couldn‚Äôt see them. There was even a little spot in the back that had snacks, drinks and even coffee! If I lived nearby I would absolutely come here often with my littles. Great place to mingle with other parents, play with your kids on a rainy day, or even sit down and use the WiFi to get some work done while the kids are entertained. I cannot recommend this place enough and I hope her business thrives! *Woman/ mother owned and operated! ü´∂

Review: It was a nice place, a big room to play around,  my son's liked it. However, there were two items that were broken. There is a slide with multi colored bolsters  and the green slide in the back. The slide in the back had a crack towards the bottom, so it was covered with tape. The tape started to come up and someone notified the employee but really didn't do anything about it. I let her know about the bolsters slide, that one of them is broken and a child could potential fall and  hurt themselves. Hopefully they will fix it. Other than that, it was clean, and we will give it some time to come back so those issues can be fixed or replaced.

Reviewer: Alexis Fromm
Rating: 4/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: I had been wanting to take my son here for a while, but was nervous about what to expect, since he isn't walking or talking. I decided to check it out on a Friday afternoon. We arrived around 2:30 pm and found a parking spot in the parking lot. When I walked in, I was greeted warmly by a young woman at the register. I was able to get registered and pay $15 for the visit. We put our backpack and shoes in one of the cubbies lining one side of the lobby. They had snacks, drinks, and merchandise for sale. The gated play area is huge, with a variety of play areas and equipment, including a jungle gym, kidkraft playhouse, climbing wall, rope climbing net, swings, and the most popular of all, a Zipline that all the kids wanted to play on. We started at the area with the puzzles on the wall, then worked our way to the toddler fenced area. There were quite a few kids of all ages playing, but we didn't feel trampled on nor did my son react negatively to having kids near him. His favorite things turned out to be the puzzle wall, the light up fish tube in the back, and the pots and pans at the kidkraft playhouse. I ended up meeting two parents that were super friendly and helpful, and my son surprised me by playing ball with both of them, which he never does with strangers. I felt relieved that my son fit in with the kids and that I wasn't alone in having a special child. Most gyms I have felt anxiety because my son isn't like the other children of the same age, but I felt at home here. Thank you to the staff and parents for this welcoming experience, and I hope to be back with him soon!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Nadine Ebri
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 days ago
Review: My daughter absolutely loves playing at the Play Jungle, but what I appreciate even more is how kind the staff are and how incredibly clean the environment is. I‚Äôm usually very hesitant to visit indoor playgrounds because so many of them feel unsanitary and poorly maintained. This one is different. It‚Äôs spotless.

I sat for two hours during one visit and watched the staff clean nonstop while the kids played. Every time someone got up from a table, it was immediately wiped down. If crumbs hit the floor, they were vacuumed right away. I‚Äôve never seen a place take cleanliness this seriously‚Ä¶ I love it.

What makes the Play Jungle even more special are the people, especially Ms. Miranda and Mr. Raheem. My daughter always looks forward to seeing them. Ms. Miranda never brushes her off. Instead, she takes the time to talk to her behind the counter which makes my daughter smile every time.

I‚Äôve also noticed that whenever a child is upset, Ms. Miranda is quick to respond. Whether it‚Äôs offering a toy, a balloon, or just a kind word, she goes out of her way to make sure every child feels cared for. She‚Äôs always walking around, watching attentively, and doing what she can to make each kid‚Äôs experience better.

This place is small, cozy, and truly family friendly. The level of care and attention they give makes all the difference.

Review: ‚ú® A Truly Magical Unicorn Party Experience! ü¶Ñüéâ

I recently hosted my daughter‚Äôs unicorn-themed birthday party at my friend and neighbor‚Äôs indoor play yard, and it was absolutely magical! From start to finish, everything was completely stress-free. The team paid close attention to every detail and made sure both our family and party guests felt cared for and celebrated.

They provided everything‚Äîfrom food, drinks, cupcakes, and d√©cor to customized party favor bags to thank our guests. All I had to do was show up, greet our loved ones, and enjoy the day. It was truly a 10/10 experience!

The indoor play area itself is fantastic. It features age-appropriate play zones and themes for toddlers through older school-age kids, making it a perfect choice for mixed-age parties. The space is fully air-conditioned, which is a lifesaver during the hot Florida summer, and it‚Äôs a great solution for letting the kids burn off energy while staying cool and safe indoors.

Plus, it has Wi-Fi and a snack bar, which made it easy for parents to relax and enjoy themselves too!

I wholeheartedly recommend this venue to any parent looking for a stress-free, joy-filled, and unforgettable celebration. You won‚Äôt be disappointed!

Review: The experience was average. We arrived before 10am and stayed for a couple of hours.

The water table, toy selection, and indoor play set were amazing. We loved seeing such a selection upon arrival.

Where we ran into some hiccups were with the cleanliness. Both in the space itself, and with the volume of toys out.
It felt like the space could use a good sweep/vacuum/mopping. The play area is sock/barefoot only and we left with very dirty socks/feet. There were crumbs on the floor, under toys, and under furniture. I spent time picking up while my youngest was finding and trying to eat the crumbs while exploring.
We dealt with a bit of overwhelm/overstimulation, as the space wasn‚Äôt picked up during the couple of hours that we were there. Other play spaces that we‚Äôve visited are frequently picked up by a staff member to try to avoid the overstimulation that can happen. This just really elevates the experience, and seems to help children explore and imagine in a space.

This is the most we‚Äôve ever paid to access a play space, and for the dollar amount paid we just had higher expectations.

It‚Äôs a nice thing to have in the area, but we won‚Äôt be back and I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôd recommend it to our friends.

Reviewer: Sarah Snoots
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: You know when you meet up with a mom friend at a playground or park and you're like oh, it's going to be great to catch up while our kids play, but then you realized you're just waving at each other from across the park? This is not that place. This is the place where you can actually talk with friends while your kids play. I've never experienced anything quite like it. I'm so sad I was only in Jacksonville to visit a good friend, because we have nothing like this in the DC area that I've found.

The layout is perfect. Clear sight lines throughout, comfortable couches for parents and caregivers, snacks, drinks, I mean, it really does feel like you're at your best friend's house except it's always being cleaned by a cleaning fairy. Spill? Gone in seconds. Thinking 'oh boy that water feature isn't going to end well!' but wait, they already thought ahead and put waterproof smocks out. Like all the preplanning you have to do as a caregiver has already been done for you. They have a toddler sized toilet!!!!!!

The toys and stations must have been selected by some parenting guru/magician, my child was entertained and could have been for hours and hours. They've been begging to go back "to nestleen!" and doesn't quite get that DC to FL isn't just a jump in the car kind of trip.

We love The Nestling Collective, I wish we lived closer. Everyone I was introduced to was so kind, funny, and welcoming, it was like I'd known them for all of parenthood. My child can't wait to go back and visit and neither can I.

Review: Sometimes I think I spend more time here than at home. The more time I spent there, the more I knew I couldn't let it go. There are so many things I love about this space.
It feels like hanging out in your best friend's living room. It's a
big open space with comfortable seating, and play stations interspersed around the room.
The regulars are wonderful people. We don't have family in town, but I've created a little community and traded numbers with many people I met at The Nest. Every time you walk in there is a friendly face waiting to say hello.
And speaking of friendly faces...the owner and staff are incredible. They're moms too, and it's obvious from the level of thought and care they put into this space. They're constantly cleaning, organizing, planning activities.
Have I mentioned the activities? There is something new to do every day. I do pretty OK with planning kid activities but they take it to the next level with creative sensory bins and tactile activities.
Go. You'll be so glad you did.

Reviewer: Emir Flores
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I recently had the pleasure of visiting The Nestling Collective, and it was an outstanding experience! This play space truly prioritizes the holistic growth and intellectual curiosity of children. The stimulating environment is designed to promote cognitive development through a range of enriching experiences that captivate and engage young minds.

The early learning classes offered are phenomenal, providing children with the foundational skills they need in a fun and interactive way. The educators are passionate and dedicated, ensuring each child receives personalized attention and support. The space itself is safe and supportive, allowing parents to feel confident in their child's well-being. The water play table and the STEM-themed fort at the center of the play area are standout features that encourage hands-on learning and imaginative play.

What sets The Nestling Collective apart is their thoughtful inclusion of a lounge area for adults. This space is perfect for parents to relax and connect with one another while their children explore and learn. The sense of community here is truly special, with regular community events that bring families together and foster strong relationships.

Additionally, The Nestling Collective is an excellent venue for birthday parties. The staff goes above and beyond to create memorable and enjoyable celebrations for kids of all ages.

Overall, The Nestling Collective is a fantastic resource for families seeking a nurturing and stimulating environment for their children. The combination of enriching experiences, a supportive community, and dedicated staff makes it a top choice for early childhood development. Highly recommend!

The venue is perfect for those parents and kiddos who are leery of the traditional amusement park, arcades, and bouncy house places where not only you, but your children are overwhelmed and overstimulated by the sounds, flashing lights, and crowds of people running around! This venue gives you an opportunity to host a party where the kids can just be kids! And, the parents can relax because the staff is watching and assisting to ensure the kids don‚Äôt get bored, hurt, or feel left out! It was nice being able to enjoy mingling with the parents of other children, family, and friends without feeling like we were being pulled in a million directions/constantly interrupted! The owner was extremely accommodating and worked with me as I fluctuated between various details regarding the party! Not to mention they coordinated so many of the details and party planning that we just showed up with the cake, party favors, and a few other items and the rest was taken care of! I highly recommend this indoor playground not just for parties, but for those parents with last minute schedule changes that need some responsible adult supervision for their kids when you are in a bind! The owner was extremely accommodating and worked with me as I fluctuated between various details regarding the party! Not to mention they coordinated so many of the details and party planning that we just showed up with the cake, party favors, and a few other items and the rest was taken care of! I highly recommend this indoor playground not just for parties, but for those parents with last minute schedule changes that need some responsible adult supervision for their kids when you are in a bind! Reviewer: A
Rating: 3/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Little Valley Play Cafe has a lot of potential, I feel the space they're in very much limits that potential. I took my little one here to try it out. The front desk area is tiny making it difficult for everyone to both check-in + grab your shoes (they make you put your shoes in a small cubby at the front upon arrival) as you're trying to leave. I do love that it's gated at the entry so no kid can escape. I did not feel the staff I encountered was very friendly. I had trouble opening the gate and she didn't help but another patron did. I do not like that they don't allow you to bring in your own food. I already pay for coming there, I don't want to buy the snacks you have. I don't eat lots of the ingredients in these foods and snacks and I don't want a dessert coffee every time I go. I like the idea of the cafe, I do understand it needs to be profitable, but my family doesn't eat what they serve. Makes it hard when other indoor playgrounds we can bring food in and eat at their designated tables. I don't like that so much of the space is taken by tables and chairs for parents. A lot of parents were sitting at the stools by the wall watching their kids. And then they leave their left drinks on that wall which leaves the drinks open for little kids to come and drink from them before their parent can stop them. I also didn't like that in order to go use the restroom you have to wear your socks. I'd like to be wearing shoes when I go in a bathroom... That's gross. And then any germs from the bathroom are now on socks that are walked around in the play area. I will say that bathrooms were pretty clean when I visited which is very necessary and appreciated. The themed play stations were great, my little one loved them. I love how creative they were designing that. I did not love that a good chunk of space was taken up for a party area. I just don't see how this space was a good choice for an indoor playground. I think this place could be amazing with some improvements. Customer service is very important and employee/owner attitudes I feel set the tone overall. I look forward to watching this place improve and hopefully grow.

Reviewer: Elisabeth Fouts

Review: First the helpful things to know, then I‚Äôll give you the reason for my 5-start review :)
1. Check the hours and get there early. They often have a line outside to get in and they reach capacity often.
2. Be sure that the kids and guardians wear or bring grippy socks. If you don‚Äôt have any or forget, they do sell them there for a very reasonable price.
OK, now onto the reason for my review.
I can‚Äôt say enough great things about the Little Valley Play Cafe and the staff! I went to a birthday party here and everything was magical! The staff arranged for all the decor and the food and of course provided a very clean, safe space to play. I enjoyed playing with the kids in the play areas at first. Then sat by and watched as they continued, while I sipped a delicious latte from their coffee bar. It‚Äôs so much easier to keep an eye on the kids with their open floor plan and safety gate. If you have or care for kids under 6, this place is a must. Great for birthday parties, rainy or cold days, or any day really. Whenever you go, you and the kids will be in for a real treat!

Reviewer: Haley Johnson
Rating: 5/5
Time: 8 months ago
Review: Yes, I'm posting a picture of the shelf in the bathroom. Why?

Because today, when I took my toddler to play and stepped into the restroom, what I saw captured everything I'd felt since we came through the door.

At Little Valley, I truly felt that my son and I were so welcome exactly as we are. It is CLEAR that this place is run by fellow mamas; every little detail has been considered! The layout is designed so caregivers can watch their little ones while they sip delicious drinks--and by the way, those drinks are hand-delivered to you, so you don't have to take eyes off your child.

But back to the bathroom shelf. Here you see tampons, baby wipes, breath mints, dental flossers, doggy bags (iykyk), and more. They've stocked everything a mama might need to take care of herself AND her baby in there, and they've done it in a way that is more beautiful than it has to be.

I knew I was taking my baby for a treat today. I just didn't know I was giving myself one too. We can't wait to return.

Similar play places I‚Äôve seen often let babies 1 and under in free if they have a paying sibling. I paid $14 to let my barely 1 year old simply walk around and not play with any of the equipment as it‚Äôs all too big for him.

So I had to pay $30 total for my 3 year old to play for an hour and my baby to walk around freely.

If you‚Äôre a neurodivergent parent, you already have short funds with therapies and everything else you have to pay.

Rating: 5/5
Time: Edited 5 months ago
Review: Today was my 2 year old son‚Äôs first visit here, and I have to say, we‚Äôve been to every play place in Knoxville, and this one is by far the best. It is spacious, clean, and designed with a strong focus on gross motor skills. We played for 2.5 hours, and my son still didn‚Äôt want to leave.

One of the things that stood out the most was the level of cleanliness. Throughout our visit, a staff member was constantly walking around, tidying and cleaning without being the least bit disruptive.

It was such a stark difference from other play places here in Knoxville where the mess can feel overwhelming and incredibly overstimulating!

Here, everything felt so well maintained and organized, making it a joy to play without stepping over clutter or navigating through chaos.

The gated play area was another huge highlight. This is the only play place we‚Äôve been to that is fully enclosed, and it gave me so much peace of mind to let my son explore freely. They also have a dedicated fully gated area for babies and toddlers, which is an absolute game changer. I so wish this place had been around when my son was a baby.

That feature alone deserves five stars in my book.

Overall, this place was incredibly clean, thoughtfully laid out, and packed with fun. We had an amazing time, and I can‚Äôt wait to come back.

I  called a couple of times To see if someone was inside, but the phone kept going to voicemail (at like 11 AM) I drove around to this mysterious door and did not feel comfortable taking my daughter in so I didn‚Äôt. IMO, this is not a professional place where you take your child. I didn‚Äôt feel comfortable, Didn‚Äôt like the location, and wasn‚Äôt a fan of the non-responsiveness. I got excited about having this kind of facility, but I realize this is not what I‚Äôm looking for. I won‚Äôt be back and won‚Äôt recommend it. Reviewer: Tori Scott
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 days ago
Review: This is a hidden gem! I have been wanting to come here with my two children, who have ADHD & different levels of Autism, my son, who is 11, and my daughter, who just turned 6, since they opened. We never had a chance to visit until yesterday (Saturday, June 28, 2025) when we were invited with some friends who are members. My oldest had a blast with the arcade games, the climbing areas, and just being indoors in general in a safe environment to help escape this heat. The facility is card only, which was no issue for us, thankfully. The machine to dispense the game card even took tap to pay, so my son was able to use some Apple Cash he had to load a new game card.

Francine was very helpful when checking in with explaining the waiver, the process since it was our first time, and swatting any of those pesky flies that snuck through the door. They didn't get far because Francine was on it in the lobby, swatting left and right, taking out those summer nuances. Liz with the killer nails (can't wait to see what design she has on our next visit) helped when we needed to check out from the snack bar, which I was very impressed with the selections that are offered. She is very personable and a great asset to the front desk. Kyrsten knew exactly what I needed on this 100 degree day when I ordered a fountain Sundrop because she came in clutch, offering extra ice! I was like, Yessssss please! I was praising the facility already, and they told me where to leave the review, so here I am!

Plum Krazy Play is now a staple in our neurodivergent family! Not only because it is a safe place I can let my children play inside with added sensory play when needed, I can get a fountain Sundrop, AND I can get some adult interactions in.... I say sign me up! We are discussing membership as a family and looking at all the calendar events, including Sensory Wednesday, which is probably going to be the first time I bring my daughter. Can't wait to come again!

As an added bonus, the facility is a Pok√©mon Gym if anyone plays Pok√©mon Go ;)

Reviewer: madison cheeves
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: ‚≠ê 1 out of 5 stars

We visited this indoor playground recently, and unfortunately, it was a very disappointing and concerning experience. The facility was noticeably dirty ‚Äî floors, equipment, and play areas all felt poorly maintained. To make matters worse, staff were mostly standing around, not engaging with kids or actively monitoring the space.

A major red flag: we found a vape on the ground inside the children‚Äôs play area. This is completely unacceptable in a space meant to be safe for young kids.

But the most upsetting part is that a few days after our visit, my daughter developed hand, foot, and mouth disease. She‚Äôs not in daycare and hasn‚Äôt been around any other children recently, so we‚Äôre confident this is where it came from. Illnesses happen, but in this case, it really feels like a direct result of a lack of proper sanitation and oversight.

This place has potential, but until they make serious improvements to cleanliness and safety standards ‚Äî and actually supervise the space ‚Äî we won‚Äôt be back.

Reviewer: Oresha Peete
Rating: 3/5
Time: Edited 3 weeks ago
Review: A great place for all ages. We celebrated my daughter's birthday who turned one year old. While I appreciate the inclusions for the birthday party package ( drinks, fruit snack, bring your own food, 3 hr party, etc) I have some feedback/concerns:
1. Each child at the party is given "flames" for games and ride but they put EVERYONE'S flames on one card. A savings for the company but an inconvenience for the host and guest.
2. "Unlimited" drinks are 2 liters but they provide small cups. So bring your own. Another savings for the company but an inconvenience for the host and guest. Individual cans/bottles would be preferred. Especially for the water, instead of 1 gal bottle.
3.  Several older kids kept coming into the toddler area. They were fully staffed, most of them positioned behind the counter. Only one birthday party in session (mine) but no employees even attempted to regulate the toddler area.
4. I booked the morning party time (10:30am) with hopes to have first access to a clean toddler area. It was very noticeable that the surfaces/floor was not clean. Therefore in my opinion the cleanliness of the ball pit is questionable. I would have rated this place at least a 4 but had to deduct another star due to cleanliness. Cleanliness and safety should be their priority especially if they are providing a service for children.

However, the staff was friendly. Music selection was enjoyable. Thank you Bryant and Christie. They let me use an extra table for my party. Bryant was always checking on us.

Reviewer: Jake Sommermeyer
Rating: 5/5
Time: Edited a week ago
Review: Edit: They put the layout back and it's so much better! Sitting out of the way of the kids is great. The adults can watch the kids and still have a conversation now. Changing my review back to 5 stars where it belongs ‚ù§Ô∏è

We used to go to Glow Worm with our 2 year old all the time and it was great, but since they have changed the layout it feels completely different.

The tables used to be all on one side and all the fun stuff was within view of parents sitting and enjoying the delicious coffee and baked goods they serve there.

Now everything is scattered and feels disjointed and disorganized. Parents who are meeting other parents can't sit and watch their kids play because they can only see small portions of the play space at a time and you lose where your kid is. Everywhere you stand to watch and play with your kids you feel like you're in the way, both of the children playing and the other parents trying to do the same thing.

I'm not sure why anyone thought it was a good idea to arrange the space this way, and I can't believe how negatively it has affected the entire experience.

If they go back to the old layout, this review would be 5 stars, as the staff, food, coffee, restrooms, toys, etc are all amazing.

Side note: the Santa that they had come take pictures with the kids recently was top-notch!

Reviewer: Bailey Ross
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: I don‚Äôt even know where to begin with just how much we love this place!! We‚Äôve brought our son here since he was around 6 months old (now 2 years old), and since we‚Äôve enjoyed it so much that we have a membership. Some of our favorite memories have been sweet moments in glow worm with our son and friends we have made.

When our son was younger we really enjoyed the area sectioned off for the younger babies. The area for littles is always filled with age-appropriate toys and even some soft play climbing, as well as a mini jungle gym for small toddlers. The half walls that enclose the area allowed for our son to see out into the ‚Äòbig kids‚Äô area, which also was engaging for him as well. While many of the toys ended up in our sons mouth, I also greatly appreciated the system they have in place that allows for the entire playroom to be cleaned between play sessions, which you definitely don‚Äôt see at other kid-centered play spaces!

While it‚Äôs nice having a designated area just for the little ones, it‚Äôs also wonderful that much of the entire play space is also friendly for both the babies, toddlers, and kids alike (and parents too). The owner is frequently adding new fun items, as well as changing the layout of the room which makes the space even better for guests that go often. There‚Äôs everything from Montessori pretend  play, to indoor jungle gyms with soft padded landings, to stem like toys and everything in between. One of the coolest things about glowworm has to be the variety of toys they have there, and how it truly seems like there‚Äôs a toy(s) for every kind of child and play. We sometimes have one of our son‚Äôs autistic cousins come with us for play dates, and they even have sensory-friendly spaces, toys, and accessories (like special ear mufflers for children with noise difficulties) that allows her to also enjoy a play space that she otherwise wouldn‚Äôt be able to. All of the toys and nugget couch setups make it hard for parents to not also find themselves playing with some of the things that are on the floor.

And last but certainly not least, glow worm is more than just a play space for children. They also have a cafe that has delicious snacks and beverages, as well as a small section of retail that always has high quality clothes/children items for reasonable prices! My husband jokes that every time I come I ‚Äúhave to buy something,‚Äù and he‚Äôs usually not wrong seeing as how wonderful many of the items are! I‚Äôve gotten some of my favorite sleepers, holiday sweaters, and other various things from the little retail section they have in the entrance. The staff members there are always so friendly, and the owner is often there and is a WONDERFUL human that I‚Äôve been excited to finally meet and get to know better. Glowing worm overall is a genuinely good place for kids, is a haven for parents that need a safe space for their kids to play, and is a small-business within the community that is ran by good humans. I promise you won‚Äôt regret checking it out if you haven‚Äôt already, this place is truly that great.

Reviewer: Sarah McNamee
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: Today was our first visit to this incredible children‚Äôs indoor play space with our 19-month-old, and I cannot recommend it highly enough for parents with young kids! From start to finish, everything was fantastic.

We booked an afternoon session online the night before, and I found the pricing to be very reasonable for the full two hours we were able to stay and play. The policy of allowing two parents per child is a great touch, and the experience was worth every penny.

Right from the entrance, the space was welcoming. There‚Äôs an adorable little shop with the cutest clothing and a cozy coffee shop setup. We enjoyed a smoothie and a turkey panini, both of which were spot on. The play area itself was a dream come true for our little one. There were around 15‚Äì20 kids during our session, which felt lively but never overwhelming. My husband and I could relax in comfortable chairs in the play area, enjoying our snack while keeping an eye on our kiddo. We were also able to join in whenever we wanted.

The equipment was spotless, and I was particularly impressed with the wide range of activities available, from wooden toys to sensory play that really engaged our toddler. It‚Äôs clear that a lot of thought and care went into creating a safe, fun, and enriching environment for kids.

During our session, I couldn‚Äôt help but text a couple of mom friends to share this hidden gem. We‚Äôre already planning future playdates here! I can‚Äôt thank the staff and the owner enough for providing such an affordable, enjoyable, and thoughtfully curated activity for families. We can‚Äôt wait to come back and play again soon!

Highly, highly recommend!

Review: If you have little ones up to age six, Glow Worm Cafe & Play has always been one of our favorite places to visit. I discovered this place when I was new mom with a tiny eight week old, trying to find things to keep us occupied during a time that was very chaotic. I would go to a mom‚Äôs group that was held there, and I remember I couldn‚Äôt wait till my daughter was big old enough to play because it was the coolest place ever. When she was about six or seven months old, they offered a little play session for littles and we did that. She loved it, she would crawl around, and it was fun. Shortly after her first birthday, we began playing at the baby area in the Highlands location and she was obsessed. My tiny girl discovered a love for slides and play kitchens, and it was so cool watching her confidence grow as she explored the bigger area and the big kid slide!! We alternate locations, and the Beechmont location, it‚Äôs smaller so it‚Äôs really amazing watching her play on her own (something we are still working on!) and figuring out how to climb the steps to the slide, or pushing balls on the ball wall.  We love both locations and can‚Äôt wait for the new one! Katie has created such an amazing place and it‚Äôs so inspiring watching it grow! The staff has always been so friendly and the food is amazing (especially the everything bagel scone and the turkey sandwich!). We really love going to Glow Worm and I‚Äôm so grateful we found it. I truly feel like it is such a gem and recommend it to everyone! Also I highly recommend Cocoon. They offer weekly meetings for babies, newborn to thirteen months, and toddlers, thirteen months to I believe thirty-six months and it‚Äôs such a godsend. I don‚Äôt know what I would do without it!

Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: ‚≠ê 1 out of 5 stars

We visited this indoor playground recently, and unfortunately, it was a very disappointing and concerning experience. The facility was noticeably dirty ‚Äî floors, equipment, and play areas all felt poorly maintained. To make matters worse, staff were mostly standing around, not engaging with kids or actively monitoring the space.

A major red flag: we found a vape on the ground inside the children‚Äôs play area. This is completely unacceptable in a space meant to be safe for young kids.

But the most upsetting part is that a few days after our visit, my daughter developed hand, foot, and mouth disease. She‚Äôs not in daycare and hasn‚Äôt been around any other children recently, so we‚Äôre confident this is where it came from. Illnesses happen, but in this case, it really feels like a direct result of a lack of proper sanitation and oversight.

This place has potential, but until they make serious improvements to cleanliness and safety standards ‚Äî and actually supervise the space ‚Äî we won‚Äôt be back.

Reviewer: Oresha Peete
Rating: 3/5
Time: Edited 3 weeks ago
Review: A great place for all ages. We celebrated my daughter's birthday who turned one year old. While I appreciate the inclusions for the birthday party package ( drinks, fruit snack, bring your own food, 3 hr party, etc) I have some feedback/concerns:
1. Each child at the party is given "flames" for games and ride but they put EVERYONE'S flames on one card. A savings for the company but an inconvenience for the host and guest.
2. "Unlimited" drinks are 2 liters but they provide small cups. So bring your own. Another savings for the company but an inconvenience for the host and guest. Individual cans/bottles would be preferred. Especially for the water, instead of 1 gal bottle.
3.  Several older kids kept coming into the toddler area. They were fully staffed, most of them positioned behind the counter. Only one birthday party in session (mine) but no employees even attempted to regulate the toddler area.
4. I booked the morning party time (10:30am) with hopes to have first access to a clean toddler area. It was very noticeable that the surfaces/floor was not clean. Therefore in my opinion the cleanliness of the ball pit is questionable. I would have rated this place at least a 4 but had to deduct another star due to cleanliness. Cleanliness and safety should be their priority especially if they are providing a service for children.

However, the staff was friendly. Music selection was enjoyable. Thank you Bryant and Christie. They let me use an extra table for my party. Bryant was always checking on us.

Reviewer: Chelsea Wooten
Rating: 4/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: The hive is very neat! This small town needed this after Polk county remolded the outdoor playgrounds. This is going to be a popular place on hot, rainy and cold days! This is a great indoor playground and has many sensory play area for little ones, plus a under 3 baby/toddler zone. They even have a semi private area that can be rented for parties. My 11 month old and 6 year each had there only spaces and had fun for hours. I also appreciate nit having to worry about big kids/teenagers running around and nocking into my child which is sometimes you find at parks and some of the larger indoor playground, jumping gyms.

There is different lanes for sensory and imagination play. Each of the 4 lanes are themed, under the sea, construction zone, outdoor/picnic, and house/doll. The only call out is we noticed the bottom baseboard in the lanes had a rough texture, so if not careful, could get a splinter. All the other boards in the place were smooth and laquered.

Something to note, we hadn't been before they moved the baby zone but talking to some parents, they voiced they didn't like how small it is now. The baby zone used to be where the party area is now. Parents were saying there was more room for them to run around and spread out. On the other hand I could understand the need for larger party area to accommodate larger parties. I didn't mind the baby area and we there on Sunday afternoon after the church crowd. The only thing I didn't like was the net gate used to act as a baby safety gate. Toddlers were climbing over it, under it and around it where it's only attached and hooked at the bottom. Looks broke. Would like to see a solid 3' wall with a swinging gate like at the entrance of the place.

There are a few adult games scattered about, table games like checkers, Jenga and chess. There are large yard games like corn hole, connect 4, tick tac toe.

There is plenty of tables with metal bar stool seats. I personally would have liked to see lower seating with back support that is more children friendly and more comfortable for parents to lounge while the kids play. However they do have two leather futon couches and 4 cushioned arm chairs towards the stage, set up in two living room style sets. There are also plenty of high chairs for babies and they looked clean!

The hive offers WiFi and a variety of refreshments and snacks. I had one of there nitro coffees (never had before) but was very good and creamy. The flavoring range is surprisingly amazing if you are willing to be adventurous and try new things. The also offer craft sodas, teas, and traditional coffee drinks you get at a coffee shop. There is ice cream, we got the waffle bubble and it was so yummy. So much ice cream for the $7. So worth it. There are snacks starting at $1, chips, gummies, dunkaroos, etc.

My daughter keeps asking me when we are going to go back again. Great hangout place, for. Both parents and kids. A little bit of everything for everyone.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Ashley Brooks
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: In response to Curt Digla & Nordrissa Lewis:
I completely disagree with this review, as my experiences at this venue have always and consistently been the complete opposite. It‚Äôs clear that the reviewer had a frustrating visit, but many of their complaints seem exaggerated or based on misunderstandings.
First, calling this place a "glorified daycare" is unfair. It‚Äôs an indoor entertainment space designed for kids to have fun in a safe and engaging environment. The bounce houses, attractions, and activities are exactly what one would expect from a family-friendly venue.
It makes perfect business sense for certain attractions to be available only on specific days to encourage visits during slower periods (i.e. Wednesday)‚Äîthis is a common business strategy, not an attempt to deceive customers.
Regarding pricing, hosting a party at any entertainment venue comes with costs, and $416 for a birthday party that includes a dedicated space, play areas, and food is actually quite reasonable compared to similar venues. Pizza and Capri Suns are standard party offerings, and expecting gourmet options at this price point is unrealistic.
As for the cake, I don‚Äôt know of a single venue that includes cakes as part of the package‚Äîoutside cakes are clearly allowed, so all it takes is asking. However, last-minute issues can happen anywhere, and instead of escalating frustration, a simple check with staff could have clarified the situation.
The owners and their family members are PHENOMENAL, and their staff is professional. If a child was asked to remove a wristband, I have no doubt it was handled appropriately. The accusation of racial favoritism is not only unfair but also unfounded‚ÄîTHIS BUSINESS DOES NOT OPERATE ON RACIAL BIAS.
Additionally, the claim that the venue fabricates positive reviews is simply false.
Comparing this experience to renting a bounce house at home completely ignores the fact that not everyone has the space, time, or desire to host a party themselves. Many parents appreciate the convenience of an all-in-one venue where they don‚Äôt have to worry about setup, cleanup, or keeping kids entertained.
This review is overly negative and fails to recognize the value this venue provides. My personal experience, as well as that of many others, has been overwhelmingly positive.
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS VENUE TO PARENTS‚ÄîIT IS ONE OF THE CLEANEST, FRIENDLIEST INDOOR PLAY AREAS WE HAVE EVER TAKEN OUR LITTLE ONE TO. WE WILL BE BACK AGAIN AND AGAIN!
