Reviewer: Niki Smith
Rating: 5/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: I was searching for an indoor playroom in my area to take my nearly 20-month-old granddaughter and found Eve's Garden at the last minute when I had almost given up. I wasn't in the mood for the chaos of a trampoline park, but with the extreme heat, I knew we wanted to be indoors. From the moment we walked in, I was impressed by the safe, clean and fun environment. My granddaughter had an absolute blast, and to my surprise, my 11-year-old son enjoyed himself as well. They had air hockey, basketball, jumbo connect 4, an inflatable obstacle course, an interactive sand room and an interactive ball game room with a projector for him.

The variety of activities available kept both children entertained and busy. It took my granddaughter a little while to acclimate, but in no time, she was running around, laughing and playing! For this outing, I was specifically looking for a toddler-friendly space, ensuring she could have fun without the risk of being trampled by bigger kids. Eve's Garden perfectly fit the bill, and it was an added bonus that my son also had a great time. The music was amazing, and although we didn't partake because we had just eaten, I saw that they had a variety of snacks and drinks for purchase.

I've already recommended Eve's Garden to a dozen friends and family and can't wait to visit again when my granddaughter is back in town. The experience, staff, cleanliness and overall atmosphere were all top-notch. 10 out of 10!

Reviewer: Mary Chang
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: HUGE perk about this place is that adults CAN STAND UP STRAIGHT in the jungle gym. I have never been to an indoor playground where it is tall enough for that, not even Jump City Scarborough. It makes it so much more comfortable for all us parents who have kids who drag us around through the whole thing. Also, the layout is so well thought out. Lots of mazes and turns. Many different options on going up and down, of different difficulty levels. There are probably 5 or 6 slides, all super slidey and fun even for an adult. Good enclosed toddler area with lots of padding.

The price is great because you get indoor playground, laser tag, trampoline park, rock climbing wall, ninja obstacle course, all for one price. Only arcade you have to pay for, but $20 can get you around 10+ games. We chose 12 rings and a coin purse as our prize.

This is probably my top choice of indoor playground. It is like the better version of the Scarborough location. Staff are helpful and professional, they do well at maintaining safety and cleanliness.

Food: everything tastes decent. The fries look measly for $6 but interestingly they were a nice added touch, we did not regret them. The cheese on the pizza is good.

Ways to improve: laser tag area is a bit small. Imaginative play around for toddlers is lacking toys. Some arcade games were broken but had no sign, causing us to have to go to the attendant to ask for our credits back.

Reviewer: Alinka Malinka
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: I do not recommend visiting The Jump City Richmond Hill.
We attended a birthday party - an extremely unpleasant experience.
The staff is unfriendly and, what is especially outrageous, rude.
The whole party lasted only 2 hours, the children did not have time to play or communicate. And at the end they literally kicked us out.
Only when we had already packed our things and were ready to leave, we were ‚Äúallowed‚Äù to stay for another 20 minutes - but the mood was already spoiled.
Although the premises are large, they are organized completely ineffectively.
The floor is very cold, the surface is hard, you need to walk on it in socks, because you leave your shoes and things in the open locker room.
The children quickly get cold, and the staff wears sneakers.
As a result, all the children got sick after the party, as did some of the adults.
The attitude of the staff leaves much to be desired - instead of help and understanding, we encountered rudeness and irritation.
Against this background, the price is absolutely not justified, and the impression of the holiday was spoiled for everyone.
There are many other children's centers in the area, where the organization, service and conditions are much better.
This place does not even deserve one star.

Review: The first thing that jumps out at you about Jump City is just how big it is.  Unfortunately because it's so big, it doesn't feel warm and inviting.

The floors are cold ceramic, and everything is strangely spaced out.

The good part is that with all that space, there's lots of room for activities and games for the kids including a large climbing structure with slides as well as a big trampoline area and an area for laser tag.

Our kids had fun, but I'm not sure we'll be back often because it's challenging for parents to keep an eye on their kids and it just doesn't feel warm and inviting like a kids playground should be.

I'd say it's a 3.5 rating, but I bumped it up to 4 because kids really seem to enjoy it and have fun, and that's what matters most.

Review: Feedback on My Experience at the Playground.
I have visited this playground multiple times with my children, and I would like to share a few concerns regarding my experience:
1.	Some of the staff members speak to children in a harsh and unfriendly manner, which can create an unpleasant experience for them.
2.	There seems to be a lack of proper supervision regarding the entry and exit of visitors, which raises safety concerns.
3.	On my last visit, I ordered a large pizza, but unfortunately, more than half of it fell to the ground immediately after I received it. When I asked a staff member for assistance in cleaning the area, she ignored my request and instead told me that I had to pay for a new pizza, even though I never requested a replacement. When I reiterated that I needed to clean the spilled pizza, she responded in a mocking tone, questioning why it had fallen.

It seems that some of the staff members are very young and have not been properly trained to provide quality customer service. Unfortunately, due to this experience, I have decided not to return to this location. I hope this feedback helps in improving your services.

Reviewer: D (D0mD33D0m)
Rating: 2/5

Review: The goods:
- A variety of activities for youths, ages 14 and under.
- The winter opening hours on Sunday were not particularly busy.

The bads:
- The "security" checked bags for outside foods inconsistently; it appeared that certain individuals were targeted.
- There are numerous employees, but no one was disinfecting. This issue seems to be concentrated at the port of entry, where no one disinfected high-touch areas, and there were no hand sanitizers in and around the area.

My 6 and 2-year-old visited on Sunday together and both have exhibited the same symptoms since then. The only similar place they went was this play area. No one else has reported being sick. What is the disinfecting policy? They may clean the floors, but what about the play areas? What about the controllers on games? I noticed the floors being cleaned, but what about the play areas?

Sadly, I will not return for this reason. Both daughters now have developed a high fever, cough, runny nose, and lethargy. There has been no other common place where they both played and ate food.

Reviewer: Carly Ferguson
Rating: 1/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: I recently visited Outslide In with my child, who has autism and sensory issues. Unfortunately, our experience was far from pleasant and highlighted a significant lack of accommodation for children with special needs.

My son struggles with sensory issues and will not keep socks on his feet. Despite explaining this to the staff along with the fact that he is non-verbal and autistic, we were persistently followed around by an employee holding a pair of socks and demanding that they be put on my son. This constant pressure and lack of understanding added unnecessary stress to what was supposed to be a fun outing.

Eventually, we left because he couldn‚Äôt keep the socks on and didn‚Äôt want an employee following us within arms distance the whole time. This exclusion felt incredibly unfair and discriminatory. It‚Äôs disheartening that places like this are not equipped to accommodate children with special needs.

Children with special needs should not be excluded from such places because of their differences. I hope that Outslide In can improve its policies and training to become more inclusive and understanding towards all children.

Reviewer: Amanda
Rating: 5/5
Time: Edited 2 years ago
Review: Pros: all inclusive! Pay to enter.  Stay all day or a few hours. Take a wrist band and come back later to play again as part of your entrance fee. So many options for play. Hours of fun! Gated playgrounds, kid friendly bathrooms, chairs and seating for supervising adults placed in and outside of the gates. Staff are constantly walking around, resetting and monitoring safety of kids at play. Imagination rooms with open windows and doors (pizza shop, ice cream parlor,  grocery store, veterinarian,  and firehouse. Location is just around the corner from the food court, so no outside food allowed is not a big deal. Cafe with drinks, including coffee, and snacks is run by the Outslide In staff and located just inside their entrance.

Cons: the amount of kids can be very loud and the music being payed over the speakers can add to the sensory overload. No outside food or drink except water in unless you rent one of the party rooms. Party rooms are pricey for a small group.

Reviewer: Roi Ceren (ksamim)
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: We just celebrated our daughter‚Äôs fourth birthday at Funville Factory and it could not have been more perfect. From the moment we arrived, the owners were right there welcoming us and helping set everything up, making sure we had everything we needed. They even accommodated us with juice boxes, the cutest Super Kitties themed plates, and a pile of stickers that the kids went crazy over.

The place itself is a little smaller than some of the bigger indoor playgrounds, but honestly that was a huge plus. There was so much variety packed into the space with swings, slides, pretend houses, and climbing areas, and because it was cozy, it was easy to keep an eye on all the kids without feeling overwhelmed. The owners were constantly walking around, making sure everyone was happy and calmly stepping in if two kids looked like they might get into a squabble. It felt so safe and thoughtfully run.

The party room looked amazing when we walked in, like a mini Super Kitties world made just for our daughter. They paid attention to every little detail, making sure every child had a seat, plenty of juice, and a stack of stickers to take home. It made the whole party feel really special and personal.

Funville Factory is perfect for younger kids, especially around two to six years old. It seems like they do not really accept kids older than six, which honestly makes sense because the space is so perfectly tailored for the little ones. If you have a four-year-old like we do, this place feels like a dream.

What really stood out the most was how personally involved the owners were the entire time. They were not just running the place, they were making sure our daughter and all her friends were having the best time. We could not have asked for a better experience and we will definitely be back.

-----------------------

Between the overcrowding and the clutter, my one-year-old was terribly overstimulated after an hour and a half each time we visited. He had trouble falling asleep‚Äìwent to bed well over an hour late‚Äìafter both of our visits. We get out and about doing toddler things most days and that‚Äôs never happened anywhere else, so for me that really highlights how overstimulating it is here.

I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs a fun place for lots of kids, but unfortunately it‚Äôs not a great environment for mine.

Reviewer: Audrey Fitzsimmons
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: We stumbled across Funville earlier this summer (thank you OTP Mama for the tip!) It quickly became a favorite play spot for our toddler and was a life savor for us on those grueling hot summer days.

The place is AMAZING - with all sorts of toys/sensory exploration/playground fun you need to keep a toddler (or crew of toddlers!) entertained for hours on end. They also offer various packages - that you can take advantage of through their membership OR NOT. (I personally appreciate that flexibility in a membership/subscription dominant world) Of course they have birthday party packages, and we just hosted our son‚Äôs 2nd birthday party there.

I wasn‚Äôt exactly sure what to expect - but it was an amazing day that went off without a hitch. The owner, Jen, went above and beyond with the decorations. All I had to do was share the number of attendees and theme, and she took care of the rest (‚Ä¶and had it decorated better than I ever could have!!) Jen‚Äôs professionalism - which permeates through her entire staff - is top notch and the Funville team‚Äôs customer service makes party day enjoyable for everyone (parents too!). The pizza that‚Äôs included as part of the birthday package is delicious - and also happens to be right next store, in case you need to add on any last minute additions. (Have I mentioned the convenience of this experience??) My husband and I were carefree from start to finish and it really changed the entire day for us - it was totally worth it. They also took care of the gift bags AND had a special gift for the birthday boy.

THANK YOU Jen and the Funville Factory team for making this such a wonderful day - and planning experience - for my family! I absolutely recommend this place for anyone with kiddos (toddlers are the sweet spot, but I feel like kids up to 7 or 8 would also have a ball). And if you‚Äôre looking for a fun space for your next event, and a professional/customer-focused staff to help you execute, you‚Äôve found your spot!

Reviewer: Manisha
Rating: 5/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: Funville was the perfect place to celebrate my daughter‚Äôs 3rd birthday. I purchased the private event package, and the place was closed to the public for a couple of hours. My daughter could enjoy the place comfortably with her friends, and I could relax and enjoy talking to my family and friends without worrying about cleaning, serving food, or setting up the decorations. The staff did a wonderful job with the decorations and setting up the tables. My daughter wanted a Minnie Mouse-themed birthday, so the staff decorated the party room according to that theme and even had Minnie Mouse plates and utensils for the cake. They also provided goodie bags for all my daughter‚Äôs friends. My friend told me how much her two kids loved what was in the good bags. My daughter also received a Funville T-shirt, a Mickey Mouse puzzle, and a lollipop.

Also, the package includes Napoli pizzas (the pizza place is next to Funville) for your guests. This was the first time I had Napoli pizza, and I fell in love with its fresh ingredients and overall flavor! Most of my guests had their pizza for the first time and are planning a separate trip to Funville and Napoli Pizza.

Another reason to have your toddler celebrate their birthday at Funville is that parents do not have to chase after their toddler. This is because Funville is a small space, but it is packed with interactive and fun activities that will keep them occupied. It is also clean and well-maintained thanks to the staff who ensure everything is in order. I could catch up on conversations with parents and enjoy myself while knowing my daughter is playing safely with other kids.

I highly recommend this event space! Thanks, Funville!

Reviewer: Valerie B
Rating: 2/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: Hi Valerie,

Thank you for your feedback. We apologize if our pricing felt too high for you.

Here‚Äôs a breakdown of our pricing:

	‚Ä¢	$1 for adults: We strive to keep our prices affordable. Many indoor playgrounds charge around $4.99 for adults, or even the same amount as for children. For comparison, our family recently visited the Peppa Pig Theme Park, which charged $70 for adults despite there being no rides for adults. (It was super fun to watch our kids having a BLAST!)
	‚Ä¢	$4 for children 8 months and younger: But they play for FREE WITH A PAYING SIBLING!
	‚Ä¢	$10 for children aged 9 to 21 months: Our playground is specially designed for this age group, with plenty of toys and activities tailored to their needs.
	‚Ä¢	$16 for children aged 22 months and up: We carefully researched our pricing and can assure you that our prices are among the most competitive in Georgia.

Regarding cleanliness, I can assure you that we take this very seriously. We clean and disinfect regularly throughout the day, even if it may not always be visible. We understand that while you‚Äôre focused on watching your child, it might be easy to miss our team in action. Additionally, we don‚Äôt mop the floors during business hours to avoid soaking your socks or causing slips and falls, which is why we require socks to be worn. We are also moving our shoe rack outside the entrance to help keep socks clean and ensure a better experience for everyone.

We appreciate your input and hope to welcome you back soon.

Best regards,
Jen}

Reviewer: Amanda Reed
Rating: 2/5
Time: Edited 7 months ago
Review: A friend of the family had their childs'
birthday party at this place (prior to this I had never been here before). From an outsider looking in, personally, I thought that they pretty much ruined this kids birthday party for her & she is young. She was 2 going on 3. It matters when you have to stand outside & wait with everyone who is supposed to be attending the party with you (plus some... because there were other's out there waiting for other birthday parties doing the same) so I'm sure you can imagine how crowded it was & you can't go in.  They were over 10 minutes late letting everyone in for the birthday party so we're all forced to stand outside, with other larger groups of people (that seemed to be waiting for the same thing that we all were) which was waiting for other birthday parties to begin as well. It was extremely disorganized. I would never want to have my child's birthday at this place and this is just the beginning. I, personally, think they need to work on time management but what do I know..? Oh & going back to that whole "10 minutes late thing" don't you guys worry about it... They "fixed it" by just  tacking on 10 extra minutes at the end (after the family had to say something to them about it) but that makes it ok right...? Especially to the 3 year old (I'm sure the child was extremely understanding). It was so chaotic in there & I'm not sure how things work when you're just going to enjoy the day with your family, but for the people dealing with the "birthday party thing", there is no one keeping any sort of track with the children, making sure at the very least that the child is going home with the parents & family that the child should be (oh, & not getting injured while being there either because that's important but you sign a waiver so I guess it is what it is... Play at your own risk).  We finally got into the "party room" & it was so crowded, & were pretty much forced to rush the children into everything that they were going to be doing in that room & that includes eating (and of course I don't need to tell you the pizza was late so every kid there was starving). They finally get the pizza & then are forced to rush everyone there through that process & eat the cake, only to have to turn right around from that to hurry up & watch the birthday kid open presents. The kid's barely had any real time to enjoy & play & run & have fun around the place (except for, of course, when they were waiting on the late pizza to arrive) but even then it was so crowded with so many other people there that the kids couldn't really enjoy it. I would not have been a very happy person, let alone parent of a kid having a birthday party here & I would have had to pay in advance (and I'm sure it's no small amount of money) to deal with all this. Be warned: no matter what the reason you are there, birthday or otherwise, WATCH YOUR CHILD, because Lord knows, no one else is & no one there can be relied on to it properly & no one watches their own child better than YOU! It's unfortunate because it should (in my opinion) be a place where you can sit & relax and watch them play from a distance & get a little bit of time to breathe (which we all know as parents is hard to come by). I did not get that feeling from this establishment & personally, I would not want to go back. Just telling it like I see it. Sorry, it wouldn't be me if it wasn't honest. Good luck out there guys & girls & try to fit in some fun (just maybe not a that spot. Lol). Be warned too... If you ever see anything there that seems like you are allowed to color... Don't do it! It's always for another event! It's for another event! SORRY! Printing anything out is too much to ask so just don't do it! Just don't do it! Ok! Other than that have fun, I guess, and good luck! It seems like every time I walk into this place, it's always something. Smh

Reviewer: Jessica Morales
Rating: 3/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: I love this place and so do my kids, but there's two things that prevent us from coming here regularly. One, the admission fee is a bit too high especially for us larger families. I have 4 kids so coming here is a "once in a while" thing, although if the prices were lower we would love to come much more often. The other issue, is that we get sick EVERY single time we play here. The first visit, my kids got hand, foot, mouth disease. The second visit, strep throat. Every other visit has luckily just given us normal colds, but without fail, I know anytime we come here that we'll all end up sick within a few days. And I've been a mom for 10+ years, we've been to tons of kids playground places over the years, I am well aware that these types of places spread germs very easily but it is not a coincidence that my kids get sick here after we've spent a few hours playing, when they haven't been sick since our last visit. I always pay attention to what the employees are doing and I see them picking up toys and putting them where they belong, and wiping down tables at the cafe, but never any disinfecting of the toys itself. I'm sure that part gets taken care of after hours, but it clearly isn't enough. I've been to kids indoor play places that have systems in place such as baskets on the wall for parents to put toys that appear dirty or have been in a kids mouth, and other places that have a employee specifically for walking around and wiping down surfaces and toys with a rag and a cleaner. There's no fool proof method to prevent germs from spreading at places like this, I know it's inevitable, but it would be great to see more effort in that aspect.

Reviewer: Roi Ceren (ksamim)
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: We just celebrated our daughter‚Äôs fourth birthday at Funville Factory and it could not have been more perfect. From the moment we arrived, the owners were right there welcoming us and helping set everything up, making sure we had everything we needed. They even accommodated us with juice boxes, the cutest Super Kitties themed plates, and a pile of stickers that the kids went crazy over.

The place itself is a little smaller than some of the bigger indoor playgrounds, but honestly that was a huge plus. There was so much variety packed into the space with swings, slides, pretend houses, and climbing areas, and because it was cozy, it was easy to keep an eye on all the kids without feeling overwhelmed. The owners were constantly walking around, making sure everyone was happy and calmly stepping in if two kids looked like they might get into a squabble. It felt so safe and thoughtfully run.

The party room looked amazing when we walked in, like a mini Super Kitties world made just for our daughter. They paid attention to every little detail, making sure every child had a seat, plenty of juice, and a stack of stickers to take home. It made the whole party feel really special and personal.

Funville Factory is perfect for younger kids, especially around two to six years old. It seems like they do not really accept kids older than six, which honestly makes sense because the space is so perfectly tailored for the little ones. If you have a four-year-old like we do, this place feels like a dream.

What really stood out the most was how personally involved the owners were the entire time. They were not just running the place, they were making sure our daughter and all her friends were having the best time. We could not have asked for a better experience and we will definitely be back.

Reviewer: Audrey Fitzsimmons
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: We stumbled across Funville earlier this summer (thank you OTP Mama for the tip!) It quickly became a favorite play spot for our toddler and was a life savor for us on those grueling hot summer days.

The place is AMAZING - with all sorts of toys/sensory exploration/playground fun you need to keep a toddler (or crew of toddlers!) entertained for hours on end. They also offer various packages - that you can take advantage of through their membership OR NOT. (I personally appreciate that flexibility in a membership/subscription dominant world) Of course they have birthday party packages, and we just hosted our son‚Äôs 2nd birthday party there.

I wasn‚Äôt exactly sure what to expect - but it was an amazing day that went off without a hitch. The owner, Jen, went above and beyond with the decorations. All I had to do was share the number of attendees and theme, and she took care of the rest (‚Ä¶and had it decorated better than I ever could have!!) Jen‚Äôs professionalism - which permeates through her entire staff - is top notch and the Funville team‚Äôs customer service makes party day enjoyable for everyone (parents too!). The pizza that‚Äôs included as part of the birthday package is delicious - and also happens to be right next store, in case you need to add on any last minute additions. (Have I mentioned the convenience of this experience??) My husband and I were carefree from start to finish and it really changed the entire day for us - it was totally worth it. They also took care of the gift bags AND had a special gift for the birthday boy.

THANK YOU Jen and the Funville Factory team for making this such a wonderful day - and planning experience - for my family! I absolutely recommend this place for anyone with kiddos (toddlers are the sweet spot, but I feel like kids up to 7 or 8 would also have a ball). And if you‚Äôre looking for a fun space for your next event, and a professional/customer-focused staff to help you execute, you‚Äôve found your spot!

Reviewer: Manisha
Rating: 5/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: Funville was the perfect place to celebrate my daughter‚Äôs 3rd birthday. I purchased the private event package, and the place was closed to the public for a couple of hours. My daughter could enjoy the place comfortably with her friends, and I could relax and enjoy talking to my family and friends without worrying about cleaning, serving food, or setting up the decorations. The staff did a wonderful job with the decorations and setting up the tables. My daughter wanted a Minnie Mouse-themed birthday, so the staff decorated the party room according to that theme and even had Minnie Mouse plates and utensils for the cake. They also provided goodie bags for all my daughter‚Äôs friends. My friend told me how much her two kids loved what was in the good bags. My daughter also received a Funville T-shirt, a Mickey Mouse puzzle, and a lollipop.

Also, the package includes Napoli pizzas (the pizza place is next to Funville) for your guests. This was the first time I had Napoli pizza, and I fell in love with its fresh ingredients and overall flavor! Most of my guests had their pizza for the first time and are planning a separate trip to Funville and Napoli Pizza.

Another reason to have your toddler celebrate their birthday at Funville is that parents do not have to chase after their toddler. This is because Funville is a small space, but it is packed with interactive and fun activities that will keep them occupied. It is also clean and well-maintained thanks to the staff who ensure everything is in order. I could catch up on conversations with parents and enjoy myself while knowing my daughter is playing safely with other kids.

I highly recommend this event space! Thanks, Funville!

Reviewer: Valerie B
Rating: 2/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: Hi Valerie,

Thank you for your feedback. We apologize if our pricing felt too high for you.

Here‚Äôs a breakdown of our pricing:

	‚Ä¢	$1 for adults: We strive to keep our prices affordable. Many indoor playgrounds charge around $4.99 for adults, or even the same amount as for children. For comparison, our family recently visited the Peppa Pig Theme Park, which charged $70 for adults despite there being no rides for adults. (It was super fun to watch our kids having a BLAST!)
	‚Ä¢	$4 for children 8 months and younger: But they play for FREE WITH A PAYING SIBLING!
	‚Ä¢	$10 for children aged 9 to 21 months: Our playground is specially designed for this age group, with plenty of toys and activities tailored to their needs.
	‚Ä¢	$16 for children aged 22 months and up: We carefully researched our pricing and can assure you that our prices are among the most competitive in Georgia.

Regarding cleanliness, I can assure you that we take this very seriously. We clean and disinfect regularly throughout the day, even if it may not always be visible. We understand that while you‚Äôre focused on watching your child, it might be easy to miss our team in action. Additionally, we don‚Äôt mop the floors during business hours to avoid soaking your socks or causing slips and falls, which is why we require socks to be worn. We are also moving our shoe rack outside the entrance to help keep socks clean and ensure a better experience for everyone.

We appreciate your input and hope to welcome you back soon.

Best regards,
Jen}

Reviewer: heather
Rating: 3/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: I know people love this place bc indoor spaces are much needed in our community. If you‚Äôve been and love it, I love that for you.

Our experience, I took my 2.5 yr old and my 6 month old, they charged me $15 for the 6 month old to enter. I baby wore her and she didn‚Äôt play bc.. she‚Äôs 6 months old. They said they processed a refund when I spoke up about it, but it never cleared. I didn‚Äôt report back bc I‚Äôm just over it at this point. So, we went and they had day camp going on. Everytime he wanted to get on the trampoline he was told no, it‚Äôs for camp kids. Being my kids sensory seeking is running and jumping, he didn‚Äôt get to do very much there. He doesn‚Äôt like swings, and the swings are dead center of the space. He was running between the swings bc running is one of his stims and was knocked down a few times bc of kids swinging. So it‚Äôs unsafe. There isn‚Äôt a place to run. Jumping was a no go bc it seemed solely for camp kids.

Also some of the camp kids were aggressive. One little boy kept coming up to my kid and grabbing his shirt trying to literally drag him. It scared my kid.

The water fountain area stayed wet and our socks got wet and dirty, felt gross. The bathroom floor was also wet and felt gross bc it‚Äôs a unisex bathroom so you don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs pee or water. I threw our socks away after walking away.

I feel like it could have been more, it wasn‚Äôt anything ‚Äúspecial‚Äù. Not when I have most of the things at home already with the exception of the zip line. Even the toddler toys aren‚Äôt anything unique. I expected more from all the hype.

But definitely great for older kids and kids who like swings. I think it‚Äôs a great idea to have, and wish the owners all the success. Looks like they will do great things in the special needs community .

Reviewer: Brittany Griffin

Review: We Rock the Spectrum Kids Gym has been an absolute blessing for our family. As a parent of two sons with very different special needs, it‚Äôs the only place where both of my boys can truly be themselves. They‚Äôve never interacted with one another the way they do here, and I‚Äôve seen them grow in ways I never expected in just the first few visits!

This gym is a safe, welcoming space for kids of all abilities. I‚Äôve met so many amazing families who, like me, are looking for a community that understands the unique challenges of being a special needs parent. It‚Äôs not just a place for kids with special needs; neurotypical children are also part of the experience, learning to interact with and appreciate others who may have different abilities.

My kids LOVE the Zip slider! The rock wall and teen room are also a favorite. Their calming room is so adorable and perfect for when we need a break.

What I love most is their saying ‚ÄúFinally a place where you never have to say ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry‚Äù ‚Äú. It is so very true!  My children are not only given the opportunity to play and have fun, but they‚Äôre also learning important social skills and empathy. It‚Äôs a truly inclusive space where all children, regardless of ability, can feel valued. If you‚Äôre a parent of a child with special needs, I highly recommend checking out We Rock the Spectrum Kids Gym. It‚Äôs a place where your child can thrive, and where you can find a supportive community.

Review: Heard about this place on a  Facebook group. I tried to take my daughter to this location earlier this week. I  called a couple of times To see if someone was inside, but the phone kept going to voicemail (at like 11 AM) I drove around to this mysterious door and did not feel comfortable taking my daughter in so I didn‚Äôt. IMO, this is not a professional place where you take your child. I didn‚Äôt feel comfortable, Didn‚Äôt like the location, and wasn‚Äôt a fan of the non-responsiveness. There were also zero cars outside, which made me think the place wasn‚Äôt even open despite their hours being listed as open from 8 to 4. I got excited about having this kind of facility, but I realize this is not what I‚Äôm looking for. I won‚Äôt be back and won‚Äôt recommend it. Reviewer: Tanya Roberts
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: I have not been to many indoor playgrounds, but I do return to this one often. They have equipment to entertane small babies to young teenagers. Kids can romp and play pretty freely without endangering each other. There is a Diner here within easy access of the play area. Food is at a typical expense. There is a reasonable selection of drinks, snacks and desserts.

I have had a few objections that they seem to be addressing, which is awesome. At this point, I am only concerned with one gate that the kids can easily get out of and it gets a little difficult to keep track of them when it get busy. There are play areas out of sight. Parents usually look out for each other's kids so I don't get too nervous about it. There are two separate entrances/exits. One stays locked and the other has an employee manning it the majority of the time. So I would say it is reasonably secure. But I would recommend that you keep a vigil just in case.

My three kids love it here and they range from 2 to 4 years of age. They have yet to get hurt here and they meet lots of other kids and get plenty of exercise.  They are usually worn out by the time they get in the car.

Check it out, it is worth the trip.

Reviewer: Donovan Nichols
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Sylvania Playland is a great place to take the kids to burn off some energy, especially on those cold winter and hot summer days in the heated / air conditioned indoor space. The kids love running around and playing on the inflateables, bounce houses, swings, slides, etc.

I would say that 1 hour isn't quite enough time, but 2 hours will help your kids sleep well when they get home. You might as well spend the extra couple bucks to get the unlimited play.

There is a 3 and under area for the small children that my 1-year-old loves. The big slide is a hit with my 4-year-old!

There are several party rooms, so this is a great place to have a birthday party for your children. They run around for an hour, eat for a little bit, and then go back to playing for the rest of the 2-hour window. You can bring your own decorations or use the ones that Sylvania Playland provides. They have pizza for the attendees and other add-on options.

They also have mini-golf, but we haven't done that part of Playland yet. In addition, there is a little arcade and an ice cream shop.

I highly recommend Sylvania Playland for parents with kids who are under 12 for a very fun experience.

Review: This is toddler heaven! My one year old loved it immediately, and we signed up for a membership the first day. Normally at home she is really clingy to me, but she is so entertained by everything here, she plays independently for hours. It's a nice space for parents to chat with each other or to chill by yourself. Free wifi works well (and is allowing me to write this review on my computer right now!) The ladies who work here are super kind and friendly with the kids and are on impressively top of disinfecting and tidying. They literally follow the kids around and clean up after them the entire time. (If only they would follow me around in my life and clean up after me!!) Normally we go to the library, but with cold season coming up, it's worth paying to play in a clean environment. Not to mention WAY more things to play with. I really hope local families will take advantage of this amazing play space. We are lucky to have a safe, clean, community for our little ones, and I hope they get enough support to keep doing what they're doing!

Reviewer: Roi Ceren (ksamim)
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: We just celebrated our daughter‚Äôs fourth birthday at Funville Factory and it could not have been more perfect. From the moment we arrived, the owners were right there welcoming us and helping set everything up, making sure we had everything we needed. They even accommodated us with juice boxes, the cutest Super Kitties themed plates, and a pile of stickers that the kids went crazy over.

The place itself is a little smaller than some of the bigger indoor playgrounds, but honestly that was a huge plus. There was so much variety packed into the space with swings, slides, pretend houses, and climbing areas, and because it was cozy, it was easy to keep an eye on all the kids without feeling overwhelmed. The owners were constantly walking around, making sure everyone was happy and calmly stepping in if two kids looked like they might get into a squabble. It felt so safe and thoughtfully run.

The party room looked amazing when we walked in, like a mini Super Kitties world made just for our daughter. They paid attention to every little detail, making sure every child had a seat, plenty of juice, and a stack of stickers to take home. It made the whole party feel really special and personal.

Funville Factory is perfect for younger kids, especially around two to six years old. It seems like they do not really accept kids older than six, which honestly makes sense because the space is so perfectly tailored for the little ones. If you have a four-year-old like we do, this place feels like a dream.

What really stood out the most was how personally involved the owners were the entire time. They were not just running the place, they were making sure our daughter and all her friends were having the best time. We could not have asked for a better experience and we will definitely be back.

Reviewer: Audrey Fitzsimmons
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: We stumbled across Funville earlier this summer (thank you OTP Mama for the tip!) It quickly became a favorite play spot for our toddler and was a life savor for us on those grueling hot summer days.

The place is AMAZING - with all sorts of toys/sensory exploration/playground fun you need to keep a toddler (or crew of toddlers!) entertained for hours on end. They also offer various packages - that you can take advantage of through their membership OR NOT. (I personally appreciate that flexibility in a membership/subscription dominant world) Of course they have birthday party packages, and we just hosted our son‚Äôs 2nd birthday party there.

I wasn‚Äôt exactly sure what to expect - but it was an amazing day that went off without a hitch. The owner, Jen, went above and beyond with the decorations. All I had to do was share the number of attendees and theme, and she took care of the rest (‚Ä¶and had it decorated better than I ever could have!!) Jen‚Äôs professionalism - which permeates through her entire staff - is top notch and the Funville team‚Äôs customer service makes party day enjoyable for everyone (parents too!). The pizza that‚Äôs included as part of the birthday package is delicious - and also happens to be right next store, in case you need to add on any last minute additions. (Have I mentioned the convenience of this experience??) My husband and I were carefree from start to finish and it really changed the entire day for us - it was totally worth it. They also took care of the gift bags AND had a special gift for the birthday boy.

THANK YOU Jen and the Funville Factory team for making this such a wonderful day - and planning experience - for my family! I absolutely recommend this place for anyone with kiddos (toddlers are the sweet spot, but I feel like kids up to 7 or 8 would also have a ball). And if you‚Äôre looking for a fun space for your next event, and a professional/customer-focused staff to help you execute, you‚Äôve found your spot!

Reviewer: Manisha
Rating: 5/5

Review: Funville was the perfect place to celebrate my daughter‚Äôs 3rd birthday. I purchased the private event package, and the place was closed to the public for a couple of hours. My daughter could enjoy the place comfortably with her friends, and I could relax and enjoy talking to my family and friends without worrying about cleaning, serving food, or setting up the decorations. The staff did a wonderful job with the decorations and setting up the tables. My daughter wanted a Minnie Mouse-themed birthday, so the staff decorated the party room according to that theme and even had Minnie Mouse plates and utensils for the cake. They also provided goodie bags for all my daughter‚Äôs friends. My friend told me how much her two kids loved what was in the good bags. My daughter also received a Funville T-shirt, a Mickey Mouse puzzle, and a lollipop.

Also, the package includes Napoli pizzas (the pizza place is next to Funville) for your guests. This was the first time I had Napoli pizza, and I fell in love with its fresh ingredients and overall flavor! Most of my guests had their pizza for the first time and are planning a separate trip to Funville and Napoli Pizza.

Another reason to have your toddler celebrate their birthday at Funville is that parents do not have to chase after their toddler. This is because Funville is a small space, but it is packed with interactive and fun activities that will keep them occupied. It is also clean and well-maintained thanks to the staff who ensure everything is in order. I could catch up on conversations with parents and enjoy myself while knowing my daughter is playing safely with other kids.

I highly recommend this event space! Thanks, Funville!

Reviewer: Valerie B
Rating: 2/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: Hi Valerie,

Thank you for your feedback. We apologize if our pricing felt too high for you.

Here‚Äôs a breakdown of our pricing:

	‚Ä¢	$1 for adults: We strive to keep our prices affordable. Many indoor playgrounds charge around $4.99 for adults, or even the same amount as for children. For comparison, our family recently visited the Peppa Pig Theme Park, which charged $70 for adults despite there being no rides for adults. (It was super fun to watch our kids having a BLAST!)
	‚Ä¢	$4 for children 8 months and younger: But they play for FREE WITH A PAYING SIBLING!
	‚Ä¢	$10 for children aged 9 to 21 months: Our playground is specially designed for this age group, with plenty of toys and activities tailored to their needs.
	‚Ä¢	$16 for children aged 22 months and up: We carefully researched our pricing and can assure you that our prices are among the most competitive in Georgia.

Regarding cleanliness, I can assure you that we take this very seriously. We clean and disinfect regularly throughout the day, even if it may not always be visible. We understand that while you‚Äôre focused on watching your child, it might be easy to miss our team in action. Additionally, we don‚Äôt mop the floors during business hours to avoid soaking your socks or causing slips and falls, which is why we require socks to be worn. We are also moving our shoe rack outside the entrance to help keep socks clean and ensure a better experience for everyone.

We appreciate your input and hope to welcome you back soon.

Best regards,
Jen}

Reviewer: Roi Ceren (ksamim)
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: We just celebrated our daughter‚Äôs fourth birthday at Funville Factory and it could not have been more perfect. From the moment we arrived, the owners were right there welcoming us and helping set everything up, making sure we had everything we needed. They even accommodated us with juice boxes, the cutest Super Kitties themed plates, and a pile of stickers that the kids went crazy over.

The place itself is a little smaller than some of the bigger indoor playgrounds, but honestly that was a huge plus. There was so much variety packed into the space with swings, slides, pretend houses, and climbing areas, and because it was cozy, it was easy to keep an eye on all the kids without feeling overwhelmed. The owners were constantly walking around, making sure everyone was happy and calmly stepping in if two kids looked like they might get into a squabble. It felt so safe and thoughtfully run.

The party room looked amazing when we walked in, like a mini Super Kitties world made just for our daughter. They paid attention to every little detail, making sure every child had a seat, plenty of juice, and a stack of stickers to take home. It made the whole party feel really special and personal.

Funville Factory is perfect for younger kids, especially around two to six years old. It seems like they do not really accept kids older than six, which honestly makes sense because the space is so perfectly tailored for the little ones. If you have a four-year-old like we do, this place feels like a dream.

What really stood out the most was how personally involved the owners were the entire time. They were not just running the place, they were making sure our daughter and all her friends were having the best time. We could not have asked for a better experience and we will definitely be back.

Reviewer: Audrey Fitzsimmons
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: We stumbled across Funville earlier this summer (thank you OTP Mama for the tip!) It quickly became a favorite play spot for our toddler and was a life savor for us on those grueling hot summer days.

The place is AMAZING - with all sorts of toys/sensory exploration/playground fun you need to keep a toddler (or crew of toddlers!) entertained for hours on end. They also offer various packages - that you can take advantage of through their membership OR NOT. (I personally appreciate that flexibility in a membership/subscription dominant world) Of course they have birthday party packages, and we just hosted our son‚Äôs 2nd birthday party there.

I wasn‚Äôt exactly sure what to expect - but it was an amazing day that went off without a hitch. The owner, Jen, went above and beyond with the decorations. All I had to do was share the number of attendees and theme, and she took care of the rest (‚Ä¶and had it decorated better than I ever could have!!) Jen‚Äôs professionalism - which permeates through her entire staff - is top notch and the Funville team‚Äôs customer service makes party day enjoyable for everyone (parents too!). The pizza that‚Äôs included as part of the birthday package is delicious - and also happens to be right next store, in case you need to add on any last minute additions. (Have I mentioned the convenience of this experience??) My husband and I were carefree from start to finish and it really changed the entire day for us - it was totally worth it. They also took care of the gift bags AND had a special gift for the birthday boy.

THANK YOU Jen and the Funville Factory team for making this such a wonderful day - and planning experience - for my family! I absolutely recommend this place for anyone with kiddos (toddlers are the sweet spot, but I feel like kids up to 7 or 8 would also have a ball). And if you‚Äôre looking for a fun space for your next event, and a professional/customer-focused staff to help you execute, you‚Äôve found your spot!

Reviewer: Manisha
Rating: 5/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: Funville was the perfect place to celebrate my daughter‚Äôs 3rd birthday. I purchased the private event package, and the place was closed to the public for a couple of hours. My daughter could enjoy the place comfortably with her friends, and I could relax and enjoy talking to my family and friends without worrying about cleaning, serving food, or setting up the decorations. The staff did a wonderful job with the decorations and setting up the tables. My daughter wanted a Minnie Mouse-themed birthday, so the staff decorated the party room according to that theme and even had Minnie Mouse plates and utensils for the cake. They also provided goodie bags for all my daughter‚Äôs friends. My friend told me how much her two kids loved what was in the good bags. My daughter also received a Funville T-shirt, a Mickey Mouse puzzle, and a lollipop.

Also, the package includes Napoli pizzas (the pizza place is next to Funville) for your guests. This was the first time I had Napoli pizza, and I fell in love with its fresh ingredients and overall flavor! Most of my guests had their pizza for the first time and are planning a separate trip to Funville and Napoli Pizza.

Another reason to have your toddler celebrate their birthday at Funville is that parents do not have to chase after their toddler. This is because Funville is a small space, but it is packed with interactive and fun activities that will keep them occupied. It is also clean and well-maintained thanks to the staff who ensure everything is in order. I could catch up on conversations with parents and enjoy myself while knowing my daughter is playing safely with other kids.

I highly recommend this event space! Thanks, Funville!

Reviewer: Valerie B
Rating: 2/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: Hi Valerie,

Thank you for your feedback. We apologize if our pricing felt too high for you.

Here‚Äôs a breakdown of our pricing:

	‚Ä¢	$1 for adults: We strive to keep our prices affordable. Many indoor playgrounds charge around $4.99 for adults, or even the same amount as for children. For comparison, our family recently visited the Peppa Pig Theme Park, which charged $70 for adults despite there being no rides for adults. (It was super fun to watch our kids having a BLAST!)
	‚Ä¢	$4 for children 8 months and younger: But they play for FREE WITH A PAYING SIBLING!
	‚Ä¢	$10 for children aged 9 to 21 months: Our playground is specially designed for this age group, with plenty of toys and activities tailored to their needs.
	‚Ä¢	$16 for children aged 22 months and up: We carefully researched our pricing and can assure you that our prices are among the most competitive in Georgia.

Regarding cleanliness, I can assure you that we take this very seriously. We clean and disinfect regularly throughout the day, even if it may not always be visible. We understand that while you‚Äôre focused on watching your child, it might be easy to miss our team in action. Additionally, we don‚Äôt mop the floors during business hours to avoid soaking your socks or causing slips and falls, which is why we require socks to be worn. We are also moving our shoe rack outside the entrance to help keep socks clean and ensure a better experience for everyone.

We appreciate your input and hope to welcome you back soon.

Best regards,
Jen}

Reviewer: vasista k.j
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: This place sounds like a fantastic spot for families with kids! The variety of activities are plentiful enough to keep everyone entertained, from the little ones (ages 0-9 are specifically mentioned, including a baby slide!) to the grown-ups who enjoy joining in.

The practical aspects also get a thumbs-up. The facility is noted for its cleanliness, including the restrooms, which is always a big plus. Safety also appears to be a priority, with the padded surfaces. The staff are nice and efficient, contributing to a positive experience.

A couple of helpful tips emerge : remember to wear socks and bring cash if you're interested in the video games or claw machines. Visiting during lunchtime on a weekday seems to be a good strategy if you prefer a quieter atmosphere, likely due to school being in session.

Overall, this place seems like a winner for families looking for a fun, clean, and safe environment to spend quality time together. It's definitely earning repeat visits!

Reviewer: Jessica

Review: We celebrated our daughter's 1st birthday at Kidtopia. I forgot the gentleman's name who was assigned to help us on 7/19/24 at 1:30 but he was awesome! He had the room already set up for us and he frequently checked in with us to see if we needed any help. I brought my own decorations and portable freezer for a DIY sundae bar which turned out perfect! Another pro was that it was less crowded on a Friday afternoon. A few con's was that the communication via email before the party was unresponsive and the water bottles provided in the package are mini sized. It was 94 degrees the day of our party so luckily they had the AC on. I'm not sure why the company would skimp on the water bottles...it seems they would still make a profit by providing 10 regular sized water bottles. Overall, it was a chill party, I would recommend it and do it again!

Reviewer: Norma Ruiz
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We came here on a rainy day - we were in that area and searched an indoor play area and this came up in my search. We arrived at 3:30pm - there are 2 hour play slots through the day. Each 2 hour slot was $16.00 (plus $3 if you wanted to get their socks, you don't have to) so we only had 1 hour to play. We could either decide to stay for the hour or wait for the 5 o'clock hour to start. We decided to stay for the one hour and when I was going to pay she asked me are you coming back at five? I said I'm not sure do I have to pay for both slots. To my Surprise I didn't if I stayed for one hour she would prorate my time and give me a discount which I found amazing. Or she could give me wristband so I can come back at five, which I thought was amazing as well! Both options were great! The play area had so many different variety of games and structures and slides. They also have an area with arcades.arcades. While we were here, I noticed that a couple families were having parties and noticed rooms where those parties were held, which seems like a great option for people wanting to host their kids birthday party.  I won't fail to mention that there was a stationary wooden ice cream truck that was pretty large. An adult could definitely fit in there or maybe three, I saw about 56 kids there at one time, and they had kitchen and little toys to serve the " ice cream truck parlor guests". My daughter had an absolute blast here and I recommend this spot for any parent wanting to take their kids to an indoor play area whether it's a rainy day or a special birthday celebration.

Reviewer: Roen Rojas
Rating: 1/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: There's comes a point where a manager needs to understand their customers. I understand policy is policy, and I wasn't fighting it, but my situation was poorly mishandled.

My mother took my daughter here at 430 pm on 11/18 to have a good time. I work nearby and my plan was to pick her up at 530. I get here, and I mentioned I'm just here to pick up my daughter. But my daughter, and you know kids, wanted to show me what fun things she is doing. Well, I was denied entry because policy states "1 free adult".

I explained to the manager, I've been here before and was granted entry just for 5 minutes just so my daughter can show off what shes doing. He was still asking for $7 so I said nevermind. My mother was pretty upset because my father has entered before without penalty. Maybe we got lucky with whoever helped us before because they were lenient. Maybe the worker who helped us wasn't a manager and didn't care for the rules? Who knows.

Anyways, if policy is enforced when they feel like enforcing it, it gets confusing to the customer.

The manager who helped me didn't handle it well. He could have said, "I understand. I'm sorry. Please go in but next time, it will be $7". And then I would follow suit. We don't read their online website and we were unaware of the additional adult fee. Now we are. But it's too late. We're not coming back here.

To add, the manager was pretty defensive the whole time we were talking; comparing Jolly Roger to other local places and how they're more expensive and strict.

Teeny Town is around the corner and they only charge entry per kid.

Reviewer: Tae Nguyen
Rating: 4/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Let me tell you, this indoor play structure in the East Bay is a real rollercoaster of emotions, and by rollercoaster, I mean both the ups and downs you'll experience while visiting!

First off, let's talk about the layout. It's like a maze of fun, and my kids absolutely love it. There are more twists and turns than a telenovela, and my little ones can't get enough. They've got a ball pit that's deeper than my love for chocolate, a slide longer than my to-do list, and a small jump place that makes me reconsider my anti-jumping stance (adults should be allowed to jump too, right?).

But what really takes the cake (or should I say ice cream) is the ice cream machine. Picture this: a magical contraption that mixes ice cream on demand. It's like having a dessert genie in a corner, granting all your sugary wishes.

Now, here's where the plot thickens. The seating situation for us grown-ups is about as scarce as a unicorn sighting. Seriously, finding a place to rest your weary bones is like trying to find a needle in a haystack. And if you do manage to snag a spot, you'll quickly realize it's located next to the massage chairs. You'd think those would be a godsend, right? Wrong! They emit a never-ending chorus of loud beeping noises that will make you question the life choices that led you to this point.

So, while I'd love to give this place a solid 5-star rating, I have to dock a point for the limited seating and the ear-piercing massage chair symphony. But hey, if you can overlook those minor hiccups, you'll be in for a wild ride of indoor playtime adventure. Just be prepared to jump, slide, and dodge massage chair beeps like a ninja in a candy store.

Reviewer: Angela Kratsas
Rating: 1/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I should have known from the first call that I should not have booked my daughter‚Äôs birthday party here. I have never done a party at a jump n play kind of place before and needless to say this entire experience has left such a bad impression that I never want to do one again. There was never a manager available for us to speak to. No one communicated properly. The lack of communication is like nothing I have ever seen before. I‚Äôve been in the customer service industry for my entire life and have never seen a business that was ran so poorly.  I have never felt inclined to write a bad review but this place really ruined everything for me. When I first called to book my daughter‚Äôs birthday the phone rang and went to voicemail like it was a personal cell phone. If you are going to run a legitimate business then I would suggest having a real business line with a real voicemail box set up. I left one message, no call back, two messages, no call back. I left an email in the inquiry box on their website, no response. Finally on my third voicemail they called me back. I asked to book the date that I wanted to they said ‚Äúsure but let me call you back‚Äù. Whoever I was speaking with didn‚Äôt know how to reserve the room and date. They called me back and told me I needed to put down my credit card information for the 50% deposit but, they said they would call me back because they didn‚Äôt know how to take my card info. Then they called me back and sent me a link. I went through the steps with them on the phone. It took 20 minutes to do this. It was such a waste of time. As a business owner you need to figure out a better solution to taking payment over the phone. Come week of the party I get a call wanting to confirm my party. I confirm it. They call me back a couple days later and asked to confirm again. I confirmed it. Then they called me yet AGAIN on the actual day of the party to yet again confirm my reservation. The lack of communication was clear. As a business owner you should really work on communication with your staff.  We get to the jump n play the day of our reservation and they told me they needed the same card I booked the reservation with to finish charging us for the other 50% of the party. They also told me that there was an email sent to me that said I would need that card. No email like that was ever sent to me. They lied to me to make it look like it was my fault. To have your employees lie to the customer is pathetic. That card unfortunately was closed because we had fraud on the card so there was no way to present the card. The staff made my husband leave his own daughters birthday party to go get cash. There are so many ways in this day and age to be able to accept multiple credit cards. As a business owner you need talk to the bank about a solution.  Their business specialist will be happy to help you out with that. While my husband drove around in the pouring rain missing his daughters birthday party the staff continued to harass me for the money. They threatened to not allow any of my guests in until they had their money. Like they were pimps bullying their employees. They came in to ask me for the money three separate times within 30 minutes. Finally my husband came back after missing half his daughters birthday and gave the staff the FULL AMOUNT for the party. Not just the 50% that was needed. They said they would refund the 50% deposit which ultimately did end up coming back to us after almost a week. All in all I will never be giving another dime to this place. It‚Äôs sad because my daughter enjoyed going there but after this experience of unprofessionalism I never want to step foot there again. I hope the owner reads this review and figures our  how to make the proper adjustments. I never want to see a business fail but if this is how they run their business then I don‚Äôt see how it could last.

-----------------------

Reviewer: luciana
Rating: 1/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: Very unpleasant experience at the indoor playground in Hayward "Jump N Play"

Today I took my children to the Jump N Play playground expecting to have a fun and safe day. However, our experience was the complete opposite. I drove over 60 miles to get to the park hoping it would be worth it.

At first, everything seemed normal and the children were having fun on the rides. However, as we were playing, after a while, I noticed a group of people entering who clearly smelled like marijuana. The smell was very strong and obvious, and I found it unacceptable that the park staff allowed them to enter knowing that it is a place designed for small children.

I felt very uncomfortable and worried about the health of my children, as the smell was extremely strong and I did not want them to inhale those fumes.  I found it irresponsible and negligent of the park not to take measures to prevent the presence of illegal substances in a place where children should feel safe and protected.

Also, the games and equipment seemed old and in poor condition.

I do not recommend this park to any family looking for a safe and enjoyable place for their children. I hope the park takes steps to improve the safety and maintenance of the place.

Reviewer: Piyush Gadigone
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Here comes a heartfelt review from a truly grateful customer!

We hosted our daughter‚Äôs 3rd birthday party here and this place was exceptional. Many guests gave us compliments saying that this was one of the best birthday events they had ever attended and that their kids had lot of fun. You know you have booked the right place when your guests say they will also plan their kid‚Äôs birthday here.

There are many things that that are unique about this place:
1. This place is truly a fun place for kids of all ages. Their games and rides are innovative, much better than competitors like Kidtopia. We had kids of age 3-4 and older kids of age 6-9, and all enjoyed a lot.
2. The staff is exceptionally helpful, caring and professional. Pearl and her team assisted us throughout the event. The entire team was involved in helping setup the decoration, serving pizza, cake cutting, cleanup etc. They ensured the place was clean, and were always very cheerful. They took photos of the event for us and were always willing to help. This truly exceeded my expectations.
3. We were offered a photographer as a part of the party package we had booked (a private event)- who did an incredible job. He not only captured all the key moments perfectly but also voluntarily setup a photo booth where all the guests could take photos. The photographer entertained all requests patiently, until the last guest, all this while with a smile on his face and suggesting some great poses. The guests loved this! While our guests got some amazing pictures with their families, we enjoyed seeing our daughter‚Äôs pictures with her daycare friends - all beautifully captured.
4. This place offers the option to book the entire hall and also allows outside food - which enhanced the experience. Our guests were pleasantly surprised. Very few places give such options. Many of the guests plan to celebrate their birthday events here as well.

If you are looking to book this place, you won‚Äôt regret it and if you‚Äôve booked it, you‚Äôre in for a pleasant ride.

Reviewer: nicole D
Rating: 2/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: I think the concept of this place is very cool and offers parents an outlet and place for their kids to release energy in a climate controlled environment.

The issues that I have with this place are; they have a toddler time for under 3 year olds, but it‚Äôs not in an enclosed area where parents can kind of relax and monitor their children.
They have an entrance area that should be gated,  so that kids are enclosed so and can safely play while being monitored by a seated parent, and that doesn‚Äôt require you to constantly chase them. I really dislike this lack of a feature at this establishment and it truly has a negative effect on the experience when going.

this is a place for children to play and I feel like it‚Äôs also a place where parents can go and possibly get some work done or socialise with other parents while safely monitoring their children play with other kids.

The lack of having a gated area does not allow this at all. It‚Äôs also quite dangerous to have an open area that a young child under the age of three could simply walk out and open the door and go outside and get hit by a car.

Next, There are not bicycles in the area.  with children that are under three years old , it‚Äôs kind of overkill asking them to constantly come off of the mat area. A heavier woman kept redirecting my child off of the mat. Why have bikes in the same area? People do different things. No one has ever mentioned this before or had a problem.

Then, they have an upselling scheme of charging you $4 if you forget your socks. I have about five pairs of socks at this point because I do end up forgetting the socks whenever I spontaneously decide to come by this place.
you would think they had some type of system.
It‚Äôs literally just a tactic to make more money.
Toddler Socks don‚Äôt cost $4 for 1 pair.
If a child is wearing socks, it‚Äôs ridiculous to even charge to buy theirs.

I feel the quality of children and parents is low class and I had an experience where a child put my child in a headlock and left a scratch of my child‚Äôs neck.
The child was a bit older and clearly had some behavioural issues as the parent was not able to communicate effectively for the child to acknowledge they had done something wrong.
For this reason in addition to the other concern stated, I decided that I won‚Äôt be coming to this place anymore.

It‚Äôs truly a shame because there isn‚Äôt anything else that‚Äôs in this area, but I don‚Äôt feel comfortable paying $17 for one hour of letting my kid play and also subjecting my child to certain dangers. It‚Äôs not worth it.

Reviewer: Roi Ceren (ksamim)
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: We just celebrated our daughter‚Äôs fourth birthday at Funville Factory and it could not have been more perfect. From the moment we arrived, the owners were right there welcoming us and helping set everything up, making sure we had everything we needed. They even accommodated us with juice boxes, the cutest Super Kitties themed plates, and a pile of stickers that the kids went crazy over.

The place itself is a little smaller than some of the bigger indoor playgrounds, but honestly that was a huge plus. There was so much variety packed into the space with swings, slides, pretend houses, and climbing areas, and because it was cozy, it was easy to keep an eye on all the kids without feeling overwhelmed. The owners were constantly walking around, making sure everyone was happy and calmly stepping in if two kids looked like they might get into a squabble. It felt so safe and thoughtfully run.

The party room looked amazing when we walked in, like a mini Super Kitties world made just for our daughter. They paid attention to every little detail, making sure every child had a seat, plenty of juice, and a stack of stickers to take home. It made the whole party feel really special and personal.

Funville Factory is perfect for younger kids, especially around two to six years old. It seems like they do not really accept kids older than six, which honestly makes sense because the space is so perfectly tailored for the little ones. If you have a four-year-old like we do, this place feels like a dream.

What really stood out the most was how personally involved the owners were the entire time. They were not just running the place, they were making sure our daughter and all her friends were having the best time. We could not have asked for a better experience and we will definitely be back.

Reviewer: Audrey Fitzsimmons
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: We stumbled across Funville earlier this summer (thank you OTP Mama for the tip!) It quickly became a favorite play spot for our toddler and was a life savor for us on those grueling hot summer days.

The place is AMAZING - with all sorts of toys/sensory exploration/playground fun you need to keep a toddler (or crew of toddlers!) entertained for hours on end. They also offer various packages - that you can take advantage of through their membership OR NOT. (I personally appreciate that flexibility in a membership/subscription dominant world) Of course they have birthday party packages, and we just hosted our son‚Äôs 2nd birthday party there.

I wasn‚Äôt exactly sure what to expect - but it was an amazing day that went off without a hitch. The owner, Jen, went above and beyond with the decorations. All I had to do was share the number of attendees and theme, and she took care of the rest (‚Ä¶and had it decorated better than I ever could have!!) Jen‚Äôs professionalism - which permeates through her entire staff - is top notch and the Funville team‚Äôs customer service makes party day enjoyable for everyone (parents too!). The pizza that‚Äôs included as part of the birthday package is delicious - and also happens to be right next store, in case you need to add on any last minute additions. (Have I mentioned the convenience of this experience??) My husband and I were carefree from start to finish and it really changed the entire day for us - it was totally worth it. They also took care of the gift bags AND had a special gift for the birthday boy.

THANK YOU Jen and the Funville Factory team for making this such a wonderful day - and planning experience - for my family! I absolutely recommend this place for anyone with kiddos (toddlers are the sweet spot, but I feel like kids up to 7 or 8 would also have a ball). And if you‚Äôre looking for a fun space for your next event, and a professional/customer-focused staff to help you execute, you‚Äôve found your spot!

Reviewer: Manisha
Rating: 5/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: Funville was the perfect place to celebrate my daughter‚Äôs 3rd birthday. I purchased the private event package, and the place was closed to the public for a couple of hours. My daughter could enjoy the place comfortably with her friends, and I could relax and enjoy talking to my family and friends without worrying about cleaning, serving food, or setting up the decorations. The staff did a wonderful job with the decorations and setting up the tables. My daughter wanted a Minnie Mouse-themed birthday, so the staff decorated the party room according to that theme and even had Minnie Mouse plates and utensils for the cake. They also provided goodie bags for all my daughter‚Äôs friends. My friend told me how much her two kids loved what was in the good bags. My daughter also received a Funville T-shirt, a Mickey Mouse puzzle, and a lollipop.

Also, the package includes Napoli pizzas (the pizza place is next to Funville) for your guests. This was the first time I had Napoli pizza, and I fell in love with its fresh ingredients and overall flavor! Most of my guests had their pizza for the first time and are planning a separate trip to Funville and Napoli Pizza.

Another reason to have your toddler celebrate their birthday at Funville is that parents do not have to chase after their toddler. This is because Funville is a small space, but it is packed with interactive and fun activities that will keep them occupied. It is also clean and well-maintained thanks to the staff who ensure everything is in order. I could catch up on conversations with parents and enjoy myself while knowing my daughter is playing safely with other kids.

I highly recommend this event space! Thanks, Funville!

Reviewer: Valerie B
Rating: 2/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: Hi Valerie,

Thank you for your feedback. We apologize if our pricing felt too high for you.

Here‚Äôs a breakdown of our pricing:

	‚Ä¢	$1 for adults: We strive to keep our prices affordable. Many indoor playgrounds charge around $4.99 for adults, or even the same amount as for children. For comparison, our family recently visited the Peppa Pig Theme Park, which charged $70 for adults despite there being no rides for adults. (It was super fun to watch our kids having a BLAST!)
	‚Ä¢	$4 for children 8 months and younger: But they play for FREE WITH A PAYING SIBLING!
	‚Ä¢	$10 for children aged 9 to 21 months: Our playground is specially designed for this age group, with plenty of toys and activities tailored to their needs.
	‚Ä¢	$16 for children aged 22 months and up: We carefully researched our pricing and can assure you that our prices are among the most competitive in Georgia.

Regarding cleanliness, I can assure you that we take this very seriously. We clean and disinfect regularly throughout the day, even if it may not always be visible. We understand that while you‚Äôre focused on watching your child, it might be easy to miss our team in action. Additionally, we don‚Äôt mop the floors during business hours to avoid soaking your socks or causing slips and falls, which is why we require socks to be worn. We are also moving our shoe rack outside the entrance to help keep socks clean and ensure a better experience for everyone.

We appreciate your input and hope to welcome you back soon.

Best regards,
Jen}

Reviewer: Ashley Brooks
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: In response to Curt Digla & Nordrissa Lewis:
I completely disagree with this review, as my experiences at this venue have always and consistently been the complete opposite. It‚Äôs clear that the reviewer had a frustrating visit, but many of their complaints seem exaggerated or based on misunderstandings.
First, calling this place a "glorified daycare" is unfair. It‚Äôs an indoor entertainment space designed for kids to have fun in a safe and engaging environment. The bounce houses, attractions, and activities are exactly what one would expect from a family-friendly venue.
It makes perfect business sense for certain attractions to be available only on specific days to encourage visits during slower periods (i.e. Wednesday)‚Äîthis is a common business strategy, not an attempt to deceive customers.
Regarding pricing, hosting a party at any entertainment venue comes with costs, and $416 for a birthday party that includes a dedicated space, play areas, and food is actually quite reasonable compared to similar venues. Pizza and Capri Suns are standard party offerings, and expecting gourmet options at this price point is unrealistic.
As for the cake, I don‚Äôt know of a single venue that includes cakes as part of the package‚Äîoutside cakes are clearly allowed, so all it takes is asking. However, last-minute issues can happen anywhere, and instead of escalating frustration, a simple check with staff could have clarified the situation.
The owners and their family members are PHENOMENAL, and their staff is professional. If a child was asked to remove a wristband, I have no doubt it was handled appropriately. The accusation of racial favoritism is not only unfair but also unfounded‚ÄîTHIS BUSINESS DOES NOT OPERATE ON RACIAL BIAS.
Additionally, the claim that the venue fabricates positive reviews is simply false.
Comparing this experience to renting a bounce house at home completely ignores the fact that not everyone has the space, time, or desire to host a party themselves. Many parents appreciate the convenience of an all-in-one venue where they don‚Äôt have to worry about setup, cleanup, or keeping kids entertained.
This review is overly negative and fails to recognize the value this venue provides. My personal experience, as well as that of many others, has been overwhelmingly positive.
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS VENUE TO PARENTS‚ÄîIT IS ONE OF THE CLEANEST, FRIENDLIEST INDOOR PLAY AREAS WE HAVE EVER TAKEN OUR LITTLE ONE TO. WE WILL BE BACK AGAIN AND AGAIN!

Reviewer: Niki Smith
Rating: 5/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: I was searching for an indoor playroom in my area to take my nearly 20-month-old granddaughter and found Eve's Garden at the last minute when I had almost given up. I wasn't in the mood for the chaos of a trampoline park, but with the extreme heat, I knew we wanted to be indoors. From the moment we walked in, I was impressed by the safe, clean and fun environment. My granddaughter had an absolute blast, and to my surprise, my 11-year-old son enjoyed himself as well. They had air hockey, basketball, jumbo connect 4, an inflatable obstacle course, an interactive sand room and an interactive ball game room with a projector for him.

The variety of activities available kept both children entertained and busy. It took my granddaughter a little while to acclimate, but in no time, she was running around, laughing and playing! For this outing, I was specifically looking for a toddler-friendly space, ensuring she could have fun without the risk of being trampled by bigger kids. Eve's Garden perfectly fit the bill, and it was an added bonus that my son also had a great time. The music was amazing, and although we didn't partake because we had just eaten, I saw that they had a variety of snacks and drinks for purchase.

I've already recommended Eve's Garden to a dozen friends and family and can't wait to visit again when my granddaughter is back in town. The experience, staff, cleanliness and overall atmosphere were all top-notch. 10 out of 10!
